666586349.name: Beach is brown with untreated sewage from Tijuana
666586349.author: a TripAdvisor user
666586349.reviewBody:
Tijuana and Imperial beaches have the Tijuana river carrying untreated sewage into the ocean. Tijuana often dumps its fresh sewage into this river. The beaches are brown with you know what, some of the worst beaches in the world. It's very risky to swim in that water. Cruise ship passengers have been known to contract hepatitis swimming the Ensenada bay. 

If you ever walk near the Tijuana river you will be shocked how bad it smells.  Almost all beach towns in Mexico dump untreated sewage straight into the ocean, Tijuana, Rosaritas, Ensenada, Puerta Vallarta, Acapulco ect. Cancun dumps its sewage in the Nizupte lagoon.  Just stay on the beaches East side of the hotel zone and avoid swimming near the lagoon's openings on the North and South sides.

Further South, before reaching Ensenada, there are a few nice, clean pristine beaches with very few people, only a few bars and trinket shops, worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

664112941.name: Authentic Mexican Beach . .  Families, Lovers, Friends . . Warm and Happy.
664112941.author: a TripAdvisor user
664112941.reviewBody:
My dental work in TJ required several days. So, this time, I opted to stay at the very convenient taxi ride destination of Playas de Tijuana, rather than the tourist spot of Rosarito. It's a blue collar area with all of the happy 1950's sense of openness and innocent fun that implies. Non-pushy vendors on the beach and boardwalk with their offerings of skewers of grilled shrimp or superb helados and so much more. Dozens of seafood cafes, with balconies and decks overlooking the beach. Amazing quality. I arrived as they prepared for Spring Break and the start of the beach season. Life guard stands were opened, cleaned and painted.. Walls and stairs were cleaned and painted . . The entire place came alive. Speeches given. People cheered. Lifesaving demonstrations were given. Happy . . All was good . . 

This is the only place I've ever seen with more music than the cantina at Tlaquepaque (Guadalajara). Actually, most of it was awful and making up in quantity what they lacked in quality. But, starting in the morning, you'll see tuba, guitars, drums . . and more. When was the last tme you saw a band like that walking along the surf, looking for a place to start? Some of the bands, though, were truly good. Most importantly, though, was the sheer joy of it all . . , even with the occasional "blaats". LOL

My regret? That I didn't have another two months to stay and sample each and every cafe while listenin to the surf and watching the sun set over the distant islands.

647689434.reviewBody: With all the wallatic insanity in the world I thought taking the kids out of school for a field trip to the wall was a worthwhile educational experience and it was. The kids tried to stick their fingers through the fence to no avail. They stood with a foot on US soil and a foot on Mexican.They noted the decorated Mexico and the illegal to decorate USA side. One of the 11 year old\'s walked down with is hand on the wall shaking his head and saying "there\'s got to be a better way than this. Can\'t we use technology." Just standing there watching a wall end in the ocean gives you a perspective about the efficacy of a wall. Peace to all:) I think it\'s a great family experience and leads to insightful conversation.

We had been away from the vehicle about half an hour. When we returned we found it had been vandalized.  The rear left passenger door window had been shattered the rear seat rest pulled forward and our personal belongings stolen from the trunk.  Of course,  being panicked we called the local police, via \u201c911\u201d which was useless.  When \u201cPolic\u00eda Municipal\u201d showed up, the Officer took a look at the damage and said there was nothing they could do. Our passports and credit cards were among the items stolen. It was a horrific experience.  We will NEVER visit there again!!!  Those who visit BEWARE!!!

618023405.name: We finally went to the beach in TJ
618023405.author: a TripAdvisor user
618023405.reviewBody:
Since we live in Tijuana, you'd think we'd be at the beach a lot. Well, Tijuana is huge by mileage standards and stretches from the Pacific Ocean to almost Tecate. We share this city with 1,800,000 people. 
It takes quite awhile to get over there, and is usually packed in the summer. This one day in August (2018) was pretty calm as far as tourists and locals go. 

We had a beer and snack at a restaurant then went to walk on the beach. We ran into a good friend of ours, Johnny, who we knew when he was working on the beach in Puerto Vallarta. He was BBQ ing seasoned shrimp on sticks. They were delicious and very reasonable in cost (compared to what it would cost on the other side of the ugly wall that separates Mexico from the US.) 

The sand is fine and, for the most part, clean. There are shops and restaurants lining the street above the beach. 

It's worth it to go for a laid back day.
See if you can find our friend "Johnny" and get some good shrimp to go with your cold Corona. Tell him his Vallarta friends say "hi".

617503657.name: Teen and Toddler
617503657.author: a TripAdvisor user
617503657.reviewBody: We visited Playas de Tijuana because of the food. We don\u2019t go to the beach (it\u2019s cold and its full of people) it isn\u2019t a beautiful beach to gather around. Lot of noise. But if you would like to go I recommend to park in La Monumental (bull fight ring). The view in the afternoon is beautiful and you can take lots of pictures there with the light house and all the hearts (art) that are there in the pier. Yoa can eat sea food, coconut with shrimp (I recommend the ones near the light house). You can also buy corn tamales there in the ave pacifico street. And drink some aguas frescas at la Muchoaca at the corner in front of the arches. In Playas there are lots of coffee shops. We like to enjoy the B coffee my teen daughter likes it and my baby can walk around. We fill safe because there is only one door. We also love the birria Javier near ave Playas and La perla. Were the big big Oxxo is. The meat is clean ad my baby can eat. My teen loves the quesadillas. For 3.80 dlls you can get a huge quesadilla with meat. The service is excellent. At the ave Ensenada just in front of the Catholic Church there are \u201cMariscos Ensenada\u201d where you are going to eat the best chilli shrimp tacos. They have a variety of sea food to select . The service is excellent and don\u2019t forget to ask for \u201cagua the orchata\u201d from the tortas. In that same corner you can eat meat tortas at the Washmobile place. They are great. For dessert there are the \u201cnieves de garrafa\u201d near the baseball fields. Near ave Playas. They are delicious and they have a lot of different flavors. If you are looking to sit at a restaurant and it a big breakfast american-mexican Style and not to expensive. I recommend \u201cCasa Don Juan\u201d or \u201c Layhoos Caf\u00e9\u201d at ave Pedregal. If you would like to visit a place rather than the beach you can go to \u201cCasa de la Cultura\u201d  at Ave Agua and paseo Pedregal. There are some expos and big murals outside. You can take good pictures. Expect delay when going in and out of Playas some weekends some time there are concerts and a lot of people attend them. For hotel I recommend the one that is entering Playas just at your right. Has parking and pool. Hacienda del Mar I think is called.  Well that is is. Enjoy

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

617425737.name: Amazing deal
617425737.author: a TripAdvisor user
617425737.reviewBody:
I decided to write a review because I just saw someone make a comment about sewage and homeless people.  I'm not sure where he is getting that because I've been in Playas for a week and so far I have seen zero sewage or homeless people.  Literally zero.  It's a start contrast to the homeless situation at many San Diego beaches. I do believe the water may be somewhat polluted depending on the day, so I don't go in but plenty of Mexicans do because it doesn't actually smell bad or anything.

The other day I had a somewhat upscale dinner at the Sunset Lounge which had an amazing view of the ocean and it cost $7.

I just got an apartment on the third floor right on the beach, huge windows, perfect view of the coast and San Dieto and it is also an amazing deal.  It's hundreds of dollars less than my crappy old apartment in El Cajon.

I'm actually wondering if people are making up bad things to say about Playas because they don't want more tourists to come here raising prices.  So maybe I should lie too.  Yeah, the stink is horrible and the beggars will bite your leg off. Lol.

583882928.name: Wonderful relaxing 3 day stay
583882928.author: a TripAdvisor user
583882928.reviewBody: Lots of great little restaurants scattered all over. A safe area tourists to walk day or night. Cleanliness was factor that overwhelmed our family - we saw virtually no litter and in three days only one dog faeces left. In comparison to America itself where litter seems to be everywhere as is dog faeces. The Mexicans were all very helpful despite our poor knowledge of Spanish and other customers in restaurants would always assist if we looked to be in trouble understanding.  We walked the  3 miles along the beach to the border each day and the beach was practically deserted at all times. There were homeless people but none bothered us at all.\nThe hardest part was crossing back in the USA at the end of our stay as the lines are incredibly long. However a lot of the people trying to see wares were also cooking and selling food and if you wanted more they would go get you whatever you wanted. Despite being so many vendors at no time were they pushy or aggressive all we had to do is to wave our hand and say no thanks and off they went.\nTijuana itself is a drive away and we took an Uber we were so surprised as we had not been there for probably 10 years and  it  has changed and is now a good safe place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

572526332.name: Great time in Playas!
572526332.author: a TripAdvisor user
572526332.reviewBody: Went down to visit a friend and had a wonderful stay. We walked the beach each morning and evening, ate delicious local food, and strolled the streets. There are so many health conscious choices for eating, it\u2019s wonderful! My friend is receiving alternative cancer treatment at a clinic in Playas. We went each day for a lunch with her and there was no limit to the choices for food. I stayed in a B&B only 2 blocks from the beach, Oui Madame. The hosts were amazing, breakfasts were delicious and healthy! It was so fun interacting with the other guests, the owners, and the house cat! Highly recommend Playas for a different take on Mexico. As two American women, we felt very safe although we didn\u2019t venture out after sunset because of warnings from others unless we were with a male. Beautiful city filled with lovely and kind people!

536032807.name: It is an old-school approach with a new twist.
536032807.author: a TripAdvisor user
536032807.reviewBody:
This isn't the United States, but there is a continual shower for bathers/swimmers that runs under the concrete walkway to the beach. I have watched swimmers swim around the border fence and sunbathe on the seashore at Border Field Beach California. (It is dangerous due to the rip tides that can tow you out to sea before you can bat an eyelash). 

The beach, if nothing else, is fairly clean (the restaurants and beachfront motels keep them that way for obvious reasons). I love Tijuana beach as well as those twelve miles to the south in Rosarito.

It is wise to "keep it civil" while at Playa Tijuana, The police will be more than willing to jail you for misbehavior. It is not worth the fines and/or jail time to act the part of the "ugly American". Be smart and enjoy yourself. Look up the better local restaurants and have a great time.

535464512.name: Puente Corazon y Mar at Puente La Joya
535464512.author: a TripAdvisor user
535464512.reviewBody: I am rating this  place a five dot based on my timing when these photos were taken;on a Saturday September 9th between 6:45-7pm. I know for a fact that these images will never be repeated. Since they were obviously made manifest by the Almighty Creator. It is interesting to note that this park was  a multi-art endeavor between the American,Chinese,Mexican and Russian countries and their students as noted on the monument at the site.These photos are split between a nearly one week period,; the darker hues are from the following week between 7pm-7:30pm If you look closely you can see the lights on the Coronado Islands on the photos taken on the 14th of September 2017. I wasn\'t the only one there enjoying the view and taking pictures of this incredible phenomenon: Kaylee and Sierra were there too, two beautiful young women on a mission to spread the word of the Creator and share a couple of their experiences with me. Well that being said;enjoy the sight of this sunset,because for it to appear exactly as it did those two different evenings when the photos were taken is highly unlikely. great place for sunset scenes when the weather is permitting.

529990276.name: Great Visit
529990276.author: a TripAdvisor user
529990276.reviewBody: Be prepared to enjoy the view, food and entertainment. Have a time set aside for all the activities that it has to offer.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

529519274.name: Authentic
529519274.author: a TripAdvisor user
529519274.reviewBody: The food was authentic and cheap. The people watching was unlike the resorts in mexico. This place is where the locals go. There were two weddings when we went.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

523526036.name: The wall that proceeds through the ocean
523526036.author: a TripAdvisor user
523526036.reviewBody: My family and I traveled to Playas de Tijuana in June of 2017 where we had an authentic meal with an ocean view. We went during the week so it was pretty dead, no tourists or anything really. The beach looked like an ordinary beach but what was amazing was the how the border wall/fence lead into the ocean.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

520524589.name: Good food that\'s fresh
520524589.author: a TripAdvisor user
520524589.reviewBody: The place was very busy, which is a good indicator that the place was good. Had to wait about 5min to be seated. Staff are friendly. Salad bar has a great variety and the meat, chicken, seafood was cooked really great. Because they are so busy it took a bit longer to get the bill at pay time. A reply good restaurant. Will go again

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

510813240.name: Were the wall ends.
510813240.author: a TripAdvisor user
510813240.reviewBody: Limited activities good sea food, small city with big soul that offers you a moment  to make a reflection of the pain in both sides of the wall.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

505306756.name: Basic beach with limited activities
505306756.author: a TripAdvisor user
505306756.reviewBody: I wasn\'t sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. The beach was clean and reasonably maintained. Many families were out and about on the malecon and at the beach. There were ok food choices but not what I am typically used to for a beach area.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

504840945.name: Beautiful town by the ocean
504840945.author: a TripAdvisor user
504840945.reviewBody: A very nice city to visit. Right along the ocean; you can hear the waves lapping at the shore and feel the cool ocean breezes! A great place to just sit and relax! Interesting shops to visit. Vendors along the streets.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

502478508.name: Short but pleasant visit
502478508.author: a TripAdvisor user
502478508.reviewBody: We were here on a short visit. The weekend we were there it was the festival of the ceviche. So that was very nice. Lots of seafood and lots of micheladas. The beach isn\'t the cleanest. The waves were strong. We didn\'t get in the water. W enjoyed ourselves very much. \n

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

499472423.name: Really fun trip
499472423.author: a TripAdvisor user
499472423.reviewBody: We had so much fun visiting the West Tijuana...the wall was thought inspiring....lots of great food, shopping, fun in the sun!! We will be going back to go further down the coast!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

499398504.name: Unexpectedly nice and enjoyable beach
499398504.author: a TripAdvisor user
499398504.reviewBody: Lots of Mexican families enjoying the sun and surf. We ate at a seafood restaurant overlooking the ocean and thoroughly enjoyed it. The waiter at our restaurant said on weekends the beach is so crowded you can hardly walk, but on the day we were there (Friday) it wasn\'t crowded.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

498271416.name: Just average beach
498271416.author: a TripAdvisor user
498271416.reviewBody: It\'s a cool place to visit and take in the ocean views. Everything very old though and actually more of a historical view of older Mexico. Food is ok and I think mostly trust worthy. Not much for shopping area and not the best for tourist stop unless looking to see older Mexico. Tons of potential if some investors came in and revamped the area. Tons because quite run down. Great people though and awesome service. Beaches are decent too. The place is not a wow beach just average and the people make the beach not the area.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

497553789.name: Great time
497553789.author: a TripAdvisor user
497553789.reviewBody: We had a great time wandering around the malecon, stopping at the shops and restaurants and bars, sitting on the beach. The border wall is a stark reminder of the fences that we build as humans.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

494497346.name: A nice walk with a refreshing feeling by the sea, but good spots for food around too!
494497346.author: a TripAdvisor user
494497346.reviewBody: I lived in Tijuana for 4 years or so, and all I have to say, is that I never got tired of the view, the feeling, walking by the sea is always nice, but playas has a different vibe, always kept coming back whenever I had time to kill or would make myself the time for it. Great place if you want to do some work out, if you want to grab a coffee with a view, some pizza and beer maybe? I recommend aquamarina coffee and horno 320 for pizza and beer, those are at the end near the lifeguards little house. Feeling more fancy? Sunset Lounge, though there I have only gone for dinners, so make sure you check opening times.  If you walk towards other end, where the  usa/mex fence is, there is a little park/path that you can almost always find some kind of new art going on the fence, paintings on the wall, keep walkin all along the fence you will hit another little spot, that for me is a little jewel of playas call yogurth place, great food, good service, doesn\'t have the view of the sea, but you are in for a treat if you like hummingbirds.\nOther good places for food around in playas not by the sea you can look for are Carnitas Ruben, tacos Titos, El molino, El cafe chino Laihos, cafe Ross and argana cafe. \nDont know if they still have it, but I went I think on thursdays or tuesdays to bar Matt for ladies night, good martinis, little chill place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

493550619.name: Beach, culture and food
493550619.author: a TripAdvisor user
493550619.reviewBody: I walked to the beach in about 5 minutes and just people watched. Although the water was reported to be 65 degrees there were people playing in the water. I could see the boarder wall extending out into the ocean. I also went to the wall to see the dolphin sculpture and a monument declaring the Mexican boarder started there. There is also a great light house to take pictures of and a beautiful sign of huge metal letters spelling out Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

486592256.name: Nice beach, fun, yet noisy atmosphere, Run down buildings along beach.
486592256.author: a TripAdvisor user
486592256.reviewBody: I like the beach and from the hill over looking the sand it is a great view.  Yes the area is a bit shabby, ... or rather eclectic?  There are some good restaurants and some interesting places where you would not want to eat.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

484429063.name: Great vibe
484429063.author: a TripAdvisor user
484429063.reviewBody: We stayed here a little over a week in an Airbnb very close to the beach.The place is buzzing especially at weekend,lots of entertainers and food vendors. To get to Centro Tijuana walk a block to the road where Walmart is and hail a local taxi van, carry\'s 12 people and the fare is 15 peco each way.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

483218898.name: More accesable than San Diego beaches.
483218898.author: a TripAdvisor user
483218898.reviewBody: I had been down twice to take my son to the beach in San Diego and nary a parking spot between San Diego and La Jolla. The beaches at Tijuana and Rosarito had reasonably easy parking and great beaches with very few persons on them. Take the extra time and cross the border.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

477366591.name: A great seaside getaway
477366591.author: a TripAdvisor user
477366591.reviewBody: Really enjoyed walking down the melecon from the south to the border fence which extends into the ocean. Many drinks and food possibilities. Especially enjoyed Cafe Aquamarino & Pizza at the beginning of our trek and then cheese and wine at Huerto Orbanico at the end of the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

473699451.name: Funky waterfront community
473699451.author: a TripAdvisor user
473699451.reviewBody: Lots of good people watching on this waterfront walkway. Big Restaurant row overlooking the ocean. The US wall/fence is landscaped and painted with murals.  A big bull fighting ring is used for lots of big public events, concerts and bull fights.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

471339389.name: Playas de Tijuana
471339389.author: a TripAdvisor user
471339389.reviewBody: It is a nice beach area, good to go visit on a nice day, have a taco and look at the sea:). Could be a little cleaner though (the area around the beach).

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

467151780.name: Walking along the boardwalk by the ocean...
467151780.author: a TripAdvisor user
467151780.reviewBody: Playas de Tijuana is a popular place for locals on the weekends and some evenings.  Listen to mariachi music and indulge in the fresh, wonderful tropical fruit and roast corn from stands on the boardwalk.  Walk along the beach, stroll the boardwalk or sit in the bleachers, enjoy the view and people watch.  There are strict health standards for food vendors and we had no stomach problems as a result of eating food from the many food cart vendors and taco stands around town.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

466655567.name: Take a Drive from the Border Down the Coast
466655567.author: a TripAdvisor user
466655567.reviewBody: Worth seeing the Pacific Ocean when the sun is out. You can stop and eat, take a walk, take photos, just enjoy the water, etc.  I got to see whales off shore!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

462601547.name: Interesting
462601547.author: a TripAdvisor user
462601547.reviewBody: It was kind of stinky but very interesting to see the partly finished buildings.  The tide ruined some of them and the others never finish or they will have to start paying taxes.  So interesting to see the border wall that extends into the ocean and learn about the area.  Very pretty.  An Amish community lives down the coast closer to Rosarito.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

457354694.name: Super fun!
457354694.author: a TripAdvisor user
457354694.reviewBody: Playas is awesome! Food is great and the atmosphere is super fun! If you\'re looking for something fancy this isn\'t for u! But if you wanna have a 3dollar michelada listen to Banda and walk around and checking out the beach view and the locals then this is it! Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

454128818.name: Great Place
454128818.author: a TripAdvisor user
454128818.reviewBody: I believe this is one of the most visited places in Tijuana. It features a pretty nice boardwalk overlooking the ocean. The area is full with restaurants and coffee shops. There\'s people running in the mornings and sunsets are goreous at this place. Overlooking a body of water is a very relaxing experience. Doing it with a cup of coffee at this place is great.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

451405479.name: Wall of emotions
451405479.author: a TripAdvisor user
451405479.reviewBody: I went to the beaches at the bordered wall. This area was beautiful with painted murals, sculptures and a community raised garden. Welcome to Tijuana posted in several places. Somewhat political and a very emotional place to visit. Words of encouragement, quotations taken from strong historical figures and beautiful painted pictures can be found on the length of the iron post fence. You can see the controversies, joy and pain that this border fence has invoked on many. The surrounding area has several bars and restaurants that looked like they would be fun- some of which the music carried all the way to the wall.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

451346872.name: If you are in Tijuana a must see
451346872.author: a TripAdvisor user
451346872.reviewBody: If you are in Tijuana a must see. Take a uber or taxi from the main city - if you don\'t want to navigate the public transport etc... Pretty chilled out and relaxing, a very interesting place to be.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

451255635.name: Beautiful and peaceful
451255635.author: a TripAdvisor user
451255635.reviewBody: My favorite thing to do is have a cup of coffee by the beach at night. It is a great and beautiful place to take a walk. There is people at all time of the day, yet not crowded, so it is always pretty safe. There\'s a few shops and restaurants worth checking out.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

448156687.name: Glad we went
448156687.author: a TripAdvisor user
448156687.reviewBody: Heard that there was glass on the beach etc and my wife had a few fears of getting bugged etc but this place was really cool.  We ate at Reubens and  Charlies and the patios are cool beachfront.  Found a couple nice t-shirts for 6$ each. Wanted to go check out Rosarito beach but only had a couple hours.. was extremely warm. Plus 24 degrees but the water was way too cold to go past the ankles.  You could buy beers for 1$ and walk on the sand and costs you 5 pesos to use the bathroom.  Once u walk down about 300 yards away from the USA border fence there are some really neat coffee shops that worked hard with nifty decor.  Make sure to walk along the street side too.  Not one person begged for anything.  Was way classier than I expected.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

445957278.name: Unique
445957278.author: a TripAdvisor user
445957278.reviewBody:
Because of its location next to the US Border Fence and the Pacific Ocean it's worth a look see. Beyond that there are better beaches a few miles south in Rosario Beach. Again, it is unique. 

By the way, go to the US side of the Border Fence for a nice balanced view.

There are special events, e.g. Concerts at the Bull Fighting Ring nearby.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

438859340.name: Beautiful and serene
438859340.author: a TripAdvisor user
438859340.reviewBody: Not a lot of people so it doesn\'t get too crowded. Not as commercial as San Diego and there are plenty of food stands offering cheap seafood.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

437657302.name: Day in playas
437657302.author: a TripAdvisor user
437657302.reviewBody: If you are looking to eat good mexican food on the beach without the drive to Ensanda playas is a great escape.  Not a lot of late night fun but plenty to do during the day.  Plus you can drink on the beach un like san diego.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

433419785.name: Beautifully relaxing
433419785.author: a TripAdvisor user
433419785.reviewBody: Grab a bite to eat and a drink atop overlooking the beach. Best place to take in the scenery. Take a walk along the beach after your meal. Make sure to take a light sweater as it gets a little chilly in the late afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

429352402.name: Yes! Tijuana has a beach.
429352402.author: a TripAdvisor user
429352402.reviewBody:
If you want to visit a beach in Tijuana, you'll also reach the most northwestern part of all of Mexico.
Here you will find the Wall that separates Mexico from the USA with urban some art and poetry included. The weekends are usually packed with locals.
I don't recommend bathing as the waters are not very clean due to run off and sewage spillage. :(
Regardless, it is a place for tourists to visit and see the US from "the other side". You'll also find several small eateries (mostly seafood) and coconut shops where they serve freshly poured coconut water of your chosen coconut and then serve you the coconut meat with chili, lemon juice and salt. It's definetly not the best looking beach in Baja but it's a very significant point of interest. I would say this is a must see place to visit in Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

423001976.name: Great people, fantastic food
423001976.author: a TripAdvisor user
423001976.reviewBody: Stayed in a beach house right on the beach. Sat for hours watching dolphins on the beach and squirrels across the yard. Fantastic fish tacos especially Tacos de Frances

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

418893691.name: Playas de Tijuana
418893691.author: a TripAdvisor user
418893691.reviewBody: The place could be much much better, it is dirty, a lot of people and the places are not very nice they look old I do not recommend this place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

415909289.name: Great boardwalk, a little chaotic, kind of hippie
415909289.author: a TripAdvisor user
415909289.reviewBody:
Love it because you can see walk right up to the border fence that goes into the sea!

There's many unassuming restaurants, bars, and cafes to check out along the board walk and the street that runs parallel (above).

Could e cleaner but it's not that bad actually.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

414352345.name: South of the wall
414352345.author: a TripAdvisor user
414352345.reviewBody:
Amazing Boardwalk along the beach. Funky little cafes and pizza shops overlooking the BW and beach. Family's and kids playing on them both. A couple of tables selling street stuff but only 1 within site now. 
Ice cream vendor walking down the beach. No drunks,homeless people, police, or border jumpers in site. 
I am thinking this is what it's like when things were great before things got commercialized. 
Very middle class and a great way to spend an afternoon relaxing!!!

Most important to me is dog friendly.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

413589474.name: Dirty beach
413589474.author: a TripAdvisor user
413589474.reviewBody: Playas of Tijuana is a place with a full of potential as many people said here, but unfortunately the city didn\u2019t expend a dime on the infrastructure of that part of the city, also there is not a culture of cleanup and the people who enjoy of the beach leave always a mess there.\nThere are a lot of options of food and cafes and the sunset is beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

398208147.name: Getting cleaner...
398208147.author: a TripAdvisor user
398208147.reviewBody: This beach is loaded with potential! I think we could bring tourists in by the truckload if we could just get it a bit more cleaned up! For surf, give it a 2-star rating (unless you like closed-out shore-breakers!), but for beautiful sunsets, give it a 6-star!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

397662734.name: A great place the linger
397662734.author: a TripAdvisor user
397662734.reviewBody: I live in Playas .. about 5mins from  the beach... Full of coffee places that are individualistic, romantic, eclectic and somewhat bohemian .. what ever that means ,,, Sit , sip and chat .. a GREAT place to be.... HOWEVER ,, can be very populated on the weekend .... much better in the morning of a tranquil walk and quiet coffee .. read a book or chat with a friend

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

397369551.name: Excellent place to walk, to drink a cup of coffee, to eat!
397369551.author: a TripAdvisor user
397369551.reviewBody: Playas de Tijuana has a very nice spirit of hospitality, you can walk on the sidewalks, on the "malec\u00f3n", have a very good cup of coffee, eat a very good taste pizza cooked in a stone oven by a chef, the color of its waters is very nice blue and green, and the sunsets are really innimaginable, very good place to visit!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

396292748.name: tourism
396292748.author: a TripAdvisor user
396292748.reviewBody: i love tijuana has a lot culture, a lot things to do and great food, is safe, i  move with uber and you can pay cash or with your card in your account

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

396003704.name: Loud, dirty and tacky
396003704.author: a TripAdvisor user
396003704.reviewBody:
You'd expect that the farthest part of Latin America would be taken more care of... WOW!... it's not. 

The place is jam packed with tacky sea food restaurants and dirty coconut vendors playing EXTREMELY LOUD drug-trafficker music (live and not). The sand is stricken with garbage all the way from dirty diapers, food wrappings and plastic bags. You can even see rats the size of rabbits. Not a pretty sight. The beach buildings give a sense of a war torn city.

The people are friendly, but the ambiance by those visiting is horrid.

Let me add that there's a sewage plant right in front of the park with such a low wall that you can see the excrement floating there. Not nice at all.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

391919335.name: Lovely location by the sea and the divising border wall.
391919335.author: a TripAdvisor user
391919335.reviewBody: The Playa de Tijuana is a pleasant place, where families lounge on the beach and eat lunch or are entertained by live musicians. Along the boardwalk cafes and food vendors supply the best food at ridiculously low prices. It\'s how the beach should be.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

388794555.name: Pretty beach and one of the few beaches in Mexico with lifeguards
388794555.author: a TripAdvisor user
388794555.reviewBody: Pretty beach with clean water and one of the few beaches in Mexico that has lifeguards (from what I can tell).  There\'s a restaurant there that has really good Marlin Tacos.   I forget what the restaurant is called though.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

384028513.name: Signs of a come back. Great food selections with ocean vistas.
384028513.author: a TripAdvisor user
384028513.reviewBody: I\'ve come to enjoy visiting Playas because of the great seafood restaurants, ocean vistas, micheladas, and best of all it\'s close to the border. You no longer have to travel to Rosarito or Ensenada to get great affordable seafood. Visit las playas after partying in TJ and you\'ll find the best place for food and R&R before crossing the border back to California.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

382893437.name: Above average in many ways.
382893437.author: a TripAdvisor user
382893437.reviewBody: Playas de Tijuana is a nice community for many years. It is established. I wouldn\'t say it\'s for Tourists. Primarily because the citizens there don\'t need to rely on tourism. So you won\'t see trinkets and vendors lining the streets like Tijuana proper. Playas de Tijuana has been able to adjust to the modern world while keeping the mexican culture Thriving with Art and Music. The Only downside is traffic. So take your time! Most importantly stop by the cultural center also known as SECUT. IT is what I think cities worldwide should be: Artists and Musicians together in one great space!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

369982313.name: El Molino
369982313.author: a TripAdvisor user
369982313.reviewBody: Great upscale restaurant. Food was awesome the flavor of the food was to die for. The bartender made sure our beer was ice cold, I left a $15 dollar tip, I just hope the waitress shared it\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

369541505.name: Enjoying the beach
369541505.author: a TripAdvisor user
369541505.reviewBody: Nice board walk semi clean love the vending.  nice windy weather parking is a hassle but after that enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

367956865.name: a hidden gem, in TJ
367956865.author: a TripAdvisor user
367956865.reviewBody: Don\'t know if most travelers get a chance to go to the beach in Tijuana, but its a really nice area.  I have been going there on and off over the last 20 years and I can say it\'s quiet, peaceful and there are great food and decent places to stay without going broke.  I recently had some tacos at "tacos Polo" which is on the main feeder road into Playas de Tijuana, across from Wal Mart and it was awesome, handmade tortillas, meat so fresh and flavorful and the tostadas were to die for... dinner for me and the wife, $11 - the food was soooo good.  Highly recommend, you\'d never even know it was there until you get off the Baja "pch" highway

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

367511663.name: Excellent dinner next to the beach!!
367511663.author: a TripAdvisor user
367511663.reviewBody: Amazing dinner at Horno 360 with my family, pizza gourmet with sea food is delicious!, good variety of wines and beer. Love it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

366118969.name: To remember that you on a visit and to behave as guests
366118969.author: a TripAdvisor user
366118969.reviewBody: On the crosswalk, have crossed border of the USA-Mexico. We with the son had the visa of the USA therefore have received the Mexican visa without problems. Having gone down from the bridge have seen a number of yellow taxi, but have got on a bus. For a small payment of the American coins have reached yes avenida Revolucion. It is a lot of shops with various souvenirs. In the cross small street butcher and fish shops. My son has defined very valuable marbled beef at once. Have passed to the national museum, have taken a walk around. Several hours of stay in Tijuana have given a certain impression of Mexico. Fears that there is terrible, is only fears. Usual precautionary measures are quite sufficient. Generally people friendly, hospitable. It is only necessary to remember that you on a visit and to behave as guests. The rest in photos.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

363972085.name: Playas!
363972085.author: a TripAdvisor user
363972085.reviewBody:
Playas! 
My Home away from Home and my Home too!
This Peaceful Beach Community has been a gem in my life since the early 1980's.
The new Malecon, Or Boardwalk is a made of sturdy hard wood with rails and takes you right up to the U.S. Border fence and boundaries to the bluffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean and the Coronado Islands. The new Monumental Plaza has weekend entertainment and is a gathering place for local artists. The near by Restaurants are worth the try, El Ruedo a BBQ/ Steakhouse serves Breakfast, Lunch, And Dinner. For Tacos I highly recommend Tacos El Frances! Seasoned Beef cooked over Mesquite, fresh ingredients and hand made tortillas!
Simply the Best...

275172664.name: The Beach!
275172664.author: a TripAdvisor user
275172664.reviewBody:
A brilliant way to get away from the noise and grime of the city proper, Playas is... the playas! 

Nice sandy stretch with cafes on the boardwalk and food places up on the main street (one has a pirate ship-looking terrace that you can see from the beach that does huge fantastic fish and shrimp tacos at a good price and a big barbequed fish platter. I heartily recommend this place!) 

A perfect place to sit and enjoy the sun. You can often see dolphins jumping in the ocean as you soak up the rays...

Sometimes at Parque Mexico there is an art and craft fair which can be doubled with the beach for a very pleasant weekend! The only downside to playas is the somewhat ugly fence that runs into the sea that separates Mexico from the U.S.

269765105.name: Great for short visits
269765105.author: a TripAdvisor user
269765105.reviewBody: I always love visiting here. Its the easiest way to get a taste of authentic Mexico without the hassle of traveling deep into the country\'s interior. It\'s certainly a cultural experience being separated from another world by only a thin fence. This is probably one of the safest parts of Tijuana. I never feel as though it\'s lacking safety. Great food, drinks and music. Everything is extremely inexpensive here. Churros and Cocos Frios are great. Fresh seafood is all over. Nice cafes. This place always has something going on. Sometimes, however, things can get a little annoying. Parking can be tight, public bathrooms are not so public anymore as large men stand outside insisting you pay .50 cents or go somewhere else (I\'m sure this is unofficial), and more of the vendors are asking for pesos now where they didn\'t before, so exchanging a little money first might be a good idea. You also can\'t (shouldn\'t) swim here. The beach is fine for sunning, but enter the contaminated water at your own risk. It\'s a great place to spend a few hours and take in some sun and scenery, and food and music, but I\'d only spend a few hours here rather than an entire week or weekend. For longer trips, Rosarito is a better choice.

262483610.name: HOME SWEET HOME
262483610.author: a TripAdvisor user
262483610.reviewBody:
I want to make clear, this review may be a little biased, as Playas de Tijuana is my home town.  I grew up and got married here.  It's basically a suburb that happens to be the Northwest corner of Mexico.  Pacific ocean to the West, US (San Diego) to the North, mountains to the East, and more beach to the South. Find a place to seat alongside the boardwalk and watch dolphins, seals, cruiseships go by, and if it's the right time of year, you may even see a whale or two go by.
Everytime I go visit, I am always so glad to be in Playas, it is quiet, peaceful and just nice!  Oddly enough, most of us who grew up there, rarely ever actually go IN the water (unless you like surfing, etc.) Most people on the beach are probably not Playas residents. We do enjoy walking on the boardwalk, coffee, a coconut or cool drink off many of the locally owned coffee shops and snack bars.  
Nowadays, Playas has a mall, movie theater, many restaurants both locally owned as well as chain American restaurants.  It's a suburb so don't expect the ruckus you'd expect in the more tourist areas, don't expect endless bars or people trying to sell you blankets, piggy banks and other crap you see alongside the border or downtown areas.  This is a residential area, with good schools, working middle and upper middle class neighborhoods. My family has been living there for generations. It's grown a LOT in the last 15 years or so, but it still has a lot of charm I often took for granted when I lived there.  Whenever we're in town, my kids (who don't live here) are always in awe of just about everything, from the fantastic weather almost year round, the quiet living, helping my mom in the garden and gathering fruit from the trees to make fresh lemonade or baking a cake or pie.
Enjoy healthy dining at the Yogurt Place (b-fast, lunch and dinner), stop for hand-crafted coffee at Cafe Latitud 32 (you would need to go down to the boardwalk to find it), if you lucky  you can see a live band playing. A MUST is tacos from EL FRANCES... opened at night, they use the best cuts of meats, fresh home made tortillas and all the delicious fix-ins. THIS IS what "street tacos" are all about.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

260946035.name: The Lovely Mexican Beach Next Door
260946035.author: a TripAdvisor user
260946035.reviewBody:
Playas de Tijuana is situated within swimming distance to Imperial Beach in the United States.  As a matter of fact, I saw the concrete and steel partition separating the Tijuana beach from Imperial beach quite easily when I first visited Playas.  

The ocean was just as blue as it is in Imperial Beach, and the waves lapped on the shores in a soothing, repetitive rhythm.  When I went, there was a festival at the beach.  A stage was set up right in the middle of it, a steel skeletal structure complete with giant speakers and stage lights.  Local Mexican music was playing loudly in the background, and the beach goers, clad with thongs, bikinis, sunglasses and hats, swayed to the music, laughing and sipping Tecate.  Children were hurling themselves gleefully onto the crashing blue water, seemingly oblivious to the occasional wave that loomed over the surface.  

Next to the beach up the sloping rise are homes, shops and apartments lined up alongside the beach.  They were not as shiny and new as the ones in Imperial Beach; the buildings had a age worn look about them.  But there were flowers and plants everywhere, and Spanish architecture was all over the place.  It was definitely Mexico.

When I climbed up one of the steep concrete stairways leading to the main street, I saw rows and rows of coconut vendors.  Patient Mexican men and women in the various booths had piles of fresh green coconut behind them.  I ordered one, and the nice gentleman who served me cut the top of one of the coconuts with his sharp machete, exposing the white tender meat without opening it.  He scooped the coconut meat loose and kept it inside the husk.  He mixed the meat with chile powder, Tejuina, limon and salt.  It was delicious.  I ate my coconut treat slowly as I surveyed the Tijuana beach street.

There were many Americans there, and they all seemed content to savor the atmosphere and occasionally talked to other Americans.  Mainly they sat on the many shop tables located outside, eyes half closed.  It was warm and the breeze was cooling and pleasant.  I didn't feel inclined to talk either, just experience the scene.

I can only describe Mexico as relaxed and friendly.  Nobody seemed to be in a hurry.  Even the local vendors seemed indifferent to the many hours they endured sitting in their booths, waiting for customers.  They occupied their time watching over their many children, who they carried around proudly in their arms or playfully chide when they got out of hand.  The local people laughed, played and loved each other.  

People were more inclined to speak Spanish even though many could speak English.  I talked to a local American woman who just moved there.  She was able to live comfortably in a rented one bedroom apartment close to the beach with her modest retirement income.  She could even get phone signal from the U.S. where she lived.  When I asked her if she missed the U.S., she said, "I visit there, but my life is much better here."  I believe her.

I consider Playas de Tijuana as an affordable paradise, not a posh retreat.  It's a nice place to sip, consider and just be.  I've been in more affluent beach communities, but in my humble opinion, it might as well be. The beauty is in the people, the atmosphere and the lifestyle.  The only thing I will say is...you have to be there to feel it.

For an upscale place for lunch, dinner, or just wine and dessert, with a wonderful view, try the Sunset Lounge Playas.

Playas is not known for throngs of women clad in skinny bikinis and muscular men playing beach volleyball.  On an average day, it would be surprising to see more than 10 people on the 2 mile stretch of beach.  At night this beach is to be avoided at all costs as it is quite dangerous!

There are a couple of good seafood restaurants, but not much else to see if you come to Playas.  Most people just come to hang out on the street above the beach on the weekends making traffic a nightmare in this area.  

I would not come to Playas for a day at the beach, head south to Rosarito or take your pick of any of the San Diego beaches

248514018.name: Beaches in Rosarito - average place in winter
248514018.author: a TripAdvisor user
248514018.reviewBody:
I grew up in a coastal state in India where Beaches were not a new thing. When I moved to San Diego, Beaches remained part of my life. Heard that there are lot of attractions, sport activities to do in Rosarito beach. But unfortunately we crossed the border in winter and the playas were kinda deserted except the actual Rosarito beach. 

Beaches are definitely not an attraction in winter. But happened to be in Tijuana in 2014 December and thought of going to this beach. The beach just had horse riding and few street vendors selling various food items, bracelets and necklaces. We tried spicy dried mango for 20 pesos and it was yummy. We could bargain with the horsemen as it wasnt the season. 8USD was for 1 horse for a kid. 
The restaurants were lousy as well with very less people. Still there was loud music and people having drinnks on the beach. But heard that in summer this place would just be overcrowded. 
Visited Papas Beer restaurant on the beach and the food there was really yummy. Tried Veg Fajitas and freshly prepared hot tortillas. That was the best tortillas I ever had...
Overall experience was good. Looking forward to visit during summer again...

Later walked along the beach and had fresh coconut water and of course the coconut meat with chili and lime :) As a Canadian I felt safe and loved relaxing in Playas

226520679.reviewBody: A strange yet wonderful place where the derelict and dirty mashes up against the new & gentrified. Lots of trash on the beach, Lots of crumbling businesses and houses, but plenty of shiny new places with wifi too. Probably the most interesting part of Playas is the fact that you can walk up to the international border between Mexico and the US where it meets the Pacific Ocean. On the other side of the fence is "friendship park". The fence is much like bars of a jail cell. It\'s possible to reach through and hug a person on the other side. Good graffiti pieces on the street and cool art scene.

You can walk all the way up to the border fence and look into the US as well. The US beach is desolate with only Border Patrol. The Mexico side is packed when its warm.

Lots of parking lots along the beach boulevard for about $50 pesos a day (less than $5 US).  Not touristy like Rosarito.

171256825.name: Best place in Tijuana to live
171256825.author: a TripAdvisor user
171256825.reviewBody:
Hello. I came to live to Playas some years ago and I loved it. Of course, it's not Cancun, La Paz or another beautiful beach in the country, but it's the best place to live in Baja and very near the border. 
Playas de Tijuana is a small community with nice ocean views, maybe the last place in Tijuana where you can walk far away from noise, traffic and big malls. We have good quality banks, movie theaters, coffee shops and other local business. 

If you are thinking about living in Tijuana, close to the border, in a healty environment, and with nice views , Playas will be in your top 3. 

It's not the beach from the beer adds with cristaline water and good looking california people around, but it's full of small coffee shops, some crazy foreign artist ;), photographers, people walking their dogs, local families walking, and of course, surfers. 

Remember Baja is Wild, Tijuana is the most visited city in the world (because it's border with California,) but Playas, can be like being in Tijuana being a little bit out of the city,. 

Hope this info is helpful

158441481.name: Hey, remember you are in Mexico!
158441481.author: a TripAdvisor user
158441481.reviewBody: Tijuana de Playas is the beachfront neighborhood of Tijuana. This is not really a tourist area, although visitors are definitely welcome!  Most Americans gravitate towards the downtown area of TJ (Ave. Revolution) or Rosarito, although there are nice eating establishments on the bluff overlooking the beach.  The majority of of people you will meet in this area are local residents, and the restaurants and shops cater to residents. Therefore, restaurants do not generally offer cheap lobster dinners but do have a nice modestly priced dinners and appetizers that cater to local tastes.  Shrimp cocktails, fish tacos, and various seafood concoctions are the local fare, with local Nortena bands for entertainment and buckets of cervesas the primary draw.  The beach is nice, but is very crowded with locals on most days. This is a place to visit only if you are interested in experiencing the locals scene.  Every restaurant has at least one English-speaking waiter, but remember tourists as primarily a secondary market here.  It is safe, fun, and a good place to go if you are interested in a more "locals" scene.  The beach boardwalk is a nice addition, and the food/drink prices are better than what will be found in the downtown area.  Bottom line, remember you are in Mexico, sharing the local culture with local residents.  Do not expect anything more, and you will have a great time!

116768322.name: The beach where the border fence goes into the Pacific Ocean
116768322.author: a TripAdvisor user
116768322.reviewBody: It is  interesting to just go to the Playas de Tijuana (Tijuana Beach) to sit in the sand, drink beer, people watch, and possibly even swim. It is even more of an attraction if you are interested in border issues and in seeing where the border fence separating Mexico and the US goes into the Pacific Ocean. As of 2011 the city of TJ has put in an attractive observation deck , with public pay restrooms right next to the border and friendship park which when/if it reopens will allow persons on either side of the border to interact with persons on the other side. .The city has also built an attractive entryway with arches at the main entrance to the beach about 1 block south from the observation deck. From the arch there is an amphitheater with stone steps leading down to the water, a two way raised wooden boardwalk that goes for at least a kilometer, and lifeguard towers. If you go on a warm summer day especially on a Sunday you will see many families from Tijuana and surrounding areas enjoying the wide sandy beach. If you walk down the boardwalk you ca see some public art on the walls of buildings, stop at one of sever small coffee shops, or just take in the scenery. There are also modest restaurants mostly serving seafood above the boardwalk. If you like ice cream a store across the street  from the arches provides a good selection of the Mexican ice cream bars called paletas along with drinks and snacks. The big stadium structure you see is the Bullring By the Sea (Plaza Monumental is official name) which has bullfights during the summer and has hosted many concert by groups such as Pitbull, Mana, and Santana. Even though the beach is located right on the border it has a  feel of  being more authentic \u201cMexican\u201d and not catering to nearly as much to foreign tourists as the Tijuana\u2019s Revolution Ave and Rosarito Beach about 20 minutes south..  In general from the perspective of many tourists the area is underdeveloped and there are some old or unfinished buildings that seem out of place especially when they have great views and are right by the water.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Ensenada porque me sur # 1023 frente la Iglesias esteia del mar plays Tijuna

606484034.name: IS THE BEST SHOPPING MALL !!
606484034.author: a TripAdvisor user
606484034.reviewBody: You can find anythink in this mall !! Plus they have theatres . VIP..!! They have wine , coffe , martinis , . Sushi, and more !!

601860042.name: Forget Avernida Revolucion.  Come to Plaza Rio instead if you\'d like to see where locals go.
601860042.author: a TripAdvisor user
601860042.reviewBody:
Unless you like freak show, then go to Avenida Revolucion.  Once we cross the border, we headed to Avenida Revolucion just to do tourist thing.  I didn't feel safe at all with little kids so I just kept on driving.  
Plaza Rio on the other hand is where the locals go.  Avenida Revolucion is a theme park for gringos to see what "Mexico" ought to look like.  

Our main reason for visiting was for Mini City (recommend for elementary school kids).  We ate at Furasshu (Japanese Teppanyaki place).  We felt completely safe while walking around here.  We wish our kids weren't as tired from Mini City so we could explore more stores.  There are candy shops, arcade, movie theater, department store, restaurants, food court, super market, and so on.  A lot of people were out on date.  Many more family outings.  There are securities around.  I brought my car over the border.  It was right where I left it, not a scratch on it.  There were tons of other California license plates which gave me a piece of mind.  I arrived here bit before noon on Saturday and there were tons of parking.  We left around 6 and lot was full with people driving around looking for a spot.  Parking isn't validated from what I understand.  It charges by minute with something like 12 hour parking fee of 100 pesos (about 5 bucks).  BUT, it doesn't take USD and it doesn't have a credit card slot.  So make sure you have some peso.  There were performers doing Aztec dance and Mexican dance in center stage area with many people watching.  This mall it outdoor so it may not be the best place to roam around on a rainy day.

There's also Tijuana Cultural Center (CECUT) right across the street.

588704526.name: Look for the foodgarden
588704526.author: a TripAdvisor user
588704526.reviewBody: La plaza Rio is a big plaza with regular stores but you can find the food garden have a lot nice food the price is really chip the place are a kind of hipster but nice. You can also buy a beer.\n\nThe only thing that i dont like is a big parking and almos all the time full.

588674005.name: Shop in security!!
588674005.author: a TripAdvisor user
588674005.reviewBody: A great place to peruse and grab a coffee... its like a strip mall... if its raining...unlikely ..but then this would not be good .. Has a great movie theatre and plenty spend your money on in. both things and food... Always a Starbucks!!! \nGood for the family to amble through and you don\'t have to be so worried about whats sticking out your pockets to be grabbed. Its safe and has a good police presence!!

573997563.name: Great Place to wonder around
573997563.author: a TripAdvisor user
573997563.reviewBody: Had everything that you may need from a store similar to Walmart, low - high end shopping, Cineplex, Starbucks, Mexican Rest., Burger King.  Safe, clean and great entertainment.

570835362.name: A little bit of everything
570835362.author: a TripAdvisor user
570835362.reviewBody: This is a very nice plaza and has stores for just about anybody. The stores range from affordable prices to high end. Good selection of restaurant choices.They have good entertainment as well, such as, a movie theater and a play place for kids and teens. It is located near the border and close to other places to visit such as bars across the street for a good night life and the Cecut, which included an IMAX-like theater, museums, and an aquarium. Definitely recommended for first time visitors and return visitors.

548513137.name: Safe place to Shop
548513137.author: a TripAdvisor user
548513137.reviewBody: Mall was a standard type mall with some amazing department\\grocery stores. We had a great time just walking around and shopping. Would love to return.

499264943.name: Nice mall great Cinema
499264943.author: a TripAdvisor user
499264943.reviewBody: Decent shopping good prices, clean safe and very good cinemas VIP option too. Very good overall mall, especially for Tijuana. Been there many times. 1/3 the cost than San Diego. Etc

496490554.name: a big mall
496490554.author: a TripAdvisor user
496490554.reviewBody:
this is a very big mall
with lots of shops around, restaurants, travelling agency, banks, Cinema, etc....
a nice place to kill sometimes, get some good food, watch a movie or just relaxing....
here also have a ground for some show for the performers in the weekend...

477524543.name: Plaza Rio
477524543.author: a TripAdvisor user
477524543.reviewBody: Mac Cosmetics, McDonalds, Burger King and different little shops. There\'s a store similar to Walmart if forgot anything they have it.

436350724.name: A lot of the same
436350724.author: a TripAdvisor user
436350724.reviewBody: Nothing out of the ordinary. Restaurants and clothing stores all around. They have a movie theater and some american restaurants. Nothing too fancy but it is good for a Sunday with the family or just to kill time any day of the wk.

409440597.name: Largest Mall in TJ
409440597.author: a TripAdvisor user
409440597.reviewBody: Just across the border in the RIO area is the RIO  MALL. Paid parking. All kinds of business. .from drug stores to movie theaters. Travel agencies to jewelry stores. Best mall in town. Very large market and more. Good opportunity to see all kinds of products and goods that are not tourist trinkets.

406667629.name: Love this mall!!
406667629.author: a TripAdvisor user
406667629.reviewBody: If you go to TJ, you gotta visit Plaza Rio. It\'s within walking distance of the border, if you choose to walk across. They\'ve got great stores and good food. They even have a small Caliente casino. Go to the Cinepolis VIP theatre. The prices are great (cheaper than a regular movie here in San Diego, but in a VIP theatre with lounging leather seats), and they have awesome beer and food. Love this mall.

389942807.name: A mall. A nice, clean, safe mall. A very "American" mall - no local flavor to be found here
389942807.author: a TripAdvisor user
389942807.reviewBody: This is a good place for some shopping - if you are a local. If you are from the U.S., you have seen it all: the same chains, the same stuff, the same looks. A mall in Ohio would not look different. If you are looking for a tourist adventure, go to the local markets instead, only a few steps from the mall is Mercado Hidalgo. There you can be as Mexican as you want to be.

382919770.name: great atmosphere
382919770.author: a TripAdvisor user
382919770.reviewBody: It is a great place to find hidden treasures for a small budget and look at the local fashion companies.

372341103.name: just a big open mall
372341103.author: a TripAdvisor user
372341103.reviewBody: you would come here to kill a bit of time.. didn\'t go into many shops to see the difference in price.. but with it being an open mall, there is no chance to escape the heat of the day.

369880027.name: A day at the mall
369880027.author: a TripAdvisor user
369880027.reviewBody: It\'s a good mall, very similar to US malls. Has plenty of nice shops and boutiques from different prices. You can go to the movies, shop, or have a nice cup of coffee and people-watch.

363994025.name: Plaza Rio!
363994025.author: a TripAdvisor user
363994025.reviewBody: Plaza Rio Tijuana!\nI was just there last week! we stopped in for some buffet action at the California Buffet.

346975127.name: Really Nice Mall in Tijuana
346975127.author: a TripAdvisor user
346975127.reviewBody: I had a tour guide that led me to this mall and I was really impressed. I was really impressed with the Food Court called "Food Garden Plaza".  Not sure if it was the main food court to the mall. But it had alternative food options.  Not your normal food court with chains, but I believe this is a must stop in Tijuana.  I had Mexican Ceviche that was better than any I have had in the USA.  They had craft beer and Mexican fusion dishes in there.  This mall had a nice bard on the outside and your big normal chain stores.  I would suggest stopping here after viewing some of the older historic points in the city.

338595334.name: Mall just like in the USA
338595334.author: a TripAdvisor user
338595334.reviewBody: This mall made me forget that I was in TJ. It\'s a very nice, clean and upscale mall as typical of nice malls in the USA. This mall has shops like Sephora, Apple Store, Starbucks, and a very huge movie theater. I walked around the mall for a while and checked out all the stores. I found mostly nice helpful people working at the stores, most in their 20\'s and thirty\'s.

302011307.name: Great Mall
302011307.author: a TripAdvisor user
302011307.reviewBody: Great shopping mall in downtown Tijuana, and they have both a Cinepolis Movie theater and a Cinepolis VIP Movie Theater. They also have a great food court and you can pretty much find anything you need here.

641325390.name: Great collection for only 50 pesos
641325390.author: a TripAdvisor user
641325390.reviewBody: There was so much to look at.  2nd and 3rd floor filled with masked wrestlers memorabilia.  Real hair shaved from losers head!!!!\ud83e\udd24Original masks and I swear some articles of clothing still had blood on it!!!! Check it out!

617383416.name: 2 thumbs up, a must see in Tijuana
617383416.author: a TripAdvisor user
617383416.reviewBody: The museum is perfect, you are amazed and memorized by all you see. From the cool asortment of collections on the 1st floor to the fantastic Lucia Libre collection/memorabilia on the 2nd floor, and also by the memorabilia of making of the movie El Viento Negro and the construction of the Sonora railroad on the 3rd floor.

614644948.name: For Fans of Luche Libre and Marvel/DC
614644948.author: a TripAdvisor user
614644948.reviewBody: I would highly recommend asking for curator Zaurel Leon for his knowledge regarding Luche Libre and the superheroes collection; he is very knowledgeable with all the sport, superhero figurines and history behind virtually every single piece in this museum. HIs enthusiasm is contagious. \n\nBonus... you can take a picture in their wrestling ring... just be sure to bring your own mask :)

598323821.name: AMAZING PLACE TO BE
598323821.author: a TripAdvisor user
598323821.reviewBody: Unique one and only kind of museum, definitely one spot to explore in the city of Tijuana , one visit isn\'t enough to admire every item collected in there. I love it and Gladly come back.

597392617.name: AWESTRUCK!!!
597392617.author: a TripAdvisor user
597392617.reviewBody: As a Lucha Libre fan I am still awestruck by the amazing collection of everything that I grew up either watching, reading or playing with and to have my family also enjoy the same pasion for Mexican Lucha Libre is awesome...

593564761.name: Awesome family fun!
593564761.author: a TripAdvisor user
593564761.reviewBody: If you want to learn a bit of history on lucha libre you need to go to Mullme, it is the only museum of its kind and the people working behind this project are amazing, fun stories and interesting ones too, and one of the most interesting aspects is the collector culture that has a nostalgic value.\n\ngo have fun guys best experience you can get.

581574483.name: Amazing
581574483.author: a TripAdvisor user
581574483.reviewBody: Not too far from San Diego, this museum was a fun and surprising find on our trip to Tijuana. Joseph was super nice and helpful, showed my sister and I around, and explained some of the collection pieces to us. He also took some great photos of us posing as luchadoras in the ring!

673821845.name: A cultural must!
673821845.author: a TripAdvisor user
673821845.reviewBody: This is a must to visit when you come to Tijuana. No matter if it is week day or weekend, there is always something interesting to do from art gallery, exhibits and conventions to food and crafts festivals you will always have great moments in this cultural center.\nThe place has a nice coffee shop, a theater, a souvenir and books store, an IMAX dome and a bistro restaurante named El Cubo among others.\nI recommend you prior your visit to check the official web page to see the calendar and full activities to enjoy the must your stay.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

670183694.name: Interesting place to spend a couple of hours
670183694.author: a TripAdvisor user
670183694.reviewBody: The spherical structure of the cultural centre is distinct and can be seen from far. Admission is cheap. There are several displays from various periods of the development of the Baja area, but the museum is rather bare and some of the exhibits do not have English explanations. However, it was still rather eye opening. Well maintained. No free wifi here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

666332757.name: Don\'t Miss
666332757.author: a TripAdvisor user
666332757.reviewBody: When visiting Tijuana don\'t miss Cecut. I is an absolutely incredible adventure.  Great exhibits , always something new.  Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

661444283.name: Great outdoor sculptures
661444283.author: a TripAdvisor user
661444283.reviewBody: The cultural center buildings are interesting, although we did not see much of the inside. The outdoor garden is full of historical artefacts/reproductions, like an Olmec head and a Chac Mool.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

653026871.name: Nice visit
653026871.author: a TripAdvisor user
653026871.reviewBody: Place has movie theaters, plays, great place to take a break- has IMAX - very friendly people in the area.  Highly reocmmend

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

646599785.name: Well Worth a Visit
646599785.author: a TripAdvisor user
646599785.reviewBody: Museums may not be everyone\u2019s cup of tea - but see if there are any art shows happening outside. On my last visit they had a great arts and crafts expo. It was a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

646088866.name: Nice Museum, several expositions
646088866.author: a TripAdvisor user
646088866.reviewBody: Several expositions, and Sunday the Museum is free, with many expositions about Baja California history, and National and International art

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

643567886.name: Beautiful and interesting!
643567886.author: a TripAdvisor user
643567886.reviewBody: A great place to visit! My children especially love the imax movies! And we learned a lot from the exhibits. The architecture is also beautiful. Enjoyed it with my family.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

637127758.name: Amazing place!
637127758.author: a TripAdvisor user
637127758.reviewBody: The CECUT was amazing, the week we went they had an artisan fair! The best Mexican artisans were there for that week and it so beautiful! We also went to the theater and watched a short documentary and to the botanical garden! Lots of family fun! We enjoyed it so much! So if you go, don\u2019t forget to check out the weekly activities they are having  and pick up a brochure!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

633730433.name: Awesome learning experience
633730433.author: a TripAdvisor user
633730433.reviewBody: Such a cool museum! We were there on a day where only part of the museum was open, and we were still easily entertained for hours. Great museum with exhibits in English and Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

633276278.name: Nice building - lack of culture
633276278.author: a TripAdvisor user
633276278.reviewBody: Wandering the numerous stalls selling trinkets and other touristy kitsch outside the building, the center seemed far less \'cultural\' and more commerce aimed at gringos. The interior was a vast empty center.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

631353976.name: Interesting events always going on there.
631353976.author: a TripAdvisor user
631353976.reviewBody: The museum is very interesting and there are always good cultural events going on there.  Do not skip the book-souvenir store they have.  Beautiful pices of mexican handcrafts.  And go by the Cubo Bistro, nice place to eat!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

630595092.name: Must-go!
630595092.author: a TripAdvisor user
630595092.reviewBody: First, it is free on sunday, so check it out! There are different exhibitions on three floors from local artists as well as "bigger" names and well worth your time. We went a few days before d\u00eda de muertos and were lucky enough to see an altar for the dead. The building itself is interesting as well and there are even concerts and other events going on. Just a little break from exploring Tijuana in an airconditioned space - and I think you can get coffee there as well, we didn\'t go because it was quite crowded.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

625186425.name: Great museum and IMAX movies
625186425.author: a TripAdvisor user
625186425.reviewBody: The museum is very interesting. They also have art exhibits on the cube. On sundays everything is FREE!! The IMAX theatre is very cool, just seat all the way on the top so you don\u2019t get dizzy.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

624829754.name: Good family fun
624829754.author: a TripAdvisor user
624829754.reviewBody: My partner and I went there on the weekend... Was lots of fun, and with families all a round. The IMAX was running and was great value for us.... about $1.00 for both of us...\nIf its a rainy day your in out of the weather and you can spend a few hours there.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

619025425.name: Get yourself some culture
619025425.author: a TripAdvisor user
619025425.reviewBody: Tijuana Cultural Center is a wonderful place to spend a couple hours. Maybe get yourself out of the sun for a bit. The museum is FREE and gives you some of the important history of the area. Actually quite fascinating. Models of ships, missions, railroads, native dwellings, etc. all the exhibits are in Spanish AND English. I recommend taking a stroll through the botanical gardens out back where they have some nice recreations of some important Mexican artifacts and beautiful foliage.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

600624304.name: CECUT
600624304.author: a TripAdvisor user
600624304.reviewBody: A great place to start knowing the culture in Tijuana and in Baja California. Good shows, great art exposicions.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

598879301.name: Much to see
598879301.author: a TripAdvisor user
598879301.reviewBody: My family went to visit the Cecut center specifically to check out the aquarium. Though it is small, it is a good price and lots to see. At the end of the aquarium, you exit by going through the botanical garden which is beautiful! We have been to the Cecut before and there is more to do as well. They have a dome theater, which shows different movies such as ocean life, safari life, natural disasters, and the such. There is a library in the Cecut center as well as Art all around and more. It is a great place to visit with family, as a couple, with friends, or by yourself. Definitely shows a lot of the Culture and beautiful Arts.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

595348193.name: Mexican Culture just across the border.
595348193.author: a TripAdvisor user
595348193.reviewBody: CECUT has been around for some time now, it is the regions most renown cultural centre and museum featuring a theatre, planetary, art gallery and museum.
