It hosts some of the regions most important arts and literature festivals as well as plays and concerts. It is primarily sponsored by the federal government and therefore ticket prices are very affordable. There are a couple of book stores as well as art and literature workshops. When visiting Tijuana you cannot afford to miss CECUT.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

585858520.name: Good Arts center
585858520.author: a TripAdvisor user
585858520.reviewBody: CECUT contains much entertainment. From museums and aquariums to cinemas and concert theatres, there\'s a wonderful choice of entertainment. \n\nThe OBC, Orquesta of Baja Californa holds concerts there every week on Thursdays.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

583885030.name: Beautiful and spacious
583885030.author: a TripAdvisor user
583885030.reviewBody: Clean, eating places available!, security guard  visible and helpful, toilets nice and clean. Great Art Exhibition which was well set out so that viewing from further back was possible. Nice place to visit

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

583227326.name: A great collection of modern art venues
583227326.author: a TripAdvisor user
583227326.reviewBody: A great collection of art and theatre venues offering different styles and types of entertaining. Good vibe. Very modern.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

580448633.name: Tijuana continues to surprise me
580448633.author: a TripAdvisor user
580448633.reviewBody: During a walking tour of Tijuana, this was one of our stops.  We got tickets and went through the upstairs area which describes the history of the area; quite fascinating.  Didn\'t expect to see an attraction of this caliber when we started the tour.  Tijuana continues to surprise me (in a very good way).  Would definitely recommend a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

570197942.name: Great overview of the history of Mexico and tijuana
570197942.author: a TripAdvisor user
570197942.reviewBody: The main exhibit displays the history of Baja California from the dinosaur age to around the setup of the new US Mexico border. The displays are in Spanish and English however side exhibits are solely in Spanish. Don\'t just come to take a picture of the dome that houses the IMAX theatre but go into the complex and spend a couple of hours, also go into the botanical gardens and have a stroll. There is a coffee shop and clean toilets. Entrance to the museum is free but there are charges for the IMAX.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

566094073.name: Love this museum. Great art displays and traveling exhibits.
566094073.author: a TripAdvisor user
566094073.reviewBody: Love the architecture and staff. The natural history portion is good, not great, but definitely worth seeing. The art exhibits are wonderful. I\'ll go again and again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

555771476.name: Super IMAX experience
555771476.author: a TripAdvisor user
555771476.reviewBody: While visiting we decided spontaneously to visit CECUT to see a movie in the IMAX Theater.  We were surprised to find that on that daythere was a celebration of the three holy kings on that day in Mexico where a special sweet bread is eaten traditionaly on that day called "Rosca" and that around the entire theatre there was a huuuuge rosca that was being given away. It was meters and meters long. It was atreat for the children as well as for us. We later went into the theatre and saw the most amazing movie about Baja California wildlife, specifically speaking sealife and littoral mammals, narrated by mexican scientists and wildlife experts. The takes were wonderful and the audio magnificent. The Theater was only half full. There is an Elevator for disabled guests which was good. Parking was private and easily accesible. Prices extremely reasonable. Did not have more time to explore the rest of CECUT. Definitely recommended.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

555170528.name: Good food
555170528.author: a TripAdvisor user
555170528.reviewBody: I was in San Diego visiting and we all decided to go to Rosarita through Tijuana. It was a nice drive and we stopped at a fish restaurant for lunch. $7 a person and it was so tasty.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

552843914.name: Interesting information that could definitely be revamped and updated
552843914.author: a TripAdvisor user
552843914.reviewBody: The history of Tijuana and Baja California is too interesting to present it in such a boring fashion. This museum could definitely make some low cost investment to modernize its collection by for example, having wifi and a website that visitors can access from inside the building and read/listen to a guided tour.\nThe building is beautiful, and there was a private painting collection being displayed that I could not find the name of its artist. I would still recommend for people to visit it, however, while doing so, I felt it would be better for me to google the story of Tijuana and Baja California and could get better info. Also, because of the items being shown, I think it could be interesting for kids.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

551671409.name: Good summarizing of mexican history
551671409.author: a TripAdvisor user
551671409.reviewBody: With signs in both Spanish and English this was a good summarizing of the mexican history, from the imperialistic era to the jesuits and then the revolution 1910. Not too widespread but everything gathered and it was possible to see the whole museum. Some interesting artifacts and nice models of the first chapels here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

551288020.name: The Best cultural place in Tijuana
551288020.author: a TripAdvisor user
551288020.reviewBody: This center is the best cultural venue in Tijuana, located in the River Zone, 1 minute from the boarder it has all kinds of different events, you should get the program. Depends on what you are looking for, but most of the shows, conferences and events are great!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

550905449.name: Great architecture..
550905449.author: a TripAdvisor user
550905449.reviewBody: Quite an interesting building.. great place to explore after lunch.. lots of good works on display, historical perspective on how Tj became such a hub for growth.. pretty amazing and totally recommended.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

549582297.name: Tijauna trip
549582297.author: a TripAdvisor user
549582297.reviewBody: Stepped into the museum district in Tijuana and checked out the culture center of arts. Very interesting exhibition on the history of Baja California

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

544609054.name: Nice Local Museum
544609054.author: a TripAdvisor user
544609054.reviewBody:
Is a good place to See some local History, and spend some time.
They have an IMAX theater, An Aquarium and Art galleries.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

536238836.name: Fabulous tour of history of Baja
536238836.author: a TripAdvisor user
536238836.reviewBody: I loved this place! I could have spent HOURS going through it all. Basically you\'ll be walked through from the earliest humans through today.\n\nWould have loved to take in one of the movies at the IMAX, but not enough time.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

531831363.name: Yes Tijuana offer culture at its best!
531831363.author: a TripAdvisor user
531831363.reviewBody: Great suprise while visiting CECUT, a wonderful culture pavilion that offers great art rooms; I have a chance to admire an artist-photographer collection and a local painting artist collection; clean, functional and personnel were very kind and accommodating! \n\nCongratulations Tijuana!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

510668984.name: Outstanding Cultural and Arts Complex
510668984.author: a TripAdvisor user
510668984.reviewBody: This is a must-see stop in Tijuana.  Theater, Art Galleries, IMAX, Cinetheque, Bookshop, Aquarium, Lectures, Caf\u00e9, etc. and as of three months ago an outstanding new culinary venture, Cubo Bistro.  Almost always something interesting going on in the esplanade, usually free...music, concerts, artisanal fairs, etc.  Clean, free restrooms and safe parking (not free.)\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

508459387.name: So much to see and do
508459387.author: a TripAdvisor user
508459387.reviewBody: My daughter and I were in Tijuana for medical reasons and were looking for something low key to do so I could get some post-surgery walking in. We found this on Google and learned it was not far from where we were staying. We were especially lucky because there was some sort of festival going on outside the museum as well as all of the great exhibits around inside. \nI\'m not art buff but it was interesting to see the paintings, sculptures and such on one level but our favorite exhibit was the Mayan exh. in the Botanical Gardens. Such a beautiful walk! The history is rich and detailed and we loved learning so much about Tijuana\'s/Mexico\'s  beginnings. There was an Asian exhibit as well. Unfortunately, most of the descriptions are in Spanish with no translation so unless you have a basic understanding of Spanish, you\'ll find it hard to read/learn. But it\'s still nice walking through it. We understood a good deal of it so we were fortunate. \nThe aquarium is very small and dingy/dark compared to US aquariums but it was pretty and had some nice components. I felt like the tanks could have been cleaner or water clearer but I admit I know nothing about keeping salt water fish and perhaps it is supposed to be that way. Either way, the staff was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our 3 hours there tremendously. We will be coming back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

506842236.name: Cool concept
506842236.author: a TripAdvisor user
506842236.reviewBody: I love the architecture of this Cultural Center. It just makes it so quirky. I recently went with my college class to watch a documentary of the Wild Life in Africa. We very much enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

505306447.name: Many activities and celebrations!
505306447.author: a TripAdvisor user
505306447.reviewBody: We go here regularly. I recommend going to their website or following on FB. You will get regular updates of any events that are coming up as there are many. Most are usually free. This is a very nice cultural center but is used for so many things. I definitely recommend enjoying a film on the dome/globe screen.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

504319143.name: Wonderful place to visit
504319143.author: a TripAdvisor user
504319143.reviewBody: It\'s ver nice with architecture that was built 35 years ago, but the look is still charming. Nice work of art, great space, and design. \n\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

502332951.name: Many Events Year Round
502332951.author: a TripAdvisor user
502332951.reviewBody:
This place has many interesting free and outdoor events year-round. Sometimes with free concerts. 

Some of the shows are great as well (example: Black Swan - ballet) and others.

Check their website for scheduled events and shows. 

Great place to visit with family.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

496489615.name: museum visit
496489615.author: a TripAdvisor user
496489615.reviewBody:
a museum of Tijuana and mexico...
a must place to drop by if you wan to know more about mexico and tijuana....
ticket price is very cheap and it is very informative to the visitors  to learn more about mexico...
nice and great experience here....
outof the museum also have some stone carving...
and also sometimes will have fair here also, selling some local items....

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

492434045.name: lovely and incredible
492434045.author: a TripAdvisor user
492434045.reviewBody: spent about an hour there. there was a band performance when i was there. lots of typical Mexican snacks sold around by vendors.\nInside the center, there were exhibitions.\nIf I wasn\'t in a hurry, it\'s a place one could spend hours without knowing.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

490167523.name: Incredible experience
490167523.author: a TripAdvisor user
490167523.reviewBody: If  you  are  coming to Tijuana. Please make sure you visit this venue.  I have only positive thoughts.  I  have been to many events.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

487436074.name: May trip
487436074.author: a TripAdvisor user
487436074.reviewBody: Spent several hours here.  Outside was a large book fair of different vendors but all Spanish books.  Inside was an Fernando Botero Art Exhibit.  About 40 paintings and sketches of the crucifixion of Christ.  Very interesting.  Also other parts had other art exhibits.  Museo de las Californias was extremely interesting.  Displays of ancient artifacts and of the settling in Mexico of the Spanish.  Allow about 2-3 hours if you enjoy museums.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

484732071.name: went durning cinco de mayo
484732071.author: a TripAdvisor user
484732071.reviewBody: was very interesting all the things i learned. Lot of venders selling their wears and then the shows .

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

484426886.name: Well presented
484426886.author: a TripAdvisor user
484426886.reviewBody: The building is architecturally interesting with displays on many levels. There were a few art exhibitions on when we visited which were very good. The walk though the areas history was well laid out if not a little querky. We went on a Sunday and it was a pleasant surprise that it is free on a Sunday. There is a small park attached to the building complex which is also worth a visit. Recommended.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

480946625.name: This is a must see.
480946625.author: a TripAdvisor user
480946625.reviewBody: Loved the art and the museum. While we were there they were having an anime expo which was very interesting. Loved the gardens and the statues.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

473481505.name: Modern Art
473481505.author: a TripAdvisor user
473481505.reviewBody: We went to the modern art section of the cultural center and found it very interesting.  Be sure and go to the first floor gallery where the artist depicts a modern version of the events leading up to and the death of Christ.  In this artist version,  Christ is pretty chubby!  But it is good art work. \n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

472443908.name: Place to go with the family
472443908.author: a TripAdvisor user
472443908.reviewBody: All the time I went tijuana we visited  because siempre tiene cosas muy  interesante I like most the imax theater but if you only want to relax walk at botanical garden love it

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

471471917.name: Not What I Expected
471471917.author: a TripAdvisor user
471471917.reviewBody: My expectations were [ridiculously] set too high. I do like the building, walking into a ball---cool. I was a regular in the Monterey Aquarium, different art galleries, and the Smithsonian museums. I hoped to see an exhibition of the Mexican Revolution, but didn\'t see one. I looked for examples of the fish found around the Baja Peninsula. It does have an IMAX theater, but I\'m deaf, there was no use seeing that. The beautiful artwork that was in place caught my eye, and made the trip worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

469487713.name: Cecut Museum / Tijuana Cultural Center
469487713.author: a TripAdvisor user
469487713.reviewBody: This Museum is totally Excellent. I\'ve seen 2 sets of shows here and they could stand up against any museum in New York City.  They show traditional, controversial and totally up to date selections of paintings, photography and sculpture. There is also a theatre with a wonderful stage for ballet / music, a children\'s section and an Imack movie theatre in the ball shaped section.\nEven if you just want to see some great architecture. Completely worth the trip. 5 stars

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

468148858.name: Visit CECUT
468148858.author: a TripAdvisor user
468148858.reviewBody: I\'ve been several times at CECUT every time a great experience. It\'s a very interesting place, not just for the building itself but for the ever changing art galleries, the projections at the IMAX, teather plays, and expos. If you are in Tijuana take some time to visit this museum.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

467649428.name: Great place!
467649428.author: a TripAdvisor user
467649428.reviewBody: Visited here while I was in Tijuana and thought that it was a wonderful place and an interesting museum.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

467117767.name: Passing Time
467117767.author: a TripAdvisor user
467117767.reviewBody: Well I had an hour to kill waiting for my dentist who was across the street from this big ball Aquarium.  This was an enjoyable hour spent there. I think the price was @ 4 bucks or less. It housed some really beautiful fish and other odd creatures from the sea. Some of exhibits lack the care needed for this show. Some things are falling apart. All in all a good place for adults to go with kids and good place to escape from the heat. It is a safe environment and pretty clean.  Good dentist office across the street and a few steps away is a very nice little restaurant with simple menu and good food. Price very reasonable. Have fun.....

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

467108843.name: Cultural and enriching place to visit
467108843.author: a TripAdvisor user
467108843.reviewBody: I personally like to appreciate the architecture of the buildings, and the cultural aspect of what it has to offer!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

465698359.name: Art & History
465698359.author: a TripAdvisor user
465698359.reviewBody: I always enjoy art and history. The paid exhibits were worth the price. The architecture alone was interesting. My favorite piece was by hector banda. It was at the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

462601292.name: Wish we had more time
462601292.author: a TripAdvisor user
462601292.reviewBody: The free gallery was interesting and I loved the gardens.  Wish we had time for an IMAX and the exhibit upstairs detailing the history of the area.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

460928838.name: Getting to know Tijuana Mexico
460928838.author: a TripAdvisor user
460928838.reviewBody: Great start to a Friday morning. No lines, no crowds. The staff was very helpful.  The center is not very big and does not compare to what we have in California.  However, I learned more about the history of Tijuana.\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

457187234.name: The best cross section
457187234.author: a TripAdvisor user
457187234.reviewBody: What with a historical component, art, science, aquarium, etc., this one location has a good cross section of the history and culture of Baja.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

456785157.name: Cool exhibits and art
456785157.author: a TripAdvisor user
456785157.reviewBody: This is a must-see for any tourists in Tijuana. "La bola" as locals call it always has something to offer. The IMAX teather keeps it interesting and the art exhibits and library are very cool.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

455963538.name: Modern art
455963538.author: a TripAdvisor user
455963538.reviewBody: We strolled thru here before leaving to the airport. It had an event going on. But we did admire the nice modern art. Next time we will prepare to have a few hours to visit. Many nice places to visit in tiuana

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

454127334.name: Great Cultural Site
454127334.author: a TripAdvisor user
454127334.reviewBody: I love this place. I visit it whenever I have a chance. It features an Imax theater as well as a performance theater and several rooms with art and other exhibits. This center houses "Museo de las Californias" (Californias Museum)\n The museum shows the history of both Californias; higher and lower. From the first inhabitants in the area to the arrivals of Spaniards and other peoples in the area. \nThe whole place is fantastic and it\'s highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

451404587.name: Really cool exhibits for a good price.
451404587.author: a TripAdvisor user
451404587.reviewBody: The staff was inviting and helpful in explaining everything and how to enter the exhibits etc. Definitely a well maintained building- had super clean bathrooms too!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

451352387.name: Just walking
451352387.author: a TripAdvisor user
451352387.reviewBody:
Its abig cinema with wild themes from Africa and the Sea
Place and prices are afordable
Its ok.
Maybe shows should be more different to incentivate people to return more often

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

450874820.name: Not tourist friendly
450874820.author: a TripAdvisor user
450874820.reviewBody: No one spoke English when you tried to use what little Spanish you know they stare and send you to another person who also doesn\'t have the time to help. Every person is too busy but willing to take your money

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

448157222.name: Really cool!
448157222.author: a TripAdvisor user
448157222.reviewBody: Im not one to say I enjoy art, but this had some cool history.  The imax runs every hour.  Inside the exposition they had nifty weapons and ships that was worth reading.  Back home something of this value would be 20$.  We paid less than 2$.  Imax was about the same.  Plan for atleast an hour in the gallery.  I didn\'t get to see it all.  Should of went back.  It\'s worth it.  Can go after dinner as well so you have no excuse to check it out while your here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

446506774.name: Always A Great Experience
446506774.author: a TripAdvisor user
446506774.reviewBody: I\'ve come here from La Mesa, CA for several concerts, the most memorable of which was a concert by the winner of the International Mariachi Music competition!  True Mariachi music isn\'t the small groups (generally thee or four players) that play in Mexican restaurants and bars.  The winners that year were from Tijuana, and it was truly a professional performance.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

445380683.name: Imax Theater
445380683.author: a TripAdvisor user
445380683.reviewBody: Went to see the humpback whale documentary, loved it and the little coffee area they have. There is a nice museum in the other building which has many different exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

441651505.name: Very nice area
441651505.author: a TripAdvisor user
441651505.reviewBody: This is a great part of Tijuana.  The city gets a pretty bad rap because of the occasional violence, the endless construction, and pretty bad traffic, but there are nice parts of town, and this is one of them.  The only reason I\'m not providing a 5th star is because the guard told us that we couldn\'t walk our dogs on the property - even though we were barely off the street on the sidewalk in front of the place.  But the place itself is quite impressive and the wide streets with green-strips running down the middle near the river are pretty nice, for TJ.  There are a couple of nice Starbucks around as well, and a couple of decent hotels.  The Roundabouts have interesting sculptures and statues in this area as well.  Good place close to the airport to hang out during a layover.  Cab ride is $150 pesos - Uber is about $80.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

438859124.name: Something interesting to do
438859124.author: a TripAdvisor user
438859124.reviewBody: Lots of interesting architectural things to see and art. Not too crowded so you will have plenty of time to see at your own pace.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

437658417.name: Great place to spend a whole day
437658417.author: a TripAdvisor user
437658417.reviewBody: Lovely place for culture interested people. It has several areas to visit. Centrally located with easy access.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

436003864.name: Recommended
436003864.author: a TripAdvisor user
436003864.reviewBody: Great museum, very educational.  Highly recommended for families.  Friendly staff.  Good restaurant with fair prices.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

432701003.name: Exposition
432701003.author: a TripAdvisor user
432701003.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to visit, they often have painting expositions , more like always, plays , opera, simphonies , books and apr\u00f3piate shops. \nLove the place, they also show interesting movies in their circular theatre. \nDon\'t miss it when you visit tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

432170689.name: Very clean and well kept inside with good price of entrance
432170689.author: a TripAdvisor user
432170689.reviewBody: The IMAX is very good priced, about 2 bucks US and there was 4 options of movies to see. There is a cafeteria and gift shop and lots of space to walk around.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

429825480.name: A must for culture in TJ
429825480.author: a TripAdvisor user
429825480.reviewBody: It has some good expositions about mexicans artists, a small aquarium and a permanent exposition about the history of Baja. The architecture of the buillding is really nice and it has an excellent location

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

429775992.name: CULTURAL AND  INEXPENSIVE
429775992.author: a TripAdvisor user
429775992.reviewBody: great place to  spend an  afternoon  or  weekend  with  family, they  have  great  public  event,  free of  charge, and  new movies  on  imax  very  afortable

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

429342293.name: The best cultural place in Tijuana
429342293.author: a TripAdvisor user
429342293.reviewBody: This is one of the most important and valued places in Tijuana for art exhibitions, theater, symphonies, music and festivals. The huge round structure houses an Omnimax theater that runs 1 hour films (about 4-5 to chose from)every hour from Monday till Sunday. You can also watch a laser show with music and fog at night inside the Omnimax on weekends. This laser show is a tribute to a group or musician such as Pink Floyd, Beatles, Daft Punk, Michael Jackson, etc. \nAlmost anything related to arts, culture, venues and information will be found here. A must place to visit if you ever come to Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

428293589.name: One of the good place to visit in Tijuana
428293589.author: a TripAdvisor user
428293589.reviewBody: Very interesting, the performing artist were very daring you have to see to believe .. amazing show and the museum itself it\'s very interesting with its history . Defiantly good to visit

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

426254653.name: Entinjuare Festival
426254653.author: a TripAdvisor user
426254653.reviewBody: The cultural center is amazing was in ahhh of the architecture and planning involved. I will return again to see different exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

424803210.name: Nice.
424803210.author: a TripAdvisor user
424803210.reviewBody: Nice people nobody is touching you,they respect but sometimes they press you to buy something or to seat to their place.Anyway we will visit it again for sure.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

423838343.name: Lots of history
423838343.author: a TripAdvisor user
423838343.reviewBody: We went to the museum and is very interesting , it is called "El museo de las Californias". Also we watched a movie in the IMAX theater and it was a fun experience. The day we were there an orquestra was having a free concert. We wished we had more time to get to know the place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

423132959.name: The pride of TJ
423132959.author: a TripAdvisor user
423132959.reviewBody: A very attractive permanent museum coupled with changing art exhibit, it is truly the cultural vein of the city.  IMAX, and other auditoriums make it very comprehensive. Nice outdoor shows as wrantell. I personally deplore the absence of a proper restaurant and or bar..

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

422917467.name: Great place to visit in Tijuana
422917467.author: a TripAdvisor user
422917467.reviewBody: Great place I do recommend you to get in time and select seat from the middle to upper section to get a much better experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

416273417.name: I liked...
416273417.author: a TripAdvisor user
416273417.reviewBody: I liked it, they have good customer service, however I think that exposures do not keep the public amused

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

415909973.name: Interesting, a little lacking
415909973.author: a TripAdvisor user
415909973.reviewBody: Apparently it tends to be empty. It\'s huge and only part of the museum half has a permanent exhibit. Then again it\'s super cheap.\nGood book stores (in Spanish). The IMAX movie theater (the ball building) seems interesting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

412776010.name: Awesome day
412776010.author: a TripAdvisor user
412776010.reviewBody: This is very educational to go with your kids because they get so intrigued about things that they see every day and do not apreciate is a good place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

410207031.name: Visit to the museum
410207031.author: a TripAdvisor user
410207031.reviewBody: I crossed the border on foot for an experience in Tijuana and Ensenada.  Before I headed to Ensenada I wanted to visit the museum and see what it offered.  Understand that I like history and muses do thought this was well done.  Most, if not all, signs are in English and Spanish.  Offers and history of Baja and of Mexico from the early Indians to the present day.  I learned a lot.  Replicas of ships, churches and more.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

399943631.name: Worth seeing!
399943631.author: a TripAdvisor user
399943631.reviewBody: There was wonderful National Geographic photographic exhibtion on which was very well done.   Plus the Botanical gardens are worth a walk around, not so much the aquarium.  My only problem is that I wish there were more signs in English!\nOtherwise for the money it is well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

397518658.name: Excellent Experience
397518658.author: a TripAdvisor user
397518658.reviewBody: Every time i have gone, i always wish to have time to do it more often. I could be on IMAX, theater or exposition, its alway a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

397055037.name: Check it out
397055037.author: a TripAdvisor user
397055037.reviewBody: Throughly enjoyed our visit. I love to read all the stuff but it was so interesting. We look forward to our nexted visitors so we get to go again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

391918862.name: Pleasant centre for culture in a busy city
391918862.author: a TripAdvisor user
391918862.reviewBody: The Tijuana Cultural centre is actively used by the people for all ki9nds of activities. Not only is there an art gallery and museum, but the IMax is especially popular and very good, except movies are, of course, in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

390203227.name: A place to visit!
390203227.author: a TripAdvisor user
390203227.reviewBody: Well this Cultural Center has an impressive architecture. I was surprised by the fact that everything looks like perfect and TJ people take care of it. I was happy to visit it since everybody says is one of those places that you must go!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

389940161.name: A must visit place worth the trip
389940161.author: a TripAdvisor user
389940161.reviewBody: This is an awesome place for the whole family. The museum of the Californias displays the history of the area with gorgeous displays, including an 1:4 scale model of a Spanish galeon, models of most of the missions in Baja California, the inside of a galeon, a mission, an hogan, etc. The botanical garden is great and the exhibitions are amazing. Even during summer the program is so diverse and interesting, and that all for an entry fee that under the current exchange rate is less than $ 1.50. Don\'t miss it! It is just a short ride with a colectivo from the city center.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

388862745.name: A place that inspires knowledge
388862745.author: a TripAdvisor user
388862745.reviewBody: We were impressed of the design of the Cultural Center, clean, simple and beautiful. We visited the imax theater viewed the Pandas being introduce back into the wild, didn\'t turn out well for them. The art exhibits nice a place for you to experience Mexico history. Visitors this is a place to visit. Weekends are a place for arts and crafts. food and great music.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

387225573.name: excellent experience
387225573.author: a TripAdvisor user
387225573.reviewBody:
excellent family fun
must be aware of the ULTURAL events that occur in the main concourse CECUT
alternative cinema, imax screen, theater and many other event
Free museum Sunday

excelente diversion familiar
hay que estar pendiente de los eventos ulturales que se presentan en la explanada principal del cecut
cine alternativo, pantalla imax, teatro y muchos otros evento
domingo de museo gratis

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

385055221.name: CECUT
385055221.author: a TripAdvisor user
385055221.reviewBody: If you have time definitely a place to visit\nGood price, family fun, the kids will enjoy, good memories...

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

382258684.name: Wonderful museum
382258684.author: a TripAdvisor user
382258684.reviewBody: We enjoyed the museum which had an interesting history of Baja California.  While we were there, there was a music program featuring 3 guitarists.  There was also a comedian doing the story of DonQuixote.  My husband who speaks Spanish says it was wonderful

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

380363841.name: Fun and interesting trip.
380363841.author: a TripAdvisor user
380363841.reviewBody: Definitely worth stopping at if you\'re in the area. You can learn a lot of the culture and history of the city here. Great attractions for the kids as well. You can spend an entire day here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

378641185.name: DO NOT MISS IT VERY INTERESTING AND HISTORICAL
378641185.author: a TripAdvisor user
378641185.reviewBody: I LOVED THIS CENTER; IT HAS so much to offer.  Even the Art Gallery is fabulous as are the collections explaining Mexico\'s Baha development and history of the land, animals and people.  I highly reccomend the Center and if in TJ shame on you if you dont see it.  The architecture alone is a 10 ++.\nIts easy to find just ask a taxi driver or your hotel.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

372937317.name: One of the best places in Tijuana
372937317.author: a TripAdvisor user
372937317.reviewBody: I just happened to be there to see a play call the beauty and the beast and I came early so I had a chance to check other areas of CECUT to my surprise this place is awesome.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

372684486.name: Awesome location
372684486.author: a TripAdvisor user
372684486.reviewBody: I highly recommend for anyone who loves museums, exhibits, or any educational learning, I also liked their mini aquarium and their sweet potatoe frapps are the best ,

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

371291149.name: Amazing cultural centre!
371291149.author: a TripAdvisor user
371291149.reviewBody: Great Theatre, IMAX, museum and exhibit space. Lovely public areas and cafe to grab a drink or snack before the show. Beautiful cactus gardens too!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

370947145.name: Interesting Museum about California History
370947145.author: a TripAdvisor user
370947145.reviewBody: I really loved the Museum which surely does not try to cover the crimes committed by the Spanish monks against the native population as well as the fact that these same monks brought to California  and transmitted illnesses like syphilis and similar.\nAll explanations are in Spanish and English which is fine. I was longing to buy a small book about these details for South California, but in the Museum shop there was no book which was not in Spanish (except a guide of Tijuana). I am sorry to say that I do not feel in condition to read a complex book in Spanish. I could read in English, German, Italian, Greek, Russian and French, but there was absolutely nothing in any of these languages. This was a disappointment.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

370780776.name: Casual Visit on a Sunday
370780776.author: a TripAdvisor user
370780776.reviewBody: We visited the cultural center expecting to experience a museum replete with exhibits representative of Mexican history and culture. Our impression was somewhat different once we had walked around the various levels and expanses of the modern building. The artwork is mostly modern impressionistic paintings and plenty of odd structures made of unrelated materials. It was somewhat bizarre for my American taste. There are plenty of references to sexual organs and symbols in the art but there are some historically-themed paintings. The concrete building has large open empty expanses with wide open spaces. That puzzled us as there is plenty of room to place exhibits but none were there. There was one upstairs area where people were looking at exhibits, but the stairs were roped off with a guard standing by. He pointed us to an information desk where we were told we couldn\'t go up to that level. At least that\'s what we thought they told us since we don\'t speak Spanish. We looked at two areas where movie theaters were exhibiting multiple movies and each had lines of people ready to enter. We opted to finish our tour and venture out into the bright sunshiny day, ready for the next place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

370255190.name: Beauty and the beast musical
370255190.author: a TripAdvisor user
370255190.reviewBody: Great show and service. People that worked there were really nice. There is a lot of parking underground and on the first floor as well. Just a heads up if you have a show at 7pm get there around 6:00 especially because of traffic and there\'s a lot of activities the same day and place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

368686218.name: CECUT
368686218.author: a TripAdvisor user
368686218.reviewBody: Excelent place to meet.  Cultural, historic, academic, and very fun trip.  Several activities, shows, presentation and obviously the IMAX Dome center.  Excellent for all the family and all ages. Make sure to review the agenda before...

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

367606049.name: First calss enterteinment
367606049.author: a TripAdvisor user
367606049.reviewBody: The Tijuana Cultural center and in particular the IMAX theatre are an incredible deal, for less than $5.00 Dollars (including parking fee) you get to see Imax movies in all their glory, I just saw a documentary of US National Parks and it is impressive, the place is clean and orderly.\nTake the family

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

367048815.name: Wonderful exhibits and beautiful building
367048815.author: a TripAdvisor user
367048815.reviewBody: Cecut is a not to miss. This building is spectacular and they always have fantastic things to see. Live entertainment an beautiful art exhibits.\n. A few yards away is a wonderful IMAX theater.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

366198831.name: CECUT
366198831.author: a TripAdvisor user
366198831.reviewBody: The arts center of Tijuana City, they always have concerts, art expositions, theater, California\u00b4s Museum and an aquarium.  You will find here a lot of things to enjoyed.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

365480413.name: Great Cultural experience
365480413.author: a TripAdvisor user
365480413.reviewBody: It may be a difficult to communicate in spanish, but this place offer a lot of options from expositions, children activities, imax movies and even an aquarium. the entry for the cecut is free, but if you want to watch any of the imax, special events or the aquarium, you will need buy tickets for those particular events

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

361817324.name: Not to be missed attraction in Tijuana
361817324.author: a TripAdvisor user
361817324.reviewBody: CECUT is a world-class museum and cultural center that offers a variety of reasons to visit:  permanent museum exhibit of the history of Baja California, IMAX theater, traveling exhibitions, meeting halls, cafeteria, aquarium, events on the esplanade that range from music, to art, to crafts markets, etc.  It\'s the centerpiece of the Tijuana River development and a not-to-be-missed stop.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

358053992.name: Museum and theatre
358053992.author: a TripAdvisor user
358053992.reviewBody: Must visit, diferent exibitions, paintins, sculpture, Mexican culture of native mexicans from Baja California and the South of M\u00e9xico, good plays for the en tire family

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

357790657.name: Cecut!
357790657.author: a TripAdvisor user
357790657.reviewBody: This cultural center has several exhibits and even offers IMAX!\nThe multi theaters gives CECUT a multi dimensional articulate setting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

357459058.name: Got to go!
357459058.author: a TripAdvisor user
357459058.reviewBody: If your in Tj this is a fun place To take your family.Every one i know that gone there love it!!!Have fun!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

355899847.name: Grate place to visit!
355899847.author: a TripAdvisor user
355899847.reviewBody: The best of Tijuana! you do not want to miss it if you come this beautiful City... It is a new way of perceive things.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

353368229.name: Unexpected Surprise
353368229.author: a TripAdvisor user
353368229.reviewBody: What a great experience!  I\'m a museum nut and try to make sure that I visit them in every city through which I pass. How is it that I missed this one?  Especially when you consider it\'s as close as it is... Wonderful property, lovely exhibits, very informative docents and staff; a wonderful experience all around.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

352320219.name: Iconic Building
352320219.author: a TripAdvisor user
352320219.reviewBody: It\'s one of a kind, iMAX Cinema, it a point in Tijuana were you can find culture and history in one place. Everyone is friendly.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

351955167.name: Great place to visit - A must see!
351955167.author: a TripAdvisor user
351955167.reviewBody: We went here to see a movie/ documentary in 3D. It was simply amazing and there are so many other unique things to see here, everyone should visit !!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

349819704.name: Great Architecture and Art!
349819704.author: a TripAdvisor user
349819704.reviewBody: This is a hidden gem not many people in the U.S. know about. There are many great shows featuring wonderful Mexican artists. It is a fairly large complex but the size of the exhibits are not overwhelming. We have visited the exhibits over the years and always enjoyed them. We didn\'t find many people who speak English there but got along just fine. There are some new innovative restaurants in Tijuana, including Mision 19, which is very popular. We drive to the U.S. border, walk across, take a taxi to where we want to go, and then return. It may be easier to drive if you are used to it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

348649723.name: Love the movie theater
348649723.author: a TripAdvisor user
348649723.reviewBody: I am very pleased with the selection of movies they show in cecut, they are always informative and it is very fun to see them in the huge screen

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

345713060.name: Diamond in the Rough
345713060.author: a TripAdvisor user
345713060.reviewBody: This was our first vist to Tijuana as a family. This center was the highlight of our visit. Everyone was so friendly, and willing to tolerate us not speaking Spanish. My kids fully enjoyed this visit. Loved the huge dorm theater, we got to watch the movie Jerusalem during our visit. Loved all the artifacts. So well organized. Just a beautiful museum.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

343891574.name: ALL CULTURE!
343891574.author: a TripAdvisor user
343891574.reviewBody: CECUT  is the place to immerse in the different aspects of culture  that not only reflect Mexico but all over the world. You can attend  concerts, art exhibits, conferences, or just walk around it\'s open  spaces . It is  fantastic place to admire the richness of Mexico\'s art and it\'s crafts.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

340093865.name: Quiet sanctuary in TJ
340093865.author: a TripAdvisor user
340093865.reviewBody: Nice permanent exhibit on the history of Baja California with information presented in both Spanish and English. Affordable entry ticket. Also onsite are temporary exhibits in "the cube", separate tickets required. Interesting architecture, great photo spot and lovely garden (free). We plan on returning.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

339395272.name: Landmark and a must go
339395272.author: a TripAdvisor user
339395272.reviewBody: From Tijuana this is the finest building, where the national budget is well seen to create beautiful architecture. The art that is exposed in here somehow feels distant and the community is not largely engaged. This is mainly because of the current cultural and awareness state of the Tijuanan people, but that does not diminish the overall accomplishment of this place. Definitely a must go.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

337050839.name: Worth a Half Day Visit
337050839.author: a TripAdvisor user
337050839.reviewBody: Very educational.  Good history of Tijuana.  Great display of regional art when we were there.  Good parking.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

334485043.name: Definitely worth the visit!
334485043.author: a TripAdvisor user
334485043.reviewBody: I highly recommend your visit here. It was fun and interesting. I went for one of their weekday exhibits and loved it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

333185685.name: A great place to start if you are a Turist...
333185685.author: a TripAdvisor user
333185685.reviewBody: The permanent exhibition of the "Californias" you get in 30 minutes a run by of the history of Baja and Alta California...\n\nYou also have an opportunity to see that there is more to TJ than... well you know...

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

331843666.name: There\'s culture south of the border!
331843666.author: a TripAdvisor user
331843666.reviewBody: I always try to catch the latest exhibit at the Cecut when I\'m in TJ. Three floors of wonderfully curated art in all mediums...an unexpected gem in a city that\'s truly making a comeback.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

327525880.name: Interesting, Takes about 45 minutes to see..
327525880.author: a TripAdvisor user
327525880.reviewBody: Good summary of the history of the Baja Area. Some great models and dioramas. Limited artifacts. The art and cultural section on the lower floor was also educational.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

326127947.name: Interesting architecture, nice to see
326127947.author: a TripAdvisor user
326127947.reviewBody: The building is really amazing and it is interesting to see. The expositions were interesting.\nOverall it is a nice place to see, but I think it is a little overrated.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

324930278.name: Amazing place!!
324930278.author: a TripAdvisor user
324930278.reviewBody: I was fortunate enough to visit on a Sunday when the exhibits were free to the public. I also saw a soprano performance while sitting on the stage and the Ballet Folklorico here in the same day. The prices for the performances you\'ll see are very, very reasonable. If in Tijuana, do  not miss a visit to CECUT!!!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

324324332.name: Great place to visit in Tijuana
324324332.author: a TripAdvisor user
324324332.reviewBody: There is a lot to see here, very culture oriented museums, it is located only 10 minutes from hotel aqua rio. Great place to take family and friends

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

319410546.name: Just a hop, skip, and a jump from San Diego!
319410546.author: a TripAdvisor user
319410546.reviewBody: The Tijuana Cultural Center offers wonderful cultural opportunities to those of us just on the other side of the border.  Just a few months ago there was an exhibit on Frieda, a famous Latina artist. They also have hosted wonderful entertainment like the Ballet Folklorico and, of course, for decades now, they have had an Omnimax Theater.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

310377412.name: Great space.
310377412.author: a TripAdvisor user
310377412.reviewBody: Went on the last day of Frida Kahlo SUS FOTOS exhibit. It was such a treat to see rare photographs of Frida. I wasn\'t sure if it was busy because it was a sunday or because the exhibit was FREE!  I has there for a short time but will go back and highly recommend it to people of all ages.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

309824185.name: Cultural place
309824185.author: a TripAdvisor user
309824185.reviewBody:
Very nice & interesting  museums & exposition. 
Also have a good restaurant & coffee shop 
Omni max teatro 
Good parking lot 
Curious & gifts  store 
Good prices

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

306977123.name: Great place
306977123.author: a TripAdvisor user
306977123.reviewBody: Great place to go, even there imax is one of the best one I been ever in my life. There theather are also huge an spacy

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

306797670.name: Very informative!
306797670.author: a TripAdvisor user
306797670.reviewBody: Got a coupon from a server at a restaurant for 3 documentaries at the IMAX theater at the Tijuana Cultural Center and had a great time! I had never visit the center  before and I\'m glad I did. After watching the three documentaries, I went to see 3 additional exhibits: one for Frida Kahlo, another had part of the personal art collection of Carlos Slim from the Soumaya Museum in Mexico City, and yet another exhibit had art made by local Tijuanans, very interesting! This is a great place for families with kids.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

306009484.name: Bit of historical knowledge
306009484.author: a TripAdvisor user
306009484.reviewBody: If you are interested in knowing a bit more of history of Tijuana and Baja california this is a place you should.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

305046083.name: Top cultural site
305046083.author: a TripAdvisor user
305046083.reviewBody: This is the best cultural place to go, you can see expositions, imax movies, plays, state of the art installations, parking fee not cheap.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

301025440.name: Great attraction in Tijuana
301025440.author: a TripAdvisor user
301025440.reviewBody: The building is very interesting and the exposition are great. A good surprise in Tijuana. I recommend the visit!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

294851590.name: Tijuana Cultural Center (CECUT)
294851590.author: a TripAdvisor user
294851590.reviewBody: IMAX movies, great historical museum, art exhibits, garden with indigenous statue reproductions, book store and gift shop,  art classes, kids area to explore books and make art.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

293711785.name: IMAX
293711785.author: a TripAdvisor user
293711785.reviewBody: Went with my two boys to see the dragons movie on imax and they were impressed with the facilities and movie

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

293155420.name: Interesting museum - and music too!
293155420.author: a TripAdvisor user
293155420.reviewBody: A pretty good museum, but lacking in a couple ways:  they don\'t have adequate informational signs for the exhibits, and much of the info they give is inaccurate.  but we liked what we saw, and they have music there too.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

286593475.name: Great Frida Kahlo exhibition
286593475.author: a TripAdvisor user
286593475.reviewBody: Loved their Frida Kahlo exhibition as well as their IMAX dome, and their cafe! It\'s a must visit and it\'s FREE (except the IMAX movies)!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

286124719.name: Museum day
286124719.author: a TripAdvisor user
286124719.reviewBody: Went to Museum of the Californias and also Friday Khalo Museum which will be here until September 2015.\nThey both are really cool to take family to see.\nReally enjoyed both museums.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

284108073.name: Good experience, which could have been better!
284108073.author: a TripAdvisor user
284108073.reviewBody: I visited Tijuana after a long drive from San Francisco last year, and wasn\'t thrilled about the place. However, I like their Cultural Center though, although there\'s room for improvement.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

280056335.name: Told the history of this part of my Mexico
280056335.author: a TripAdvisor user
280056335.reviewBody: When I came with my fellow teacher friend, saw a lot of school kids because o nfield trips. There was a coffee shop as well as an ATM. Learned about the missions in Baja California as well as the history of  the different cultures that settled here. The art museum had an exhibit of modern art. There is a nice garden in the back

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

277745815.name: Baja migration story
277745815.author: a TripAdvisor user
277745815.reviewBody: Unexpected stories of Russian, Chinese, Japanese, French settlements in Baja.  Reproductions of sailing ships.  Well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

277402303.name: Excellent place to visit and get immersed
277402303.author: a TripAdvisor user
277402303.reviewBody:
Very safe, comfortable, clean place to spend a few hours immersing yourself in Mexican history, culture.

A bonus benefit was watching for free a dress rehersal of their 'Junior' symphony orchestra. they were very good. 

The aquarium was very small compared to the ones we have in the US.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

277301657.name: A welcome cultural surprise in a border city.
277301657.author: a TripAdvisor user
277301657.reviewBody: The art museum wing is very well done with well put together exhibits of mostly contemporary Mexican art, and sometimes more historic art. It gets traveling shows from the museums in Mexico City and also curates its own very well thought out shows. The Baja history museum is also very well done and fascinating. It gives a great perspective on the area and its development.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

274882601.name: not much to see..
274882601.author: a TripAdvisor user
274882601.reviewBody: went to Mercado Hidalgo and decided to take a walk to Tijuana Cultural Center, almost empty place, no too much to see, one o two expositions.. nothing interesting.. continued to Plaza Rio Tijuana Shopping Mall for a diner

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

274544743.name: Great Venue
274544743.author: a TripAdvisor user
274544743.reviewBody: I have seen several performances here and they have been excellent quality in a fabulous venue.  This time, there was an artisan craft market going on as well which added to the festive quality of the evening out.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

274110532.name: Real history, real culture
274110532.author: a TripAdvisor user
274110532.reviewBody: You\'d be surprised at some of the fascinating exhibits they get. For example, we saw an exhibit of medieval torture devices (very disturbing) and another time saw photography from all over the world. I especially like the garden with replicas of real Aztec deities.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

273211277.name: Cecut ...A  Must visit to Tijuana
273211277.author: a TripAdvisor user
273211277.reviewBody: CECUT center is a must visit if you are in Tijuana, it\'s a Culture Center, ... It has a historic museum , and a theater that host a variety of events. From Musical , theater shows, Concerts, it has a OMNIMAX Theater, lecture rooms , with top writers.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

273199997.name: Best attraction in TJ
273199997.author: a TripAdvisor user
273199997.reviewBody: This is a large facility with a mega screen...2 different museums...large theater...presentation halls....killer book store and more.  Many outside shows, fairs and the like. Check out the museum of the California\'s and more. The big concrete ball is a iMax theater.  Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

271784636.name: Nice cool and free
271784636.author: a TripAdvisor user
271784636.reviewBody: Nice place to see relax and cool off from the heat. ... and it\'s free.  Just be careful taking pics. You can on somethings but kids all in spanish so if you do not read the language don\'t take any.  Some neat things to see in here.  It\'s pretty large and if you read add u go then should take a couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

268573685.name: Great cultural venue.
268573685.author: a TripAdvisor user
268573685.reviewBody:
Incredible Omnimax movies.
Interesting museum of the Baja California origins.
Always there are some visiting exhibit weather in paintings, sculpture, etc.
The fountain in the courtyard is fantastic

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

268328678.name: the best place to see tijuana
268328678.author: a TripAdvisor user
268328678.reviewBody: the museum it has been part of tj for the longest time. Is the best place to visit to get to know the cultural aspect of tijuana. it has many movies and art galleries. is very family oriented.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

267764813.name: Worth the trip!
267764813.author: a TripAdvisor user
267764813.reviewBody: Spent the day at the venue. Lots to do & see. Loved the History of Baja Museum!\nThe art section was cool but not my cup of tea. The Imaz was great but wife wished it was in English - I reminded her that we were in MEXICO !\nOver all very well done - note: lots of schools on field trips!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

267539303.name: Eye opening
267539303.author: a TripAdvisor user
267539303.reviewBody: We saw only the three galleries that were on one side of the building. It is a great facility and requires much more time than we allowed it. A knowledge of Spanish would be an asset here for sure. However the few precolonial pieces on display were well worth the price of admission these were in gallery one. There are people on staff that speak good English if the language is a barrier for you. We walked to other areas of the building and there is so much more to see. I would return if in the area again and allow at least a half day instead of the two hours we had allotted.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

263780645.name: Educational
263780645.author: a TripAdvisor user
263780645.reviewBody: Very helpful, friendly and educational. Loved all the wonderful art pieces. Very reasonable priced and I believe free on sundays.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

262680356.name: A must....
262680356.author: a TripAdvisor user
262680356.reviewBody: Everytime my family and I visit Tijuana, we make it a must to watch a film at the IMAX theater. Any film before 11am is only $1.50 which I think is a steal. Our only complaint is that the A/C was not working and it was very stuffy in there.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

261464965.name: Very pleasant art museum
261464965.author: a TripAdvisor user
261464965.reviewBody: Very pleasant art museum, local work, nice aesthetic change of pace from US museums.  The building itself is worthwhile also.\n\nThe natural history museum is kind of eh, but might be fun for kids

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

260217573.name: concha buika concert at cecut
260217573.author: a TripAdvisor user
260217573.reviewBody: had the pleasure to watch concha buika in concert at Cecuts Sala de Espectaculos.  A great little venue for concerts and plays in tijuana rio zone.  the acoustics are great and seating is numbered and comfortable.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

256583451.name: museum and entertaintment center
256583451.author: a TripAdvisor user
256583451.reviewBody: A very good place to visit for fun or just to know more of the cultural things related to Tijuana, there are small restaurants , big circular screen movies, theater, music, museum, art exhibitions, documentals, and a friendly staff.  they have big and accesible parking lot. elevators, ramps and is very clean also. The ramp at the parking lot is the only one that is  not very good.\nAnother thing is that it is not expensive at all.\nThey have presented big performances as latin salsa singer RUBEN BLADES  for free.  You have to check their calendar of events at their internet site.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

255263922.name: Plan for a day of fun, culture and learning
255263922.author: a TripAdvisor user
255263922.reviewBody: This complex features a history museum of the Californias, an OmniMax theatre, gift and book shops, coffee shops and sporadic cultural events. Check their website calendar for events. I\'ve enjoyed going there often since I was a kid.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

255032318.name: Nice museum
255032318.author: a TripAdvisor user
255032318.reviewBody: Close to Rio Mall or Galeria with nice expositions going on at the time of my visit, righy after the visit just cross the street and have a nice bite at the mall which is well served of a variety of kinds of restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

250413132.name: Tijuana Innovadora
250413132.author: a TripAdvisor user
250413132.reviewBody: Great place to visit!!! From i-max to theater. No se lo pueden perder. There\'s a great book store, expositions & many things to do.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

249359169.name: Off the tourist path
249359169.author: a TripAdvisor user
249359169.reviewBody: we viewed the exhibit on Baja California.  Was interesting to see from their perspective. \nThe site has potential as a cultural center but their programming is light, they are not geared toward tourists.   The IMAX has good reviews but it makes me seasick so we didn\'t see it. \nNot a bad walk from the border, but it\'s not in the direction where the crowd goes.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

247292517.name: Nice to visit
247292517.author: a TripAdvisor user
247292517.reviewBody: It\'s just interesting to learn a history a city or place i visit. Interesting attraction. Enjoyed an educational movie in IMAX

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

245653269.name: "CECUT"
245653269.author: a TripAdvisor user
245653269.reviewBody: It could use a paint job. Besides that, it is one of the finest structures in Tijuana. If you\'re coming from the US, leave your expectations in the states when you visit Mexico. Look with fresh eyes. If you\'re going to visit CECUT, don\'t go when it\'s boring. Follow their web page or look for exciting upcoming events being held there, then go when stuff is actually happening. People are what make the experience exciting. I visited during TJ Innovadora 2014 and it was a cool experience. The theater is very impressive.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

244304894.name: Wasn\'t as inbteresting as we\'d thought it would be
244304894.author: a TripAdvisor user
244304894.reviewBody: Interesting attraction, but overall, not as informative (or clean) as we\'d thought it would be. There are a number of people there to answer questions.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

241322893.name: Worth the visit
241322893.author: a TripAdvisor user
241322893.reviewBody: Unless you are from Tijuana, the last thing you think about is "Cultural Center".  As a Tijuanense (what us native Tijuana peeps are called), I can honestly say this OmniMax/Planetarium theater is world class.  I have been to IMAXs and planetariums all over the U.S. and Europe, and even my kids always say: "The one in TJ is better!" (my kids are not from Tijuana BTW).  \nThe theater offers 2-4 shows at any given time. Prices are a fraction from just about any other theater.  Yes, movies are dubbed in Spanish, but they do offer English soundtracks once in a while (ask). Even if you can\'t understand it, the theater experience is still amazing.\nThey have a little restaurant, live theater, museum featuring different exhibits (again world class exhibits -BodyWorks, Torture Devices from the Middle Ages, etc.) again, all this for a fraction of the price you would find just about anywhere else.  Check out the garden while you\'re there, as they often have folk dancing, music and all kinds of different regional artforms from all over Mexico (especially on the weekends).

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

239799531.name: Amazing Imax theater experience!
239799531.author: a TripAdvisor user
239799531.reviewBody: This is a must if you know your spanish the theater is incredible inside and out! It has a very iconic shape you cant miss it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

237911814.name: A must visit!
237911814.author: a TripAdvisor user
237911814.reviewBody: When visiting Tijuana, try to see where the locals go. Not only is the cultural center an architectural  feat, but the exhibits, performances and people watching is worth the detour from the tourist area.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

234352802.name: Very good option for a cultural trip in TJ
234352802.author: a TripAdvisor user
234352802.reviewBody: The options are very good, you always have a good educational movie in the IMAX, several expositions of art. the place is well maintained and located.\nEven if you have a couple of hours to spare this is a good option.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

234072798.name: Family friendly and educational
234072798.author: a TripAdvisor user
234072798.reviewBody: If you are coming to Tijuana for vacation or a day trip then CECUT is a must. During my visit I decided to do their permanent exhibit of Museum of Californias (Museo de las Californias), the aquarium and walk through their gardens. The museum was a walk through the history of the California peninsula. They had artifacts, replicas, paintings and scale models of different time periods throughout the history of both states (Baja California Norte and Sur). It was pretty educational. The aquarium was ok. It was small so you can walk through it in less than an hour and the fish tanks were also small, but they still had a pretty decent collection. The garden was also nice had replicas of mesoamerican sculptures and you can walk through it in less than 20 mins if you are on your own. I did notice they had tours. Again this is very family friendly. Very clean and safe place to take the family.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

231461472.name: Excellent!
231461472.author: a TripAdvisor user
231461472.reviewBody: Although we visited on a Monday and everything was closed, we were still able to tour the jaw dropping CECUT with its amazing architecture that so well speaks to modern  Mexico with a traditional language from its ancient cultures. A landmark!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

226076615.name: Newly Renovated & Fantastic
226076615.author: a TripAdvisor user
226076615.reviewBody: Everyone who visits Tijuana should try to find some time to visit the Culteral Center (Spanish Acronym CECUT).  There is a lovely free botanical garden, an IMAX theater, a concert hall, a permanent history of the Californias exhibit and multiple traveling exhibits.  The new section of the building called "El Cubo" is a modern art exhibition space that rivals any similar space in San Diego.  There is always something interesting going on at CECUT.  Also, Sundays are free admission days for everything eXcept the IMAX theater and the concert hall.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

225993697.name: Great cultural trip
225993697.author: a TripAdvisor user
225993697.reviewBody: Lots of activities for families and young children,Sunday so some attractions were free. Attractions include Imax, art galleries, exhibit on the history of Baja, aquarium and while we were there a performance of traditional Mexican dancing. Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

224083780.name: Hit and miss even for a local
224083780.author: a TripAdvisor user
224083780.reviewBody:
Oh CECUT, how you do try. And don't...
I probably know a bit more about the politics of this place than most tourists passing through, but I'll spare you so many details and recommend checking it out - without any expectations. (I should put that in bold lettering, but I don't want to yell it at you.) 
There isn't much of a budget for anything, let alone proper advertising so I have often walked with surprise into fairs of all kinds. The yearly book fair is one of the best events they put on.
The center shows local artist and big names from Mexico City; stuff you don't usually get to see. They have had some fantastic photography shows.  And when they get a real curator in to do an exhibition - what a difference it makes! 
If for any reason you are strapped for cash, go on Sundays when it is free and then splurge on something from the gift shop... :)

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

221150760.name: Tour of Tijuana
221150760.author: a TripAdvisor user
221150760.reviewBody: In San Diego, we were picked up by Viotar touring bus and the driver\'s name was Mike. Before we could enter into Mexico we had to go through customs and get our passports stamped, armed police with machine guns. Once we were cleared to enter we were picked up by our tour bus. Mike drove us around in the bad side of town and then the good side. He introduced us to a store dealer and we went in and looked around and my wife found a pocketbook she liked and then they were going back and forth till they both came to an amount. The pocketbook is really nice and at the right price. Handicap means nothing there, it is all easy to get too. We stopped in to some of the eateries and sampled some of the food. When it came to drink, they say don\'t drink the water. After looking around and seeing the locals drinking water I ordered water and it was nice and cold and did not get sick from drinking the water. It was nice getting around, all the store owners were out on the sidewalks trying to get you into their store. All kept saying was "come in my friend", they made us laugh. It is a poor area and they say that not many Americans come to Tijuana any more, too bad, they seem to be good people, just poor.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

219812452.name: Tijuana Cultural Center
219812452.author: a TripAdvisor user
219812452.reviewBody: Loved the Cultural Center in downtown Tijuana. We visited on a Sunday so some attractions were free. Attractions include Imax, art galleries, exhibit on the history of Baja, aquarium and while we were there a performance of traditional Mexican dancing. Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

211866362.name: Nice IMAX theater
211866362.author: a TripAdvisor user
211866362.reviewBody: very good theater and museum, close to Pacific Dental Tijuana, where I visited Dr Lutz for a fantastic routine visit, had some work done last week and visited the theater about 2 blocks from his place

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

210093637.name: Low admission but only limited access
210093637.author: a TripAdvisor user
210093637.reviewBody: Did think they did a good job on the main exhibit BUT to see the Aquarium, and any of the others, each one had another charge.\nLots of walking. It was to hot to walk the gardens which were free. gift shop very pricey

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

209090551.name: Thirty years of Culture in Tijuana
209090551.author: a TripAdvisor user
209090551.reviewBody: Cheap underground parking, two book shops, clean bathrooms, great art exhibits and spaces.  Near a mall and restaurants a mile to the border.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

207890711.name: Beautiful
207890711.author: a TripAdvisor user
207890711.reviewBody: Sometimes they have a lot of events , but there is no budget for promoting their attractions and you have to do all the work looking for schedules and things of that nature. Very comfortable and classic modern look.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

207872294.name: Baja History
207872294.author: a TripAdvisor user
207872294.reviewBody: We spent two hours at the Cultural Center, and learned a lot about Baja California and Mexico. It was extremely interesting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

202491223.name: Community Cultural Center
202491223.author: a TripAdvisor user
202491223.reviewBody: Have attended concerts, comedianes and art displays many times at CeCut. Centrally located in Zona Rio CeCut provides a wide variety of events and activities throughout each month with special artists, IMAX theatre films, political and cultural talks as well as just fun entertainment. Do not miss CeCut if you have the time while in Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

198836341.name: The best multicultural site in Tj. Visit "La bola" !!!!
198836341.author: a TripAdvisor user
198836341.reviewBody: As my hometown i recomend the CECUT as the place ti visit while in Tijuana. It has a museum with Baja California history, art and photo expos all around the year, an aquarium, free matinee, shows, concerts,ballet,theater & the IMAX dome known in here as "la bola" . The prices are very average for good entertaining and great family fun. Also 1 Saturday of each month they have a presentation of the juvenile symphonic of Baja California and you can spend a nice evening with your family or friends for free. Be sure to visit one of our lovely landmarks here south of the border. Enjoy!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

198795565.name: Visit to CECUT
198795565.author: a TripAdvisor user
198795565.reviewBody: Enjoyed both exhibits. Outdoor garden very nicely done. Loved the architecture. Did not stay for Imax film.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

190034173.name: Interesting to say the least
190034173.author: a TripAdvisor user
190034173.reviewBody: We were so worried about going here with all the murders reported in this little city, so we took a tour. We felt very safe, however the only place we were let off is Revolutionary street were you can do nothing but eat and shop. its all about bargaining. You have the haggle and haggle not to be overcharged. We had a bad experience at lunch when we ordered off the menu with prices and then were charged for two diet cokes the cost of our meal plus a 15% tax (???). Totally ripped off, we did not have that kind of money left so they took what we had. If you want to load up on your american prescriptions you can here, not sure of the quality, but I dont think they are dangerous. Good non haggle prices here.
