And you can get just about any prescription drug you can think of. You are not suppose to take them back, so keep them on your person since they dont strip search you or make you go through a metal detecter (only your bags). We are glad we went to see it, but dont think we would go back. Lots of nice hand made stuff but you can play one store off the other since they have pretty much the same things (almost no made in china here). There were lots of americans leaving mexico in their cars when we left almost every car that went through (huge line) had california plates.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

185822177.name: Cultural :)
185822177.author: a TripAdvisor user
185822177.reviewBody: The Cecut is a great place to go see art and IMAC shows. They also do a lot of fun festivals, some are free and some have a cover.  We\'ve seen local bands, salsa bands, spanish rock bands.  The Imac shows are great and the museum inside about Baja California is very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

178771551.name: Best sight seeing
178771551.author: a TripAdvisor user
178771551.reviewBody: Museum , IMAX theater and gallery all combined what else can u ask for, near to the shopping center mall and food district

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

177037374.name: Tour across the boarder to Tijuana, MX
177037374.author: a TripAdvisor user
177037374.reviewBody: We took a tour bus that offered few hour tours to Tijuana. There they let us out to shop and eat. Stroll around a bit to find neat souvenirs. We also tried a taco restaurant too. It was a bit sad to see children begging on the street and selling gum to bring money home.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

170056425.name: The heart of Tijuana
170056425.author: a TripAdvisor user
170056425.reviewBody: When you come to Tijuana, your #1 priority should be visiting CECUT. Start with the museum, and then finish your tour by watching a film in the Omnimax theater, one of the best experiences you\'ll ever have. Also, check the schedule, you may be lucky enough to catch a food, music or art exposition.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

170010382.name: We love CECUT
170010382.author: a TripAdvisor user
170010382.reviewBody: We go here everytime we are in TJ - you will never know what you might find.  We attended an amazing free concert once -- We use CECUT as a central place to meet friends when we travel to TJ, but often, we go inside and enjoy it first.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

169776686.name: Change your mind about Tijuana
169776686.author: a TripAdvisor user
169776686.reviewBody: The city is growing, and so is the cultural experience in Tijuana. with the new Tijuana Cultural Center there are always great festivals with traditional folk dancing, traditional foods, art and expositions, not to mention the Omnimax theater

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

169752636.name: MEXICAN CULTURE
169752636.author: a TripAdvisor user
169752636.reviewBody: The architecture and displays are first rate. All sorts of cultural activities. Museum, music, theatre, movies, books, paintings, tec.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

169752434.name: Nice, interesting place to visit.
169752434.author: a TripAdvisor user
169752434.reviewBody: Has good art expos. Near the border. Clean, well presented. An important cultural place to visit. It\u00b4s also right next to a good shopping center.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

167342915.name: SAN DIEGO SCENIC TOURS
167342915.author: a TripAdvisor user
167342915.reviewBody: We used the San Diego Scenic Tours company for an afternoon in Tijuana on 5-30-13. The experience with this company was excellent. I will definitely use them again since it was a great price, professional and fun. We did the San Diego & Tijuana Tours (Tour A-222). They picked us up in a medium size tour bus with large windows and comfortable seats at a nearby hotel and offered a live tour as we drove around San Diego and Tijuana. Sections of Tijuana has really cleaned up a lot and I felt very safe. We had enough free time to shop, visit Cultural Center & dine. Important Tips: Remember to call the night before to confirm your tour reservations; Be on time; Stay in the areas shared by the great Tour Guide.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

166065560.name: The best spot in Tijuana
166065560.author: a TripAdvisor user
166065560.reviewBody: My teen grandkids wanted to cross the border, but what do do there to justify the drive? I do not like to drive across the border, I walk, so I needed something within walking distance. I searched for something clean and interesting that reflected the culture rather than the desperation for tourist dollars, and this place is perfect. Wonderful staff, informative displays, lovely botanical garden, beautiful grounds, and a small aquarium...all dirt cheap. This is best approached from the north side of the river, as that side is much less tourist-driven. It is approximately a mile from the starting point of the Tijuana walk.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

165480970.name: Excelellent Place
165480970.author: a TripAdvisor user
165480970.reviewBody: Since the new director arrived CECUT has gottn a facelift inside and out. Everything has changed for the better. If you haven\'t been there for a while I definitely recommend you go again...Love watching the IMAX movies

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

163873926.name: Annual Book Fair with Music
163873926.author: a TripAdvisor user
163873926.reviewBody: Check out the dates for the book fair. It was wonderful just wish I had known about it in advance. Live music, food, authors, and of course, loads of books-Spanish/English.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

162347217.name: Tijuana\'s Cultural Corner
162347217.author: a TripAdvisor user
162347217.reviewBody: CECUT really has lots of nice expositions every now and then. Not to mention, the screening of many foreign films and the IMAX dome which is a landmark of the city.\nThey added an aquarium that is good for the price you pay (about 3-5 Dlls I think) some really nice fish but it\'s pretty small.\nThere\'s a coffee shop with a nice atmosphere, good for waiting before the theater presentation.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

161629713.name: Wa-wa
161629713.author: a TripAdvisor user
161629713.reviewBody: Boring...there was nothing going on while we were there.  I would call ahead to make certain you can actually do something.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

161220349.name: Awesome Architecture
161220349.author: a TripAdvisor user
161220349.reviewBody: We spent five hours here seeing exhibits in the Cultural Center and an IMax movie in the beautiful theatre known as "La Bola".  We  came across surprising performances in different parts of the complex including Folklorico Dance, bands and singers.  On Sundays the museum is free and other tickets are discounted.  The IMax movie was less than $2.00 each.  The schedule changes often so I will definitely be back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

160817011.name: Culture south of the border
160817011.author: a TripAdvisor user
160817011.reviewBody: Stopped in here with a friend to see what was new.  It was my first time here.  It was definitely worth a visit.  Tijuana has such a negative imagine north of the border which is definitely misplaced.  I was surprised at what this place has to offer.  People were practicing martial arts out front.  It has an Imax and several different exhibits displaying local Indian and Mexican history.  Everyone is familiar with the Mission History in San Diego but no so much in Baja.  This place brings it to life along with the local history relative to what was going on in the world at the time.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

159101550.name: Great shows you may not find at home
159101550.author: a TripAdvisor user
159101550.reviewBody: There is opera, music and theatre and an interesting local community attending, also many San Diego residents are subscribed to regular programmes. Probably the most active cultural center in Baja California.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

158630503.name: A Gem in Tijuana
158630503.author: a TripAdvisor user
158630503.reviewBody: Tijuana can be a little intimidating, especially if you haven\'t been there for awhile.  But the area near CECUT is an oasis of calm and beauty.  CECUT is a "find."  It is a gem - one of the great secrets of this border city.  Its architecture can rival any museum in the US.  Well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

158025647.name: Definitely Worth a Luck
158025647.author: a TripAdvisor user
158025647.reviewBody: Most people who visit Tijuana never see the attactions of this area.  There is a performing arts center that has world class ballet, music, and other shows.  The museum has revolving exhibits including recently a macabre display of execution equipment. The art museum is small but definitely worth a visit. \n\nI would include this on you itinerary regardless of how many times you have visited Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

156666931.name: Tijuana is a crazy place!
156666931.author: a TripAdvisor user
156666931.reviewBody: We drove down from San Diego for a day trip, left the car in the USA and walked over, it was a great day of experience, colour and sunshine... we ate some fantastic food, and had some beers in the sun, enjoyed the markets and outdoor music, did a bit of shopping... It was everything I expected, and having never been to Mexico I was glad that it looked so \'Mexican\' even though I appreciate this is just for tourists!\nComing back over the border was another story though... as we approached, we saw a huge, huge queue of thousands of people, just waiting to cross, with estimated waiting times of six hours! We were stupid and hadn\'t factored this in... so a man with a van came out from the crowd, and said he was a tour guide who would get us over quicker, in his van,... on we hopped with some other tourists, for about 10 dollars each, half thinking we were taking our life in our hands, and half thinking, well, what do we have to lose? So we sat in the traffic for ages, and then he translated he would drive us to the less busy nearby border... at breakneck speeds! Let us off the bus so we queued in the sun for about two hours, eventually got through the border... and there he was, waiting for us, just as he said, to take us to our car!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

156652880.name: Yumanos exibition
156652880.author: a TripAdvisor user
156652880.reviewBody: Great opportunity to explore the Yumanos ethnic group which was the original inhabitants of Baja California, near San Jose del Cabo and located in the " La Zorra Canyon" very nice display of handicraft, etc

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

154595446.name: Fantastic!
154595446.author: a TripAdvisor user
154595446.reviewBody:
Modern, architecturally beautiful building-- clean lines and open spaces. I visited with friends today and just had to write a great review for them. The staff at the museum is helpful and will stay out of your way. The area around the ticket booth is used for photography exhibits from local artists, there is a great cafeteria (very good sandwiches & lattes). When you enter the museum, called "Museo de las Californias" (museum of the Californias) you are greeted by several acrylic cloth works hanging from the ceiling, depicting varied points of view on living in a border city like Tijuana. 

Two exhibits, "Yumanos" indigenous tribes of northern Baja California, and the permanent "History of Baja California". There is an Imax theater, a Film Club area and a performance theater.

Souvenir shop is nice and unassuming, prices are not low but the merchandise is great. 

I am definitely going back. If you are visiting Tijuana, Mexico, you should not miss it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

149508942.name: Beautiful!
149508942.author: a TripAdvisor user
149508942.reviewBody: This very modern, architecturally interesting building houses a range of exhibits and programs, some but not all for free.  On the January day we visited there was an intriguing show of hanging panels (some painted, others in montage) featuring artists from all of Latin America.  We also saw a wonderful exhibit of paintings and sculptures by a Polish artist.  Gardens also are lovely.  A nearby modern shopping mall has several options for dining. The center is easy to find and parking is available, but re-crossing the border is a nightmare.  Better to walk into Mexico and catch a cab or bus.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

146107659.name: Friedeberg exhibit
146107659.author: a TripAdvisor user
146107659.reviewBody: An exhibit of the Mexican surrealist.\nExtensive exhibit of sculpture paintings, prints. Excellent art. Excellent presentation and venue,

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

143802523.name: good experience
143802523.author: a TripAdvisor user
143802523.reviewBody: great mo 3D movies. it always has expositions, art , theater plays, pain exhibits; you name it. CECUT is one of Tij icons

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

142596960.name: EnTijuanArte 2012@ CECUT
142596960.author: a TripAdvisor user
142596960.reviewBody: Visited this weekend for a big art exhibition, many many local artists in a festival type presentation food stall and music, did not go to museum this time around but looks like they have renovated a lot since last time I was there.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

141195432.name: The other side of Tijuana
141195432.author: a TripAdvisor user
141195432.reviewBody:
Most Americans think of Tijuana in terms of downtown, cheap beer and crime. But there's another Tijuana of elegant suburbs, excellent restaurants and great art.

CECUT is a fabulous establishment. Its exhibition on Baja alone is worthwhile -- highly creative and excellently executed. But there are usually also intriguing temporary exhibits: I saw some amazing avant garde stuff. And then there is the IMAX cinema and all sorts of other activities.

Tijuana has also has opera, concerts, much more. So go and discover! You'll be glad you did!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

134482780.name: Getting tired, but hopefully renovations will help
134482780.author: a TripAdvisor user
134482780.reviewBody:
Saw a movie their theater, seats not as comfortable as a Cinepolis and small screen. Volume was too low, but wide isles if you need to get out and not bother others too much. 

The IMAX theater needs better titles like USA IMAX locations. 

Remodeling was in progress, hopefully it will improve the visit the next time.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

133529812.name: Surprising
133529812.author: a TripAdvisor user
133529812.reviewBody: Very interesting visit, I hadn\'t been aware of the diverse selection of cultural and educational events it offers.  Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

132878388.name: Enjoyable Visit
132878388.author: a TripAdvisor user
132878388.reviewBody: Took taxi drive to museum, ($3.00) and was kinda lost when I got there. They are working in construction onsite and I didn\'t even know if the place was open. I was so lost and confused, but I asked and was directed to the ticket booth where I paid $5.00 for three tickets to see the exhibition "Las Californias." My teenage kids and I were very well pleased with the exhibition. It was very, very nice and we were able to take pics of almost everything, except the wall paintings. I had to leave my backpack at the entrance and claim it after I came out, but that was okay. I didn\'t have anything important in the bag.\n\nI would\'ve loved to stay to watch a movie in the imax theater, but my teenage son didn\'t want to wait until 4 p.m. for the show.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

130201523.name: great place for culture enrichment!
130201523.author: a TripAdvisor user
130201523.reviewBody: This place has a museum and an omnimax. Plays and conserts and more everyday. if you want culture here you will find it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

129953484.name: Surprisingly beautiful to visit
129953484.author: a TripAdvisor user
129953484.reviewBody: nice imax show and the place is beautiful.  The rio plaza is a close walk and the taxi from Revolucion only cost me 30 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

129381925.name: Great Art Work
129381925.author: a TripAdvisor user
129381925.reviewBody: Enjoyed a wonderful art exhibit here, I thought from reading the outside I was going to see a Freida C. exhibit, but my spanish was rusty and it was more modern art, but it was really good and interesting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

126019046.name: my place to chill
126019046.author: a TripAdvisor user
126019046.reviewBody: love their CUBO , just the place to walk around w/ a cup of coffe , they have ENTIJUANARTE comming a must to check out

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

125849266.name: A contemporary bussiness center and IMAX teather
125849266.author: a TripAdvisor user
125849266.reviewBody: Famous for tis "globe like" IMAX teather, this cultural center has a very nice areas. I was here to visit an international congress of entrepreneaurs. And before that I ente to watch an IMAX movie.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

125193883.name: these people are serious about culture
125193883.author: a TripAdvisor user
125193883.reviewBody: there\'s always something interesting to watch or do. wednesdays there are group readings, you can sign up on facebook and find out what anthropologist is coming to town. last time i learned the mayan numeral system. there\'s always free coffee and snacks during their lectures. the museum costs, and so do the IMAX movies. but it\'s good, parking is cheap, the installations have a new-york vibe. pretty cool just south of the border.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

122308201.name: Cultura y Educaci\u00f3n
122308201.author: a TripAdvisor user
122308201.reviewBody: I was pleasantly surprised by the amount to activities and functions going on. We visited the IMAX theather and the museum. We would like to come back for the opera. www.cecut.gob.mx

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

121891719.name: Where Culture and Cool collide
121891719.author: a TripAdvisor user
121891719.reviewBody: wether it been taking the kids to an amazingly produced play, browsing the current artist in residence expo or taking a casual guitar class taught by a prodigious 13 year old, this place has everything you need for a fun and relaxing cultural outing - don\'t miss out the constant influx of jazz events, regional performances, IMAX experiences and stand up!

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

39022086.name: Learn about how TJ used to be
39022086.author: a TripAdvisor user
39022086.reviewBody: The Museo de las Californias was a lot bigger than I thought it would be.  It has tons of replicas of, as well as a few original, artifacts and detailed explanations of everything on display.  I also really liked all the old photographs of TJ and pictures taken from the air back when it was a small little pueblo.  Outside is a garden full of Mesoamerican sculptures and statues, but well shaded from the hot sun, so it\'s comfortable even on hot days.  It\'s free on Sundays, too.  What better way to spend a hot Sunday afternoon?

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

14816054.name: Don\'t miss CECUT !
14816054.author: a TripAdvisor user
14816054.reviewBody:
If you're headed to Tijuana for a day or three, I highly recommend spending a few hours at CECUT (Centro Cultural Tijuana), the cultural center of the city located in Zona Rio (a nice area).  There are art exhibitions, an OMNIMAX theatre, an archaeological outdoor garden museum, an excellent (no doubt one of the best in the world) permanent exhibition of Baja California history, an indoor restaurant; and periodic lectures and musical and dance performances.  Prices are reasonable and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  Tours are available for groups, including school groups, which I've arranged several times (I'm a teacher).
I think their number is (from the States) [--].
Don't miss it!

John Jenstad
Tecate Christian School
Tecate, CA

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

696849.name: Outstanding
696849.author: a TripAdvisor user
696849.reviewBody: This place made our Tijuana visit really memorable. The history of northern Baja inside is fascinating, the IMAX theater is excellent, and we even saw the Grammy-nominated Baja Orchestra play in the new orchestra hall, which has excellent acoustics. For anybody who thinks Tijuana is just the Avenida Revolucion, obnoxious hawkers and cheap margaritas, this is a must-see.\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes #9350 Zona Urbana Rio

603485996.name: not for tourists
603485996.author: a TripAdvisor user
603485996.reviewBody: This is a University that offers no sights for tourists. If you are here, you are on official business only... so skip this place.\n\nthey used to have some Cimarr\u00f3n goats here for a nourishment program but not anymore. skip it.

510672327.name: Main campus of state university
510672327.author: a TripAdvisor user
510672327.reviewBody: Well-ranked educational institution located on Otay mesa near the airport.  This is one of the state of Baja California\'s sources of pride and, although not a traditional \'tourist\' destination, interesting to see for those adventurous enough to venture off the popular beaten path.

401482639.name: My Alma Matter
401482639.author: a TripAdvisor user
401482639.reviewBody: My college- miss those days- great school... it has changed so much from early 90\'s to now... they have remodel the cafeteria - the parking and some of the buildings.

304586714.name: Nothing to see
304586714.author: a TripAdvisor user
304586714.reviewBody: For tourist point of view and if you don\'t study there, there is nothing to see there. Some universities have nice campus that you can go for a walk or visit but this one don\'t. Maybe the only place to visit is the sports center.

217596058.name: Evento Social Comunitario
217596058.author: a TripAdvisor user
217596058.reviewBody: Excellent University, the best in baja and North California\nhas the best teachers and Faculties.Very proud to be\nfrom TJ

171510739.name: VISIT A CAMPUS SOUTH OF THE BORDER.
171510739.author: a TripAdvisor user
171510739.reviewBody: Some times we visit a city and miss some of its positive attractions. Going through the "UABC" campus in Tijuana you\'ll be able to mingle with the best of TJ\'s younger generation. You can grab a bite at the Cafeteria and watch the students and faculty interacting. We are sproud of our most important institution of higher education in Baja California.

663396395.name: Disappointed perhaps it was just the Day
663396395.author: a TripAdvisor user
663396395.reviewBody: We went to Tijuana for just the day from San Diego and let\'s just say that it was a waste of a day.  The Market and shopping district was very underwhelming.   It was a rainy day to start with however we found nothing amazing or unique about it.  The downtown area is very dirty and there are so many vendors harassing you we just did not have fun.  Would not waste my time going there again.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

662542651.name: Local  Market
662542651.author: a TripAdvisor user
662542651.reviewBody: Lots of fun stuff to buy and eat. Plenty  Artisan Crafts, cremains, leather, shoes, anything the traveler likes to collect. Safe place for the gringos.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

662429516.name: Nice
662429516.author: a TripAdvisor user
662429516.reviewBody: When visiting Tijuana El popo market is a nice stop. Many interesting choices.  You will have an enjoyable time.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

644431335.name: Very nice
644431335.author: a TripAdvisor user
644431335.reviewBody: I enjoyed my visit to Playas and even eat some good tamales. The area has plenty of places to eat, drink, and listen to live music. The ocean view was wonderful.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

617981705.name: INTERESTING PLACE WITH LOTS OF TYPICAL MEXICAN THINGS TO BUY
617981705.author: a TripAdvisor user
617981705.reviewBody: Very colorful, everything you can imagines is there. Great selection of cheeses in all type, handicraft articles and nice people.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

612100650.name: Ally way shopping with locals
612100650.author: a TripAdvisor user
612100650.reviewBody: There are lots of locals shopping in this little covered ally way. Local cheese, herbs and chille, vegetable and fruits, spices and sweets. Candle shop put much colors on walkway. My favorite is hard ware store in the corner carrying pots and pans, toltilla makers, etc., etc., bet you can find nice souvenirs for non touristic price.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

551670849.name: Local groceries and arts
551670849.author: a TripAdvisor user
551670849.reviewBody: Comparing to the americanized plaze santa cecilia this felt not that touristy, you did not have to stop every second because people forced you to buy stuff. All the mexicans are really friendly and helpful here.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

538627596.name: Very small market!
538627596.author: a TripAdvisor user
538627596.reviewBody: Small market, did not find it that interesting, Market Hidalgo is much bigger and better.  Ut if you are in the center of town, do go and have a look, of course!

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

532917216.name: Smaller Version of Mercado Hidalgo
532917216.author: a TripAdvisor user
532917216.reviewBody: Good market to visit if you\'re anyway walking along the main tourist drag in Tijuana, Avenida Revolucion. They have a bit of everything and it provides for some nice photo opportunities. Spend 10-15 minutes looking around here and you\'re done unless you decide to purchase something.\n\nFor a more exciting experience, I recommend to visit the much larger Mercado Hidalgo, Guadalupe Victoria 2, Zona Urbana Rio Tijuana. It also has the advantage of being on walking distance from the large shopping complex Plaza Rio.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

467288077.name: Great place
467288077.author: a TripAdvisor user
467288077.reviewBody: I\'ve been here many times.. great one stop shop to buy souvenirs and something for yourself. Just please be careful buying jewelry!! I mean buying what looks to be gold! Buyer beware and everywhere there\'s NO  REFUND!! Keep that in mind.. But overall go during the daytime.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

465698733.name: Lots of stuff
465698733.author: a TripAdvisor user
465698733.reviewBody: Lots to look at but It was too much for me as a tourist for buying. There was food, pottery, candles, and any trinket you could imagine.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

451251909.name: Find everything in one place
451251909.author: a TripAdvisor user
451251909.reviewBody: This market is pretty much a big bazaar. You find everything from fresh groceries to clothing, souvenirs, medicine etc... If you want to get a taste of the Mexican culture this is a great place to check out and get some good colorful pictures too. Just make sure you don\'t visit on a busy day since it can get pretty crowded.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

435737547.name: Local flavor
435737547.author: a TripAdvisor user
435737547.reviewBody: In the evening I saw a lady with some device making tortilla in the street and I wanted one like that for myself. So, I asked her where she bought it from, and she told me that it came from Mercado de Popo, and gave me directions. The next day i was there, and yes I bought a few things for the kitchen. It is not that huge, but it has a very nice flavor. It is a place that you do not feel that you are taken over by big corporations. I really loved it. Just take some time to walk through.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

431625665.name: Authentic Mexican Market
431625665.author: a TripAdvisor user
431625665.reviewBody: El Popo is an authentic Mexican Market located downtown on Revolucion Ave. where you see the large clock on the sidewalk.  The market features fruits, vegetables, religious items, souveniers, and many other items.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

418694815.name: Great to look around
418694815.author: a TripAdvisor user
418694815.reviewBody: Stopped in here real quick...it\'s a great place to look around and get a feel for the market in Tijuana. Though I didn\'t purchase anything here, you can certainly find a wide variety of items.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

412792074.name: Viva Mexico
412792074.author: a TripAdvisor user
412792074.reviewBody: Jaja in this place you get nuts they sell everything you can and can\'t imagine is a great great place to visit is amazing .

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

391196408.name: Not a great market area. Walk the streets instead for a real Tijuana experience
391196408.author: a TripAdvisor user
391196408.reviewBody: Not a great market area. Walk the streets of Tijuana instead for an amazing mexican experience. This market place simply doesn\'t provide that experience

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

389941239.name: A shadow of its former self. There are more interesting places now
389941239.author: a TripAdvisor user
389941239.reviewBody: Unfortunately in the last two or three years the market has gone down, several shops closed. It has become a shadow of its former self. Still interesting for the newcomer, but if you are brave enough to step outside the city center, proceed to Mercado Hidalgo, only a short ride by colectivo away, and find a more interesting place there.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

386265282.name: Didn\'t really live up to expectations
386265282.author: a TripAdvisor user
386265282.reviewBody: I kept reading about how this was one of the best markets in Tijuana, huge, full of arts and crafts and great stuff to buy yada yada... I found it to be quite small with not much more on sale than spices, cheese and fruit. Fine for a colourful walk through, but not much in the way of tourist shopping. A bit disappointing. I found Mercado Hidalgo and the Artisanale market to be much better.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

362413956.name: Not like it use to be
362413956.author: a TripAdvisor user
362413956.reviewBody: First went here in 2003 and the place was buzzing. Went there recently and everything was so quiet. Shame to see the place go down hill

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

357469589.name: Great place to find herbs and natural grains
357469589.author: a TripAdvisor user
357469589.reviewBody: Spent part of the morning here with my wife and we found a lot of herbs, natural incense and grains at very reasonable prices. The are also a large variety of other types of shops from trinkets to religious statues. Something for everyone. \nWe also found most people spoke English though we are both Spanish speaking so this was not a necessity.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

349279850.name: Fun visit and good shopping
349279850.author: a TripAdvisor user
349279850.reviewBody: It\'s touristy but good touristy. I want with my daughter and we both really enjoyed checking out the shops and talking with shop owners and picking up some stuff to take home.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

338006481.name: Nice market
338006481.author: a TripAdvisor user
338006481.reviewBody: After reading reviews I was expecting a larger market with more art..... It is a nice traditional market with food, flowers, pots and pans, candy etc. On this rainy wednesday morning 9:30 it was almost empty of customers.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

337332528.name: Shop til you Drop
337332528.author: a TripAdvisor user
337332528.reviewBody: Great experience.  Felt very safe contrary to internet warnings.....crossed over the border without any hassle both ways.  There is an array of authentic items from art to herbs and many items in between.  I was pleasantly surprised to how many spoke enough English and embarrassed by my lack of Spanish.  But all who I interacted with were pleasant and gentle souls who understood my lack of Spanish as a second language

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

334486693.name: Loved it but not as much as the artisans market
334486693.author: a TripAdvisor user
334486693.reviewBody: Unique art. Got some delicious food and enjoyed walking around this mexican market. clsoe to the border!

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

320769575.name: Unique stuff, nice people.
320769575.author: a TripAdvisor user
320769575.reviewBody: Unique stuff, nice people. Lots of cool herbs, produce, handicrafts and stuff. I bought a tortilla press.Its an authentic Mexican market in a touristy border town.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

314494927.name: The "Real" Mexico!
314494927.author: a TripAdvisor user
314494927.reviewBody: I love this place. It is just outside the main touristy area and is a fun, clean and non-tourist market. I especially love the pride in the artistry of some of the displays . . particularly the chili pepper mounds.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

309291144.name: dont go alone
309291144.author: a TripAdvisor user
309291144.reviewBody: lots of shops were closed with locals hanging around seemingly doing nothing but watching you we never made it all the way thru for fear of  crime

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

305058704.name: Historial Tijuana Place
305058704.author: a TripAdvisor user
305058704.reviewBody: This is a historical local market to buy specailly for candies, almost every day is crowded, located in downtown Tijuana, con is need to search for parking spots

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

292275362.name: Short visit
292275362.author: a TripAdvisor user
292275362.reviewBody:
We were spending some time in San Diego so decided to take a quick trip to Mexico. We parked are car near the border and walked across for a short visit. A quick stop at the market to look around. A good place to get a few deals, lots of junk stuff but they are willing to negotiate. Some of the people can be a bit aggressive so just keep moving on. 
Anywhere around the border has people selling items or jewelry for bargain prices. Keep an eye on your personal things, the market can be quite crowded. 

One more tip to share is we picked up a few bottles of water and when we opened them they didn't crack like a new bottle. It seems like the guy we got them from maybe filled old bottles. 
It was fun for a short visit but we were happy to get back to San Diego

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

290255945.name: Walked across the border and visited the market and then left
290255945.author: a TripAdvisor user
290255945.reviewBody: Our one visit to Tijuana was brief.  We walked across the border just to get the kids to see Mexico.  We walked through the market, took a couple photos, got an ice cream and then left.  Make sure you take your passport.  I was told a drivers license would be good enough and was grilled on reentry.  I got back with the kids but should have been prepared.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

237777712.name: Photo Opportunity
237777712.author: a TripAdvisor user
237777712.reviewBody: Didn\'t really buy anything here, by the time we got over to the market, I\'d already picked up my souvenirs.  Although I didn\'t make any purchases, I really enjoyed my time here.  Very high energy, tons of people, and a thousand photo opportunities.  I took so many pictures that I almost exceeded the memory space left on my camera phone,  Next time, I plan to spend more time shopping.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

230588052.name: Came here last year, would come back time after time...
230588052.author: a TripAdvisor user
230588052.reviewBody: Has everything you might need in tijuana. Food, kitchen, everything. Massive pi\u00f1atas, quesos, hey, everything. Give it a visit.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

193917639.name: Terrible
193917639.author: a TripAdvisor user
193917639.reviewBody: Do not go here, we went with our 5 year old daughter for a look and it was hot, dirty and just didn\'t feel very safe. Its very dodgy, people are trying to pull you into their shops that are dark and full of junk. No thanku!!!!!! we sat at the bus stop for most of the time waiting to go back!!!

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

185586541.name: You just have to go to Tijuana
185586541.author: a TripAdvisor user
185586541.reviewBody: i came here eight years ago when i was 15 which was an eye opener.... but you just have to go even with a day tour

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

150792890.name: Worth a look to know
150792890.author: a TripAdvisor user
150792890.reviewBody: Mostly for locals, not manic. Full of good photo ops for your general market style pictures of herbs, foods, cheeses, etc. Seems a bit defunct.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

126018912.name: mexicos candyland
126018912.author: a TripAdvisor user
126018912.reviewBody: great for candies and cheeses , pinatas and mexican curios

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

6782350.name: Wonderful authentic Mexican market
6782350.author: a TripAdvisor user
6782350.reviewBody:
Just got back from 3 day trip to Tijuana, including an hour at Mercado El Popo on Saturday. I was the only tourist there. The market is not huge, but has lots of traditional Mexican items. The local people shop there, and it is like a different world.

Each stall has a specialty. One was a candy store, where you can sample delicacies like gloria caramel, white coconut alfajores, dulce de leche or walnut mazapan., and mouth watering Mexican chocolate. Dried and candied fruits include pineapple, mango, camotes, pumpkin, and chilacayote squash. 

Some shops have dozens of bins full of different types of chili peppers,  herbs, spices, and leaves used in cooking. One had potions and remedies, and a large Santa Muerte, which is the saint for some merchants. It was a large skeleton on an altar, decorated with flowers, cigarettes, and bottles of alcohol.

You will smell rows of strange cheeses, where you can buy samples to try. The cheso fresco cheese is different for each region of Mexico.

There are natural sponges, wooden tortilla presses, molcajete grinding stones, pumice stones, hollow wood for birds to build nests, quail eggs, large, flat dried and salted whole fish, and a dazzling jumble of items from all over Mexico.

address.streetAddress: C, Ninos Heroes y o Av. B 723-C

642176127.name: Worse than being MUGGED
642176127.author: a TripAdvisor user
642176127.reviewBody:
After 300 visits I'm through 
16% on football but try to cash
...they can't open the safe till Monday.
HORSES they screw you badly 
A 1000 TRIFECTA...you win ,$470
6% fee ...and they dont keep track of scratches 

Food is sub par MACHINES ARE HORRIBLE 
they even charge a fee to get your MONEY BACK 

Run away

640600780.name: Great Casino
640600780.author: a TripAdvisor user
640600780.reviewBody: When you travel to Tijuana Mexico and you are interested in a casino you will absolutely enjoy Caliente!  Great atmosphere!

626886159.name: Nice Place but Bad Customer Service
626886159.author: a TripAdvisor user
626886159.reviewBody: We are from Washington State. Went inside this huge Casino and Sportsbook yesterday. Nice place to spend a few hours at the Casino tables, slots and Sportsbook. Had a few beers and some snacks. Reasonable prices. The Customer Service was terrible. Check your tickets and count your money at the betting cashier. Dishonest Sportsbook staff. Not recommended for tourists.

626154321.name: Beware!!!
626154321.author: a TripAdvisor user
626154321.reviewBody: I have been going to this place regularly on a weekly/monthly basis for more than 20 years. I have never had any bad experience at this place until a few days ago. At 66 years of age and having a difficulty to walk due to back surgery, I was inside the sportsbook on Oct. 10th 2018. My friends at the table, recommended me to join the Caliente online Sportsbook, instead of walking back and forth to the betting counter. I did that and I was asked to make a deposit at any Caliente sportsbook. I went to the betting counter and met the female Manager who checked my driver\'s license as ID and assisted me to make a deposit of $400 in pesos which amounted to 7160 pesos. I sat at my table and enjoyed the games, while I placed some bets. I won some and lost some. Three days later October 13, 2019, I went back and placed some more bets. I also asked for 6000 pesos withdrawal from my balance. The Supervisor Juan at that time said I cannot get any money, until I go online and make a request. It takes 4 days for approval and they will send me a code. While at the sportsbook, I went online and filled the request. 4 days later I got an email with a code saying it has been approved. I went back to the same Caliente sportsbook at Casino Caliente on Oct. 16th. The Manager at that time Hector Rendon figured the amount to US $335.19. Then Hector asked me for my ID. I provided it as requested. First Hector said my approval is pending. Then I gave him the code I received. Hector said that he cannot pay me as they have no connection with Caliente Sportsbook. I asked for his Manager and then the Caliente Manager Oswaldo De La Cruz came and said the same thing. I asked Manager Oswaldo, if you took my deposit for $400 (7160 pesos) at this sportsbook, how can you not give me 6000 pesos? I was told to go online and make my request by calling them at 664-454-3333. I politely asked him to call and assist me. Oswaldo refused to help me and said it was my problem. He even refused to let me use the casino phone to make that call. \nI called using my cell phone and spoke to Alejandro right away. First Alejandro tried to deny that I made any deposit, then I reminded him, I am currently still making bets on that account and I will go to the police station (the Commandancia) and make a complaint. He then said, that is not necessary and I will get paid, but I have to upload my ID documents online (including proof of the receipt that I had made a deposit of 7160 pesos) and then I can withdraw from my account. I asked my wife to talk to him and he told her the same thing. I uploaded all the documents as requested. It has been 2 days and I have not received or heard from them yet. I will update the results as soon as I find out.

611050905.name: PLAY AND EAT !!!
611050905.author: a TripAdvisor user
611050905.reviewBody: All my friends play an drink at the Casino !! They were so happy !! And stay for hours having fun. And then we went to the Restaurant Mujeres Divinas !! and we all Love it !! Visit the Casino Caliente in Tijuana !!

594537178.name: Casino nights
594537178.author: a TripAdvisor user
594537178.reviewBody: I really enjoyed coming to this Casino right in the middle of the main strip, it is clean and so much fun

580447719.name: Great time and very helpful staff
580447719.author: a TripAdvisor user
580447719.reviewBody: We were a little apprehensive about getting started in the casino, specifically getting and loading the card.  We asked one of the staff and she said, Follow me, and took us right where we needed to go and summarized briefly what to do.  She then told us, come find me after you get the card loaded.  Pretty slick - get the card, go to the cashier and load it, and then just waive it in front of the sensor pad to transfer the funds to the machine.  Looking forward to our next visit.

567284840.name: A downtown casino?
567284840.author: a TripAdvisor user
567284840.reviewBody: We visted Casino Caliente twice during a recent visit to Tijuana and had fun - lots of machines the same as we often played in the States.  One of use won, the other broke even.....just like at home!  This casino is in the central zone and not the huge one pictured - we saw it driving around - this must be a \'satelite\' of the larger one, with the same name.  We showed our ID, got a \'player\'s card\' then loaded about 500 pesos on and played all evening.  Got something to eat and drink, very reasonable.  Separate area for smokers.  Nice.

565376798.name: Casino Caliente
565376798.author: a TripAdvisor user
565376798.reviewBody: First of all let me start by saying this Casino is not like any casino that you may have visited in the USA ,, you have to pay for parking and even if you are gambling you do not get free drinks.. you have to pay, the food is good and is not too expensive this particular casino has a race track for dogs and you can sit outside or at the restaurant to watch the races

551809120.name: A very nice casino (under reconstruction) with leagl sports betting
551809120.author: a TripAdvisor user
551809120.reviewBody: To enter, you must give the counterman your driver\'s license  so he can issue you a plastic card with you name on it. There are table games, slot machines, and sports betting (the only nearby legal sports betting outside of Las Vegas). The gambling\nis in Mexican pesos, so a $25 bet is about $1.50 US. You can feel like a high-roller! There is decent security and a metal detector at the entrance. The cashier readily converted my winnings back to dollars.  The restrooms are clean.  They are rehabbing the place, but it remains open.

462102197.name: Beautiful Casino
462102197.author: a TripAdvisor user
462102197.reviewBody: Has a wonderful time and great views of the grey hound races in the back of the Casino which I WON!!! won my first race.... ...fun betting and the animals are beautiful and the place is lovely and the service if wonderful

434121629.name: Craps time baby!!!
434121629.author: a TripAdvisor user
434121629.reviewBody:
It's super cheap to gamble, and with friends it's super fun.

Sure the place is dated, but around a craps table, it's super fun!!

Make sure you get an ID card when you enter. You need these to gamble. They are free and make life easy as hell

425046031.name: dog races
425046031.author: a TripAdvisor user
425046031.reviewBody: we visited the casino to have a little fun and watch the dog race. the casino was a little confusing if you don\'t speak or read spanish. its a club card system witch means you have to give your drivers licence or passport to obtain a card and put monies on it and if you don\'t speak Spanish and the person administering the program don\'t speak English it could be quiet the process lol. the machine will automatically load monies with your card and then you can play, when cashing out its all in Spanish so make sure you push the right button.

416292698.name: I expected more
416292698.author: a TripAdvisor user
416292698.reviewBody: I can not believe that the Bingo room is apart from the big casino. Besides they say the numbers really fast. It is terrible.

415160295.name: casino gaming
415160295.author: a TripAdvisor user
415160295.reviewBody: This is a huge casino, really lots of slot machines and table games, they also have live dog races where you can bet in different ways, good food, wine and drinks and all you need to enjoy a relaxing time in a nice and elegant surrounding.

406413644.name: Great time
406413644.author: a TripAdvisor user
406413644.reviewBody: They have dog races!  Really enjoyed playing there, wish they had more table games they get packed at night. Only down fall is the air conditioning it\'s  not great. It was HOT!  but manageable. and the restaurant was inexpensive and great food.  Oh, and you can eat at the tables and slot machines too, that was weird to see.

397395870.name: Good Times
397395870.author: a TripAdvisor user
397395870.reviewBody:
Went to Casino Caliente at the Hotel Pueblo Amigo in Tijuana.  It was a day visit rather than the evening to avoid long lines at the border on the way back.  

I really enjoyed playing Blackjack here, probably because I won some money and there were a couple of English speaking people at the table.  It was not a long walk back to the border as well, including the new PedWest walk way.

I ended up winning a bit of extra money and exchanged it to USD right at the casino.  I probably could have gotten a bit more keeping the Pesos and exchanging in San Ysidro, but not worth the hassle.

I will say, if traveling back, the new PedWest is excellent, although it is a bit of a walk.  If walking is no big deal, it is so much faster once you get there than the East pedestrian walk way.

377780969.name: Pretty good little casino
377780969.author: a TripAdvisor user
377780969.reviewBody: Relatively small for a casino, but well ventilated. There is a sports book to the left as you enter the front door and it tends to be pretty crowded, especially during big games. Over all a pretty good little gambling hall on Revolution Avenue.

363940502.name: Casino!
363940502.author: a TripAdvisor user
363940502.reviewBody: The old Jai Alai space is now the Casino in Tijuana. It is always nice to visit down town Tijuana every once in awhile.

357465347.name: casino caliente
357465347.author: a TripAdvisor user
357465347.reviewBody: Ok i like casito caliente i won 1000 dlrs last time i went .You only need to  be 18 to play not like Las vegas where you have to be like 25!Love Tijuana

340098196.name: Lower minimums then the other casino
340098196.author: a TripAdvisor user
340098196.reviewBody: This casino has lower table minimums then the other Casino Caliente further down on Avenida Revolucion about ten minutes walk. Its also smaller and less nicer than the other one of Avenida Revolucion. The best of the Casino Calientes is the one closest to the border connected to the hotel Plaza Pueblo. The table limits minimum here is only 10 pesos per hand which came out to about 60 cents per hand. Yes, you don\'t win much, but on the other hand you don\'t lose much either and a good way to pass a few hours. \n\nHere they only had a few tables as well just like their sister casino on Avenida Revolucion. If you have chips from one casino you can use the same chips to play at the other casino but in order to cash out you have to go back to the casino you originally purchased the chips at using the receipt they give you so thats something to keep in mind.

340096073.name: Great Casino to visit for a few hours
340096073.author: a TripAdvisor user
340096073.reviewBody:
I happened to stumble upon this casino while talking to the locals. This is a pretty small casino with a handful of tables and quite a bit of machines for people that like to play slots. I usually like to play at the tables so I checked out the tables. 

There is one roulette table, one crap table, one three card poker table, one blackjack table and one texas hold 'em poker table where you play against the house and not against each other. They also have a separate area where one is able to bet on american sports such as football and basketball as well as horse racing. The tables at this location is cheaper to play then lets say Vegas. The minimum bet is 30 pesos which comes out to be less than $2 a hand with the exchange rate. The sports betting for some reason takes place in American Dollars even if you bet money in pesos. Of the four bets i placed on the NFL playoffs I only won one and even though I placed the bet in pesos they gave me back my measly winnings in dollars. I only bet about $12 or 200 pesos on the game so not that I was a big gambler. 

Here, another thing unlike a casino in Vegas, you pay the money at the cage for however you want to start off with and they give you a receipt showing thats how much you paid in at the cage. Then you take that receipt and present it at the table and they will give you the equivalent amount in chips. Make sure to hang on to the receipt because you need the receipt to cash back your winnings otherwise they charge a 5% fee. I had fun when I played. 

This place might also not have all the tables staffed at all times. I went in on a Sunday afternoon and I wanted to play Texas Hold'em and they told me that they didn't have enough dealers to have that table open. There is also another Casino Cliente about ten minutes walk from this one on Avenida Revolucion so I just went there. It was a good way to pass a couple of hours and meet some interesting people playing over there.

636762325.name: Classic Bullring
636762325.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762325.reviewBody: A place that everyone who visits Playas Tijuana will see great place for events classic architecture

619075494.name: Meh
619075494.author: a TripAdvisor user
619075494.reviewBody: I came here with friends from New York, who insisted on coming. It did nothing for me. The venue was dirty and noisy, and the show boring. I\'ve seen much more entertaing bullfighter in Costa Rica.

536029157.name: Six bulls in 2 1/2 hours. WHAT A SHOW!
536029157.author: a TripAdvisor user
536029157.reviewBody:
I went in 2007 and watched two "Toreros" (bullfighters) take on six bulls. The best Torero of the day was "El Zapata" (The Shoe)  He was muy magnifico and was awarded an ear and a tail for his performance! (Had he been any better, he would have been awarded both ears and the tail)!

We sat three rings up from the sand on "La Sombra" (the shady side of the ring). You need to buy a cushion from a vendor in the ring in order to cushion your backside from the concrete seat. At the end of the show, most people throw their cushions onto the sand so that they can be resold to other visiting patrons. You can buy food, drink, and snacks throughout the entire 2 1/2 hour even, and some of the best seats in the house cost about $50.00 for the show. (It is worth every penny).

Bullfight season is from April through the end of October. If you can go, do it. It is a cultural experience that isn't to be missed.

I had the opportunity to shake the hand of the owner of the Plaza. What an honor! 

If you want to "step back in time" to the days of the Roman Gladiators go to the bullfights and enjoy when men faced death on a daily basis. It makes you appreciate your life and understand that it is tenuous at best.

493552628.name: Beautiful structure
493552628.author: a TripAdvisor user
493552628.reviewBody: This is a beautiful structure with history. I had a local give the history of where bull fights used to be a regular venue. Now I understand it is for a yearly bull fight and concerts. It is also a close walk to the beach and great restaurants. I viewed this from the outside of the walls as there were no events scheduled at the time.

365883343.name: Renewed placed !!
365883343.author: a TripAdvisor user
365883343.reviewBody: Hello,\n\nThis is an storical place to visit because you can enjoy bull fights, music concerts and big massive events. It has a big parking lot and thw plus is that you need only to walk 100 ft to reach the beach, the place needs a little bit more of maintenance, on the sorroundings you could find a lot of restaurants and food to go as well.

363661969.name: Great BULLFIGHT (Corrida)
363661969.author: a TripAdvisor user
363661969.reviewBody: Great event. Farewell apperance of ZOTOLUCO...and the worlds best REJONEADOR (On Horse)..PABLO HERMOSO DE MENDOZA. Super event. Great show. A must if in Town at same time.

357785357.name: Playas!
357785357.author: a TripAdvisor user
357785357.reviewBody: Having lived in Playas for over Fifteen Years!\nI have driven by this Monument almost every Day it seems.\nThe Bullring by the sea...

337752128.name: I DON\u00b4T LIKE BULLFIGHTING, BUT IT IS A UNIQUE BUILDING
337752128.author: a TripAdvisor user
337752128.reviewBody: ITS LOCATION MAKES IT A GREAT PLACE TO KNOW. IT IS JUST IN THE CORNER OF TIJUANA NO MORE THAN 20 steps from the border and across the street from the Pacific.  If you\u00b4re visiting Tijuana I do recommend to go to this site (it is not open all day however you can take pictures from the outside). It also serves as a concert hall on weekends.

335704316.name: Nice Place to Visit and see bullfitghts
335704316.author: a TripAdvisor user
335704316.reviewBody: if your squeamish about blood don\'t go to a bullfight but is a long standing cultural tradition with wonderful highlights and good time good food atmosphere

326690779.name: Bullfighting Ring By The Sea
326690779.author: a TripAdvisor user
326690779.reviewBody:
On November 8, 2015 a friend and I went to the bullfights held here and had a great time. Very few Americans were around to take in this cultural event. Some people want to do away with these events but I appreciate the historical and cultural aspect of it. Who knows someday these events will end in Mexico so I can say I was there. There were a total of three bullfighters and they each fought two bulls. Depending on the skills as judged by the audience, by show of waving white handkerchiefs, the bullfighter either is handed no ears, one ear or two ears from the bull after it has been put down.
Obviously animal lovers will hate this sport, but as I said who I am to judge.. The bullring is located in a section of Tijuana called Playas De Tijuana and is located very close to the ocean and not very far from the border fence. We were in Rosarito so we took the public taxi van from there to downtown then transferred to another van than took us right to the bull ring. Each ride cost 18 pesos which is about $1.10 at todays exchange rate. They sell tacos and stuff outside the bullring at great prices just outside the ring but inside the gate. The vendors also walk around inside selling snacks, cokes, beer, souveniers  and cigars. I bought a Maria and Lenin cigar made in Mexico that I really enjoyed. The beers cost $30 pesos which is a couple of U.S. dollars. 
There is huge parking lot and they charge $60 pesos or about $4 U.S. to park.
If you dont feel comfortable driving here from the U.S., although I do as I have a weekend home in Rosarito, you can walk across the border and jump on the public bus to centro, or downtown, then transfer to public bus going to Playsa.
There is another bullfight coming up on November 21, 2015 but unfortunately I can't make it.
I loved everything about it including the music etc.

473697383.name: Charming and diverse park
473697383.author: a TripAdvisor user
473697383.reviewBody: The small zoo features a white tiger, cute monkeys, and some beautiful birds.  Nice entrance plaza, plenty of secure parking costs 20 pesos.  There is a good snack shop with pizza that smelled great (we didn\'t eat, just bought some bottled water). Cute train ride for kids. Very family friendly place

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

437474607.name: Family Reunion
437474607.author: a TripAdvisor user
437474607.reviewBody: Wow this park has it all!!!!! From zoo to all the food and vendors that you can think of in a park. They also have games and bicycles that you can rent by the hour  to cruize around the park and take in all the sites.

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

429827743.name: Good for a jog or spending some calm couple of hours
429827743.author: a TripAdvisor user
429827743.reviewBody: Theres a little uninteresting zoo and some standard gardens. It has quite some attractions if you\'re visiting with your family, which is nice. If you\'re on your own, go for a walk or to read a book.

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

363948563.name: Parque Morelos
363948563.author: a TripAdvisor user
363948563.reviewBody: Parque Morelos!\nIs a nice place to sit down and relax on the grass, take a walk, or even have the childrens Birthday party!

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

361828516.name: Huge Municipal Park With Many Fun Attractions
361828516.author: a TripAdvisor user
361828516.reviewBody: Miniature Choo-Choo Train for the kids, zoo, food stalls, lakes, fountains, etc.  This is a multi-purpose city park designed for family fun.  Lots of parking.  Entry fee.

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

357470981.name: parque/Park morelos
357470981.author: a TripAdvisor user
357470981.reviewBody: Ok this park is so cool it has a water park ,go carts,bike rental even a zoo with lot of animal,like tigers,monkys,snakes and lots more..If your in tijuana miss out and go to this park.\n\nEste parque esta vien chido,tiene muchas diveciones como animales y juegos mecanicos tambien un parque acuatico.si vienes a tijuana tienes que ir a parque morelos

address.streetAddress: Av de Los Insurgetes 16000 Rio Tijuana 3ra.etapa

661444652.name: Small but interesting cathedral
661444652.author: a TripAdvisor user
661444652.reviewBody: Not as grand as many European or American cathedrals, but what is there is quite nice.  Easily visited during a walking tour along the Avenida Revolution.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

640921611.name: Incredible Catedral
640921611.author: a TripAdvisor user
640921611.reviewBody: It is an iconic place in Tijuana! An incredible place for spiritual connection.  If  you are visiting Tijuana please don\'t miss out.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

604502754.name: Must Visit Cathedal
604502754.author: a TripAdvisor user
604502754.reviewBody: They have multiple masses throughout the day if your visiting. People are very nice and helpful to visitors.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

597173431.name: CALMING CATHEDRAL
597173431.author: a TripAdvisor user
597173431.reviewBody: If you\'re walking around TJ and need a peaceful respite, visit here.  It\'s located in a small plaza area, yet steps away are working girls.  A sad contradiction.  The Cathedral is beautiful, a beacon, and a welcoming place to reflect and refresh.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

593415124.name: Loved the Church
593415124.author: a TripAdvisor user
593415124.reviewBody: Its beautiful, only a block off of the main avenue and was lucky enough to join a service in a packed house.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

562603700.name: Interesting Catholic Church built more recently
562603700.author: a TripAdvisor user
562603700.reviewBody: Interesting Catholic Church right in the heart of the things in Tijuana.  Built in the 1950s or 60s, I believe.  Very white on the inside.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

553051772.name: So many people!
553051772.author: a TripAdvisor user
553051772.reviewBody: We found this church on Wednesday afternoon when walking in downtown Tijuana. Obviously it was not Mass time, but there were many people in the pew and I saw some went into the confessional.So different from US Catholic church....

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

492433145.name: Beautiful and serene
492433145.author: a TripAdvisor user
492433145.reviewBody: Worth a visit. Its a beautiful church and with cultural feel to it. Safe and free to visit. Just walk in.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

484432117.name: Beautiful church
484432117.author: a TripAdvisor user
484432117.reviewBody: It is located in the city center so surrounded by bussel and traffic. It is a very pretty church with yellow domes, and beautifully peaceful inside.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

453931750.name: Enjoyed the visit.
453931750.author: a TripAdvisor user
453931750.reviewBody: On our private tour with Turista Libre we visited the Catedral. If you have time you should attend mass. It\'s a lovely piece of history and current part of the community.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

450137539.name: Beautiful
450137539.author: a TripAdvisor user
450137539.reviewBody: Great church, reasonably crowded, and the architecture is amazing. I didn\'t stay for mass but I imagine that it would have been a great service.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

445132277.name: Nice place of worship
445132277.author: a TripAdvisor user
445132277.reviewBody: An iconic Catholic church in the heart of Tijuana.  It is great to visit but nothing special about the place. The building itself is nice to visit.  When in Tijuana, just walk in to see inside or to enjoy the service if you understand Spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

418695422.name: A great landmark of the city
418695422.author: a TripAdvisor user
418695422.reviewBody: I just happened to stumble upon the cathedral while on my trip, but it was definitely worth-while. It\'s close in proximity to many popular restaurants and tourist shops and provides you an insight to the religious history and architecture of Tijuana. I\'d highly recommend stopping by for a few minutes.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

417684108.name: A classic Catholic Church in downtown Tijuana
417684108.author: a TripAdvisor user
417684108.reviewBody: This is a classic Catholic church in the middle of Tijuana serving the needs of the local inhabitants. It has a presence that I seem to find in the older large scale religious structures.\nThe oldest open-air market in Tijuana is just across the street. While it is not in the most desirable part of town, it is certainly safe to walk in the area during the day. The town maintains a good police presence in the area, streets are well-marked, and the Church is approximately 1/2 mile from Caesar\'s Restaurant, home of the classic Caesar Salad.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

389941561.name: It\'s a church in the center of the city. Nothing special, but still nice to visit
389941561.author: a TripAdvisor user
389941561.reviewBody: It is a church. Some might be surprised that in an officially secular country like Mexico most people are very devout. At all times you will find young and old, male and female locals here praying. No special arts or architecture here, this is a place of worship, not a museum.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

389567301.name: Interesting Cathedral in downtown Tijuana -
389567301.author: a TripAdvisor user
389567301.reviewBody: Stopped by the Cathedral while visiting Tijuana.   Noticed the Clock Bell Towers with the Tijuana Arch from the pedestrian bridge at the border and decided to see it.  It was interesting and a little different.  The outside looks better than the inside which looks sort of un-interesting.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

388163849.name: Surprisingly  clean in the middle of crowded Tijuana
388163849.author: a TripAdvisor user
388163849.reviewBody: Well kept building in and out in the heart of down town Tijuana , Mexico they have a few daily mass schedules .

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

367943365.name: Catedral De Nuestra Senora, De Guadalupe.
367943365.author: a TripAdvisor user
367943365.reviewBody: This Catedral De Nuestra Senora De Guadalupe in Centro Tijuana or Downtown for the Gringo\'s. Is a Tijuana Landmark and can be seen from quite a distance.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

340099564.name: A Beautiful Old Church
340099564.author: a TripAdvisor user
340099564.reviewBody: While in Tijuana I walked the few blocks from Revolution over to the Church. It is in an older part of town, but on a weekday there were many people around and I never felt unsafe. The church is very nice both outside and inside. The stained glass windows were worth seeing. You can buy candles and other items from vendors outside the church. Worth the couple block walk to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

337646455.name: Serves local community
337646455.author: a TripAdvisor user
337646455.reviewBody: We visited the church this morning and happened to catch the last half of a mass. The stained glass windows are lovely and the main Guadalupe decor above the altar is great. It was obviously a local, well used church and on a rainy Tuesday morning in January there were no venders at all either in or nearby!

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

331437862.name: Have a look at the Cathedral now you\u00b4re in Tijuana
331437862.author: a TripAdvisor user
331437862.reviewBody: Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de Guadalupe Cathedral is not far from Avenida Revolucion, so you might want to visit, now you\u00b4re near by.  It\u00b4s nicer outside than inside and there is a lot of life going on at the small plaza in fron of the Cathedral.  It\u00b4s a fairly new church.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

322771658.name: A day in tijuana
322771658.author: a TripAdvisor user
322771658.reviewBody: It\'s a very nice church.  Upon entering a group of teenagers were offering candles and little Guadalupe necklaces.  My two kids (3 and 1) were very impressed with inside of the church.  Loved it!

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

321218993.name: Muy lindo lugar / peaceful place
321218993.author: a TripAdvisor user
321218993.reviewBody: Is a Tijuana most! Is in downtown Tijuana in second street.. If you visit here don\'t forget to pass to the Popo market..

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

308330786.name: Its a church but call it a cathedral
308330786.author: a TripAdvisor user
308330786.reviewBody: It\'s a church that\'s in a bad part of town. I\'m sure back in the day it was in its glory days but it is nothing to see now. It\'s the main church in Tijuana with all kinds of vendors trying to sell cheap trinkets. I\'m sure Jesus would approve.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

302010450.name: Beautiful Landmark
302010450.author: a TripAdvisor user
302010450.reviewBody: A beautiful historical church located in downtown Tijuana (Centro). I always enjoy the historical significance of landmarks such as this beautiful cathedral.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

294132125.name: Nice building
294132125.author: a TripAdvisor user
294132125.reviewBody: But i find it sad that one of the nicest buildings in centro or downtown tj is a Catholic church. Couldnt that money jave been better used to sever the people of tj instead.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

287777938.name: Disappointing
287777938.author: a TripAdvisor user
287777938.reviewBody: I don\'t like to belittle religious sites and don\'t mean to say that a trip to a cathedral is ever bad, but it is situated in a bad area and outside it is surrounded by street vendors who sell cheap tokens.  It seemed kind of disgraceful.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

286464482.name: Church near the skatepark
286464482.author: a TripAdvisor user
286464482.reviewBody: I\'ve wandered in here a few times over the years, usually when we come to skate at the skatepark built behind some apartments across the street. ask a local who looks like they might no whats up, and they might direct u to the gate where the park is, where admittance can be had for a pittance... the church itself is beautiful inside, although it does stand in stark contrast to the poverty outside. It is an experience worth checking out if u are in the neighborhood, and it would be really neat to attend a service here. One year we were sleeping in the skatepark apartments, and on easter morning at like 2 in the morning the church bells started going crazy. We thought the armageddon was on us until our friends who were locals started laughing and told us it was a reminder that jesus had risen.. thanks for that... besides that, which ended up being a kind of funny story, the church is a very interesting building located in a very interesting city..

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

284256436.name: This is the main cathedral for Tijuana, people from all over come to the this church, it\'s been there for more than 50yr
284256436.author: a TripAdvisor user
284256436.reviewBody: La Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe is a catholic church has been in TJ for more then 50 yrs. It\'s location is in the heart of TJ\'s down town. The inside it\'s very beautiful; it\'s capacity about 400 people easy. My mom use to take me when I was a young child. I remember that after church we will stay for the vendors outside they sell anything you could think of.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

647074334.name: TJ\'s icon
647074334.author: a TripAdvisor user
647074334.reviewBody: Of all the Glorietas in Tijuana, Cuauhtemoc\'s was the first and one of the most beautiful I\'ve seen.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes S/N Col. Zona Río

603488335.name: a roundabout!!
603488335.author: a TripAdvisor user
603488335.reviewBody: I remember seeing the truck that brought this statue over to set it up. it originally did not have the shield it has now... you notice the color difference between it and the rest of the figure. \nthis part of the city has heavy traffic in rush hour so avoid it if you can.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes S/N Col. Zona Río

595043072.name: Central Monument
595043072.author: a TripAdvisor user
595043072.reviewBody: This is the Most iconic monument of TJ today. Considered central to all of modern TJ. It is the Hub. of Zona Rio. This is where all TJ people come to celebrate when Mexican Teams WIN a major tournament. Plaza Rio..Calimax..and INN Hotel around it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes S/N Col. Zona Río

614870221.name: Waterpark adventure!
614870221.author: a TripAdvisor user
614870221.reviewBody: This water park was a great day trip for our group while in Puerto Nuevo for a wedding. It\'s small, but has several awesome slides and pools to experience. The drinks and food were inexpensive, the lifeguards were friendly, and there weren\'t many lines because school had started back. Google the Slip n\' Fly (the park\'s ain attraction). It was an extroadinary attraction! The slides were fast and fun, and the place has a great vibe. I can\'t wait to return next year!

610930576.name: Diverse aquapark
610930576.author: a TripAdvisor user
610930576.reviewBody: It is a pretty big water-park with many water slides, a wave pool, a kids water playground and more. They have grills in some areas around the park. You can bring your own food but they have a strict policy around anything that involves glass. So either don\'t bring anything in glass or tape it up so it doesn\'t scatter. You can rent a Floatie which is recommended for a couple of rides for 50 pesos. And it\'s a really good place to visit with family and/or friends.

513458637.name: Fun place to vacation
513458637.author: a TripAdvisor user
513458637.reviewBody: I went to this waterpark this summer with my family and I really enjoyed it. They have several pools and they have a lot of waterslides. It was very crowded when I went but it was okay. They can improve on their staff and the cleanliness though.

510723031.name: Weekend
510723031.author: a TripAdvisor user
510723031.reviewBody: Great time. Family oriented. Doesn\'t allow you to take alcohol inside but they do sell inside. There are numerous pools and water slides.  They also have medical services if needed.

505303683.name: Fun and adventure in the sun - Very Affordable
505303683.author: a TripAdvisor user
505303683.reviewBody: We had a great time here. Unlike U.S. attractions, Mexico makes a point to make things affordable by allowing food and drink into the park. And when I say food, I don\'t mean picnic. Be sure to bring charcoal for the grill and make Carne Asada. There are plenty of places to set up for the family (large and small). The attractions were quite fun but remember you are in another country and enforcement of safety rules are completely different.  It is up to the participant to play it safe. I felt the attractions were maintained well but they do allow people to let loose and do things that would never be allowed in the U.S. Examples are they let people go down on slide "surf" style vs. crossed arms and feet. My family had a lot of fun and will definitely make El Vergel a reoccurring trip during the summer. Entrance is currently ranges between $80 and $150 pesos each for the day.

469737362.name: Amazing
469737362.author: a TripAdvisor user
469737362.reviewBody: Simply, the best water park in terms of attractions, cost, limited waits and ability to drink beers on the rides. Water was freezing but can\'t wait to return. Slip and fly is worth crossing the border for!

415031789.name: Fun day trip from San Diego, but a tad ghetto and unsafe
415031789.author: a TripAdvisor user
415031789.reviewBody:
One of the best things about visiting this park is that it’s a bit more “free spirited” than a water park in the states – it’s pretty much an ‘anything goes’ kind of atmosphere with plenty of thrill rides, good food options, and lifeguards who don't seem too concerned with anyone’s behavior. Unfortunately this also the park’s biggest downfall.
There is no shortage of fun things to do here, but the level of safety level of this park is questionable at best.   One immediately noticeable element is the fact that open alcohol consumption is allowed throughout the park.  There is certainly no crime in having a beer or two, but especially combined with the less than stellar condition and design of some of the attractions, allowing intoxicated people to roam freely throughout the park and rides is not exactly a great idea.
One of the first things we watched after when arriving at the park and getting settled is this rolling log type thing that is suspended above the water with steps to climb up to it on each end.  I thought it looked pretty cool and as a bit of a fitness junkie wanted to try my luck at balancing on it.
