But, directly in front of this structure is a sign instructing patrons in all caps not to walk on the log (you’re supposed to bear hug it and inch across). Several people walked on it anyway while the lifeguard watched people fall as if he were entertained by their efforts.   The kicker is that the pool below is only 2-3 feet deep, at most.  So if you fall (which everyone does) you’d better hope you don’t hit the water wrong and head straight to the bottom.  Easy way to get hurt.
Regarding water slides, part of the fun for me on enclosed water slides is the visual of flying through the tunnel – so cool.  But then there are the slides at El Vergel - these things are straight evil.  The corkscrew twists and turns look innocent and fun enough from the outside – until you are actually inside them.  For once you slide down the opening of the slides at El Vergel you are greeted with the wonderful surprise that they are pitch black inside  Like can’t see your hand in front of your face pitch black. Like can’t see and prepare your body for that sharp 90 degree downhill turn your body is about to be whipped through at ludicrous speed.  I could honestly maybe see how one could think this may sound fun on paper but you will have bruises and be dizzy when you come out, just as everyone in our group experienced.
The infrastructure is also just kinda dicey. You pull up to this place in the seemingly the middle of nowhere and are greeted by the homemade looking sign that is pinned into the mountain side and appears to have been cut out of recycled tin roof pieces.  In the park you climb shaky, sometimes rusty steps on your way up to the top of slides, you can see slides shake as people go through them, and one slide had some kind of thin cable tied between the supporting beams that had the look of a temporary repair.   There is one open slide on which the rider actually catches a bit of air – just a few feet directly above the catch air section is a length of enclosed pipe from another slide that twists around it.  We didn't’ see it happen, but It did not appear a terribly unlikely event that someone could bump their head on the pipe above if they were tall enough.
It’s a fun day trip and something a little bit different to do but be careful , mindful of, and responsible for your own safety!

676611035.name: Play with science
676611035.author: a TripAdvisor user
676611035.reviewBody: This is an exciting place to bring children, there are a lot of activities. The children can play and learn.  It is an interactive museum

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

631274317.name: more guides than visitors
631274317.author: a TripAdvisor user
631274317.reviewBody: This childrens museum puts most gringo places to shame. I sat through a 15 min video on food that was as intelligent as anything on PBS. Lots of interactive stuff

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

583113199.name: Very interesting place
583113199.author: a TripAdvisor user
583113199.reviewBody: Is a interactive museum, clean, funny activities, nice to go with all ages, you can eat  fast food inside, but its really funny an interesting place.\n

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

492094670.name: Nice
492094670.author: a TripAdvisor user
492094670.reviewBody: This is a great idea, it\'s an amazing place, it just needs more staff to set the mood and make things more interesting for the children, so more people will go and learn!

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

434938209.name: good all day family trip
434938209.author: a TripAdvisor user
434938209.reviewBody:
good trip of you have 2-12 year olds. lots to do and see. 
lots to keep kids busy, entertained and learning. 
lots of guides and they are very helpful. 

they do not accept US credit/debit cards! 
Parking is very limited! you have to park at mall across the street. 
this is why only three stars

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

386796043.name: Good fun for kids
386796043.author: a TripAdvisor user
386796043.reviewBody: El Trompo is an interactive science museum for children, but adults can enjoy their time there as well. Wear comfy shoes--the area is large with several floors and a theater.  There are a large number of science and music activities for all.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and eager to help explain the various experiments and activities.  Don\'t plan on eating there--the snack bar leaves a lot to be desired.  I\'m not sure if it would be a great vacation activity, but it is popular with locals, especially groups. El Trompo has a good program of giving back to the community by offering free outings to children of local children\'s homes, which gives them quite a few points in my book.

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

338296193.name: Fun for kids
338296193.author: a TripAdvisor user
338296193.reviewBody: This place was very fun for my son and niece, and I have to confess.. I also had fun there with all the science experiments.\nIt\'s a little bit far from downtown, but if you have kids it\'s a must in Tijuana.

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

294851425.name: El Trompo, family fun
294851425.author: a TripAdvisor user
294851425.reviewBody: This is an interactive science museum for kids.   It has several floors and theater.   The cafeteria was lacking.  My kids are looking forward to going again.  The employees are helpful and knowledgeable.

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

216838426.name: Good for a Sunday
216838426.author: a TripAdvisor user
216838426.reviewBody: If you don\'t have that much to do, and you want to kill 3-4 hours it;s a god option, in general you can say that the idea is good, but there are some details ( maintenance) that could be better.\nThe menu on the snack bar is not that good, so I don\'t recommend to have lunch there

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

211730699.name: The kids will definitely enjoy it!
211730699.author: a TripAdvisor user
211730699.reviewBody: This is a very nice place for kids to be able to explore lots of areas of science and music.\nThey have many activities that the kids can do besides games like recipes, play instruments, take pictures with great backgrounds, etc.\nIt\'s great for the whole family at a reasonable price!

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

199060802.name: Good exhibits, great prices and family fun
199060802.author: a TripAdvisor user
199060802.reviewBody: The place is big, since you enter the parking lot you can see the huge museum installation.The architecture looks very unique and fun. The tickets are very cheap and they include the exhibits and a short 3D film. The exhibits are fun, they even have some teens that can explain to your kids how the interactive exhibits work. You will have a nice and fun family time visiting. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Libramiento Los Insurgentes SN, Tercera Etapa Zona Rio Tijuana

667944231.name: Nothing special worth crossing the border for
667944231.author: a TripAdvisor user
667944231.reviewBody:
This museum is on the Liberty Path from the US border, midway before the arch and Ave. Revo.

It's a small museum, not worth making a trip for itself. Sadly after 200, the passport requirement and news of high homicide rate every year due to the drug war, not too many Americans cross over to peruse shops and trinket carts.  This Liberty Path, the shopping plazas and the Mercado de Artesania next to it, have very few visitors during weekend, virtually deserted day and night.

This area is a high crime area and can be dangerous when it's dark.  You can park at the Malls of America, walk over via Ped West and walk the path on the way to Ave Revo.

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

536030546.name: A great value for the money. The entire family can enjoy it!
536030546.author: a TripAdvisor user
536030546.reviewBody:
If you can find the time, take it! This is a great value for the money. With pictures from the 1920's of Old Tijuana, along with wax figures of international fame, it is both historic and humorous. Men, women, and children will all enjoy themselves with the various wax figures and exhibits.

There is a "Chamber Of Horrors" exhibit that may be a bit much for the "faint of heart", but most folks will find it fun, perhaps even laughable!

Not only do I recommend it, but I will go again myself the next time I'm in town. Taco Bell (no relation to the American fast-food chain) is across the walkway from the museum and I highly recommend eating there either before, or after, your visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

518570711.name: Do not park, manager is a crook and towed my car
518570711.author: a TripAdvisor user
518570711.reviewBody: Do not park here! There were two cars parked to the right of the entrance and an empty spot to the left that was definitely not marked for no parking (see photo.) The manager had my car towed and then denied that it was him that had called even though the police officer showed me the communication. He obviously has a deal with the tow company. It cost me close to $100 and two days running around Tijuana to get my car back. The guy is a crook and everyone knows it even the judge immediately reduced the fine to the absolute minimum when he heard the incident was at the Wax Museum. Unfortunately they could not do the same for the tow company who is surely splitting the revenue with this creep.

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

439633150.name: A Tijuana Landmark
439633150.author: a TripAdvisor user
439633150.reviewBody: This location has been a tourist draw for decades.  The cost of admission is super cheap and great place to take some time off the beaten path.  It is just a short walk from revolution and worth the trip.  There are some souvenir shops on the way.  The wax figures are a little dated but provide some extensive historical and cultural figures from US and Mexican history.  There are US and Mexican music figures. They even have a horror section for some further enjoyment.  Again, great distraction from the regular Tijuana tourist paths.

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

424256765.name: Wax Museum in Tj
424256765.author: a TripAdvisor user
424256765.reviewBody: This museum is a great place to come to if you want to see important historical figures from Mexican history and legends. The wax dolls look realistic and the entrance fee is inexpensive. The only down side to this museum is that it is too small and unless you go with someone who knows of its existence, then you probably would not notice it.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

421736851.name: Interesting Tijuana attraction
421736851.author: a TripAdvisor user
421736851.reviewBody:
Located on Calle Primera just after you cross Avenida Francisco Madero is the Wax Museum.  Walk up and into the lobby to the desk and pay the admission, 25 pesos or $1.50US.   

We turned around and headed in and were immediately in a Mexican history section with was figures depicting several figures from early Mexican history, including a human sacrifice.

As we continued on we passed several figures of Mexican and World history,new and popular culture.  There is also a horror/Halloween section with mythical characters.  

Some are good, Vicente Fox and Carlos Santana.  Some are bad, Bill Cosby and Sylvester Stallone.  But, all in all this is a great place to stop for an hour or 2.  

BTW, Stallone is missing his left hand.

address.streetAddress: Calle Primera Y/O Articulo 123 8281 Zona Centro

647074822.name: A tranquil place for locals
647074822.author: a TripAdvisor user
647074822.reviewBody: This park is one of the most visited parks for families, especially the ones with small children; the park is fenced, so there is a sense of safety all around. A lot of shade with  many young trees, there is a lot of potential for this place for years to come.

address.streetAddress: Av. del Parque, 600, Mesa de Otay

601118182.name: Fun place to visit for elementary school kids
601118182.author: a TripAdvisor user
601118182.reviewBody:
After running out of places to see around LA, we decided to visit Tijuana for a family trip with little kids.  There were 3 places we wanted to visit, CECUT, Mini City, and El Topo.  We've been to Kidzania in Korea so we were happy to find something similar in driving distance away.  We arrived at Plaza Rio little past 11am on Saturday and found a lot of parking.  None of the staff spoke English and the way they spoke real fast seems like there aren't that many non-Spanish speakers that visit here.  With Google Translate App and my forgotten 2 year of high school Spanish, I communicated the price, that we need to purchase their socks with sticky bottom for trampoline, and write kids name and my name for them to input into the watch which doubles for kids bank account.  So as others has stated, like Kidzania, there are 2 types of experience that kids can do.  First is work type where they earn money: fire fighter, doctor, supermarket cashier, farmer who milks and sells the milk, reporter, TV anchor, Radio DJ, etc.  Each time you complete a task they scan the watch kids wear to pay them salary.  With money earned, kids can do the second type of experience: driving a car, slide, zip line, trampoline, etc.  Although time we went, I don't think they were deducting money for zip line and trampoline.  
So they inputted kids name and took pictures of them for their watch bank account.  We went in and there weren't that many people.  I think it had something to do with citizens of Mexico working the longest hours in the world which include working Saturdays.  It started to get packed around 3pm.  We decided to do the work type first to get money.  First one that we saw was newspaper reporter.  We spoke no Spanish so we used translator to answer some question that were given at the location.  But later I saw that they actually went around asking question at different work stations to do reporting.  Kids did the dairy farmer next where they fed the cow, milked the cow and went around to cooking school and market to sell the milk.  Next was market where they asked whether a kid wants to work or be a customer.  Luckily there was another parent who spoke English who told us when we stood there baffled at what the staff was asking.  Next was firefighter where kids get to ride on a fire engine and put out a fire on a building.  The building didn't have any drawing of fire so I think my kids were confused.  Later I saw that there were bit more explanation for kids who spoke Spanish, including going down the fire pole.  Kids took a break from all the Spanish and decided to go on the trampoline.  My older one decided to make a pizza, which cost about $4-5 for a personal pepperoni or cheese pizza.  Staff dressed them up with an apron and a chef's hat while he made a pizza.  My younger one played on a climbing structure while my older one did the driving experience.  In driving experience, you can be a driver, car washer, or gas station attendant.  Rest of the day was just playing.  My son went on the zip line twice.  Went down the long slide by the entrance numerous times, went back to trampoline, and made slime in the slime lab which cost about 100 peso ($5).  By this time, it was getting pretty crowded.  We left around 4pm.  There were a lot of birthday parties and kids by this time.  

Google Translator App came in very handy.  I found out that there is no in and out privilege.  Once you leave, that's a final exit, which is a shame since there were a lot of nice restaurants in the Plaza.  Then again, it only cost about $10 per kids and cheaper for adults.  We had breakfast, fed kids pizza that they made and juice.  There were snacks and coffees available in Mini City.  Kids wanted to stay longer to play but we a long drive back to LA. 

It was fun but in comparison to Kidzania in Seoul, it was bit lacking.  For example not all stations showed how long the experience is, how much money they'll earn and so forth.  Fire experience in Kidzania actually had water gun like in carnival games to shoot fire with picture of fire.  Little things to make experience better, but then again it cost much more at Kidzania.  

We will be learning Spanish as a family an will return.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Paseo de Los Heroes #95, Local C4, Plaza Rio

569873974.name: Great time at the ballpark
569873974.author: a TripAdvisor user
569873974.reviewBody: This was our first time going to see the Toros play at Estadio gasmart. The Toros are a AAA level baseball team so the product on the field is pretty good. Now for the rest of the visit. People were tailgating in the parking lot before the game and there was also a parking attendant who watched over the lot until the end of the game. Once inside, the food choices seemed limitless and they had discounts on beer from 6:30 until 8:30. The energy in the stands during the game was amazing. We will definitely be back soon to take in another game.

521503799.name: Good Stadium
521503799.author: a TripAdvisor user
521503799.reviewBody: My church had an event here at the Estadio Gasmart. It is a great stadium, it doesn\'t seat a lot like an MLB stadium, but it is perfect for the area!

504512662.name: Baseball is not the star attraction here, but a lot of fun nonetheless!
504512662.author: a TripAdvisor user
504512662.reviewBody:
The Tijuana Toros are the local Mexican major league team with a quality of play that is probably the equivalent to double-A ball in the United States. What makes the experience here different is that the star attraction for the fans is not what happens during the game, but rather what happens in the stands and ends up on the video scoreboard. There is lots of music, dancing, cavorting with the 4 mascots that roam about, and watching the cheerleaders that are dressed in (depending on your point of view) very attractive, or rather suggestive attire. The music is loud, and stops only when the pitcher is ready to throw the ball and caught by the catcher, or until the end of the play. There are a series of video cameras that are constantly looking for fans who are overtly looking for attention and willing to have some fun poked at them. Most people are watching the video scoreboard and not really paying attention to the game, and it would be annoying to come wanting to focus on baseball with all of the other stuff going on; the scoreboard is used to show player stats, commercials, and fan/mascot antics but only minimally for instant replay. But personally, I had a great time and would definitely come again. 

The other thing to mention is the food court, which is like going to the county fair with a surprising array of choices. Besides typical staples of hot dogs and peanuts, there are a few taco vendors, hamburgers, carnitas, Buffalo wings, BBQ ribs, Thrifty ice cream, sushi, and all other typical Mexican fare. All the vendors have helpers roaming the stands with a menu: just flag down the one you are interested in & they will bring you whatever you want. Beer is very inexpensive compared with the usual US prices (60 pesos, or about $3 for 24 oz. cup) and is also sold in the stands.  One can have a great time with very little money needed for parking, tickets, and food/drink. And, lots of bathrooms that are clean and not too crowded.

Everything is in Spanish but the language is really not too much of an issue; most of the workers have at least a minimal understanding of English and for those that do not, there is always someone nearby to translate. All the announcements and such are in Spanish, but the entertainment value comes from the visuals, which really transcend language anyway.

444542688.name: Average Venue for Concerts
444542688.author: a TripAdvisor user
444542688.reviewBody: This stadium is a Baseball stadium.  It is simple and it has the problem of having minimal access.  It is a pain to get in with your vehicle and will take forever to get out for a concert.  They also did not have the access marked for VIP to get in the shorter lines.  Security was lax and a lot of people were roaming around out of the their seats blocking the view up front.  For those in the back the light and technical section was tall and in the middle blocking much of the view in the back making people rely more on the big screens them an actual direct view of the concert.

375851027.name: Better than Baseball in the US
375851027.author: a TripAdvisor user
375851027.reviewBody: Saw the Tijuana Toros on a lark. What a great experience ! The game is a huge party. Roving mariachi music, all sections food service, amazing variety, huge beers for $3, no 7th inning cut-off, very slinky cheerleaders, 3 amusing mascots, good Latin music, AAA level baseball, great crowd, party continues for a while after the game

450881431.name: Fun to kill time!
450881431.author: a TripAdvisor user
450881431.reviewBody: I went this past Sunday January 8. First time visiting this park, we go to tijuana a lot and we decided to visit this time. Small place but good enough to kill about two hours. Nothing fancy but the people are nice. Very small rides, county fairs have bigger rides. Be aready to pay about 12 dollars for 22 tickets, each ride takes from 2 to 7 tickets, not sure if its worth it. But we Will be back again.

address.streetAddress: Via Rapida Jose Fimbres Moreno Local 62 Fracccionamiento San Jose

445381290.name: Mini amusement park
445381290.author: a TripAdvisor user
445381290.reviewBody: The kids love going here whenever we travel to TJ, has many arcade games inside and small rides for little kids and larger rides for older kids

address.streetAddress: Via Rapida Jose Fimbres Moreno Local 62 Fracccionamiento San Jose

357464232.name: Mundo divertido
357464232.author: a TripAdvisor user
357464232.reviewBody: The best park in tijuana.with Games ,food,video games,games for kids,water games ,lazer tag,and lots more.

address.streetAddress: Via Rapida Jose Fimbres Moreno Local 62 Fracccionamiento San Jose

561068619.name: Curious Pair of Collections but Really Well Done
561068619.author: a TripAdvisor user
561068619.reviewBody: This museum is definitely worth a visit and probably one you\u2019d not think of going to off-hand.  There are three collections in a lavishly restored traditional restaurant: a vast collection of modest everyday items associated with Tijuana, the small common things often seen as ephemeral but that are amazing when collected; a huge collection of superhero toys and collectibles; and a whole floor of Lucha Libre masks and materials, even part of the wrestling ring.  You can get an enthusiastic, exhaustive tour through these by one of the devotees who work at this labor of love.  \n\nAs I say, definitely worth a visit even if you wouldn\u2019t ordinarily think of going there .

653778663.name: An iconic place
653778663.author: a TripAdvisor user
653778663.reviewBody: When visiting Tijuana everyone must visit the arch! An iconic place, classic architecture and also a great place to meet.

629955429.name: It is situated in the tourist area
629955429.author: a TripAdvisor user
629955429.reviewBody: This arc is "architectural artwork", it is situated in the tourist area in Tijuana, there are many restaurants, cafes, shopping and full of pharmacies, I was told that many Americans cross the border to buy pharmaceuticals, the prices are cheap, but the town is very Americanized, it is similar to Cancun, but overall it is worth the visit if you walk across the border from the USA.

597173703.name: TJ\'s ARCH
597173703.author: a TripAdvisor user
597173703.reviewBody: Think arch in St. Louis, USA.  It\'s simple, yet a large tv hangs from the center advertising and welcoming visitors.  Use this as a beacon from throughout the city.  To the immediate west is a small plaza with a performance stage (singers, dancers, etc.) and a block of shops, stalls, bars, and more.  At the west end is a McDonald\'s if you need an American fix.

656789411.name: go later in day
656789411.author: a TripAdvisor user
656789411.reviewBody: It was bright and lovely and the folks were friendly .... we were there before noon and booths were still no opened.  So I expect it is much livelier later in the day.

601541878.name: Also known as Plaza de Santa Cecelia
601541878.author: a TripAdvisor user
601541878.reviewBody:
Santa Cecelia is the saint of music so you will often see musical performances here in this plaza.  If you want to hire your own personal mariachi band, you can do that, too!

During the daytime, there are lots of small vendors set up selling various souvenirs.  There are several restaurants in this little area. It's a great place to come take pictures and load up on trinkets and margaritas.

In the evening, bar life takes over and this is the primary location for the two most-known gay bars - Hawaii and Bar Ranchero. Hawaii often has drag shows in the evenings.

445133633.name: Nice place to visit when in Tijuana
445133633.author: a TripAdvisor user
445133633.reviewBody: Amigos del Artes is located right where the icon arch of Tijuana is.  Good place to get there to see some performance and some Mexican souvenir mainly serving American tourists.  A couple nice restaurants in the area too.

389568375.name: Very Colorful - Place for souvenir shopping and people watching
389568375.author: a TripAdvisor user
389568375.reviewBody: Stumbled upon this area after walking to the Tijuana Arch from the border.  The place seemed colorful with the shops and restaurants. It was interesting to see the different things for sale as the souvenir stands.  Did not stop to eat and the restaurants, but some of them looked ok.

385002071.name: Very Colorful
385002071.author: a TripAdvisor user
385002071.reviewBody: Lots of outside entertainment and food. Very crowded and all kinds of vendors wanting to sell you their items. Not very comfortable

363480554.name: Close to boarder, yet, far in time, beautiful
363480554.author: a TripAdvisor user
363480554.reviewBody: Close to boarder, yet, far in time, beautiful. In the area of the arch, especially pm and evenings, and weekends, you find all kinds of street performers (singers, players, dancers), which give a special flavor to a visit.

345707801.name: Shopping and bars near Avenue Revolucion
345707801.author: a TripAdvisor user
345707801.reviewBody: This litlle area I think is also called Plaza De Mariachis. This little area is near the Tijuana Arch. Lots of different shops and bars. We spent some time at a Transvestite bar. A little raunchy but it was fun. And drinks were cheap.

336787257.name: Fun little taste of Mexico.
336787257.author: a TripAdvisor user
336787257.reviewBody: Lots of things to see and buy. There is a strip near by that is filed with restaurants and bars. Many stores sell things such as jewelry, clothes and trinkets. You can also get a legitimate mariachi serenade while you eat.

305113125.name: A fun day trip!
305113125.author: a TripAdvisor user
305113125.reviewBody: Once a year, my good friend, Alicia, takes me on a one-day summer adventure.  This year, she took me and another friend on the train from TJ to Tecate.  We had a great time! Be warned that if you take this train make sure that you are at the train at the time listed on your ticket as this train sticks to the established schedule and waits for no one! Right now, the train runs once a month. We went on a Saturday, so I imagine they only run Saturdays at the moment.  Apparently, the train had not run for 4 years while they repaired the train tracks.  You can purchase burritos on the train, but chose to wait until we got to Tecate to eat.  Given that we didn\'t purchase food, we were told that we would be given free samples of their cheeses and a tiny cup of Sangria which they refilled.  They had raffles and played games for prizes on the way to Tecate.  The prizes were tickets to various tours in Tecate such as the Tecate Brewery, the Kumiyaii Museum, and their new Cultural Center.  We won the tickets to the brewery!  On the way back, we had Mariachi music (7-piece group), and free samples of Tequila they were selling on board. I took a tiny taste of two different kinds of Tequila and decided that was enough for me!  As far as food is concerned, it is recommended that you not eat downtown as the train assistants are worried that it may take too long and you will miss your train back.  They do have several food trucks at the train station which sell Mexican food, water, and beer.  I was worried about Turista, so I went with a bottle of beer!  When on the train, you will pass through two very dark tunnels which everyone seemed to love and cameras were snapping pics like crazy! The train also makes a 5-minute stop so you can take your pic in front of the dam.  The train assistants were friendly and helpful, though they spoke very little English--still, we managed! The train left at 9 AM pronto and we arrived back in TJ at approximately 6:30PM. The train ride itself was approx. 2 1/2 hrs. Be forewarned that there are no bathroom facilities on the train.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Diaz Ordaz y Blvd. Simon Bolivar

399292615.name: Lo mejor.!!!
399292615.author: a TripAdvisor user
399292615.reviewBody: El mejor lugar para ir de compras.. Encuentras todo a muy buen precio \ud83d\udc4c - a veces el estacionamiento est\u00e1 agotado pero uno o dos minutos y listooo.!!!

361055353.name: Ropa y art\u00edculos de vestir
361055353.author: a TripAdvisor user
361055353.reviewBody:
Encuentras ropa de buen precio, no es de marca pero es bonita, no es un mall.

Si buscas bien hay puestos que venden algunas cosas originales, como perfumes.

Cierran temprano.

631449952.name: RIO AREA
631449952.author: a TripAdvisor user
631449952.reviewBody: This monument is in the RIO area of TJ.  Down the main blvd where all the big businesses are.  Right in front of the Cantina de los Remedios...which was the Guadalajara Grill.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes Zona Urbana Rio

610965505.name: Nice Statue in the middle of a traffic circle.
610965505.author: a TripAdvisor user
610965505.reviewBody: The statue is in an odd place in the center of the main traffic circle of Tijuana, where local Tijuana drivers are apt to make your life miserable as you try to navigate around it. You have to be walking to properly view this very nice gesture of one of our greatest presidents.

address.streetAddress: Paseo de los Heroes Zona Urbana Rio

510670560.name: Historical Building in Old Downtown
510670560.author: a TripAdvisor user
510670560.reviewBody: This used to be City Hall before the center of government moved to the new Zona R\u00edo district in the 70s.  It\'s now a museum and multi-purpose cultural center.  Well worth a visit while also visiting the nearby municipal market and cathedral.  Art exhibits change often and are usually no charge.

321218663.name: Good to visit..slow to do paper work
321218663.author: a TripAdvisor user
321218663.reviewBody: If you want to visit a cultural place pls go.. \nFor Mexicans if you have to go be prepared to do huge lines!

305061805.name: MUST to visit in Tijuana
305061805.author: a TripAdvisor user
305061805.reviewBody: In the old days this was the heart of the city government, by now they transformed in a cultural place, I recommend to visit, however need to look for a parking spot because the building doesn\'t have any.

226383348.name: weekend getaway
226383348.author: a TripAdvisor user
226383348.reviewBody: this weekend was the weekend of mexico\'s independence and they had a spectacular fireworks show and with the one\'s you love even better.

169722793.name: Found it interesting
169722793.author: a TripAdvisor user
169722793.reviewBody: Stumbled onto this place and had no idea it was the old city hall.  A local person very graciously explained the history and took us around for a mini tour and told us many stories.  The guy was just an old man who finished up a dance class who took it upon himself to make a tourist feel welcome, and wow what a diplomat and fine citizen of Tijuana.  I offered him a tip, but he refused, so offered to buy him lunch, and he said  only if we would accompany him.  Our "tour" continued.  That\'s one of the nice things about Tijuana, you never know what kind surprise you\'ll find.

661441350.name: Interesting statue while touring Tijuana
661441350.author: a TripAdvisor user
661441350.reviewBody: This is an interesting spot that we saw while taking a walking tour of the city. Near other interesting areas, like the cultural center and outdoor markets.

647075347.name: Reference for all
647075347.author: a TripAdvisor user
647075347.reviewBody: Even though this is just the physical logo for the company in charge for the development of the Rio Zone, and was at a time known as "the monument to steel", now it\'s known as "The Scissors", and a very well known reference.

595408887.name: Nothing to add
595408887.author: a TripAdvisor user
595408887.reviewBody: First thing I saw in Tijuana. Traffic gets a little crazy around it. Tenth time in Mexico, the wait at the border was one hour.

673341069.name: Craft Brew
673341069.author: a TripAdvisor user
673341069.reviewBody: Cozy little place on the edge of a rambunctious, hustling Avenida Revolucion. Eclectic, modern decor with touches of Asian, Mayan and Scandinavian artwork. The HAZY IPA was extremely hazy and good! They also have Mezcal and other non-beer drinks.

652654880.name: Great beer - great staff
652654880.author: a TripAdvisor user
652654880.reviewBody: You can feel the passion for beer in this place - highly recommended. Different types of beer from hoppy IPA and pale ale to delicately spiced stout

544608672.name: Some of the best Gin I Have tasted Enmienda 18
544608672.author: a TripAdvisor user
544608672.reviewBody:
This is a Local Craft Distilled Gin. Some of the best I have tasted. They have three presentations Citrus, Jamaica, and Aged Gin and a Vodka.

I know they sell it a Licodega liquor store, and serve it in some local places. The production seems to be limited as is not easy to find.

I tasted it at a yearly Pup Up Store Nero48 on Ave. Revolución. 

If you are in to spirits It is a must try. I personaly Liked the Aged Gin and my wife loved the Jamaica one.

Cheers!

address.streetAddress: Ave. San Antonio de los Buenos 1593

473697713.name: Arts center by the border
473697713.author: a TripAdvisor user
473697713.reviewBody: The Casa del Tunel used to have its own private tunnel into the USA. When the government shut down the nacros and human trafficers they gave the house to the amazing Makeda Dred, director of the World Beat Center in Balboa Park.  she has created an amazing arts center.  Changing art exhibits and rooftop concerts.  The rooftop features amazing 360 views of Tijuana and the USA.

676610388.name: Amazing environment
676610388.author: a TripAdvisor user
676610388.reviewBody: If you want to see the Tijuana culture, this is the right place.  There are delicious restaurants, galleries, coffee shops. The traditional donkey dress as zebra to take a picture from Tijuana, and much more.

675336229.name: Great shppoing and Bars
675336229.author: a TripAdvisor user
675336229.reviewBody: Good bars and shopping along with great place to dance. Lot to see and get involved with and an easy walk

671920102.name: Great Window into Mexican Culture
671920102.author: a TripAdvisor user
671920102.reviewBody: Spicy food, lots of people, art and colors.  Great to walk around and hear the music, taste the food and check out the many items for sale from cheesy tourist crap to authentic food and art works.

671887105.name: Kind of interesting
671887105.author: a TripAdvisor user
671887105.reviewBody: I expected this place to be so much more. Lots of venders but many have the same items. Lots of pharmacies.

670544150.name: AWESOME AVENIDA
670544150.author: a TripAdvisor user
670544150.reviewBody: Okay, visiting Avenida Revolucion isn\'t what it used to be when Americans constantly visited and shopped.  So, like with the American retail scene, this street scene has changed, too.  Yes, there are still the souvenir shops and a few, many fewer, merchants requesting you to visit their stores.  However, you will also now find American fast food like Burger King, unique coffee spots and restaurants, a Casino, and a much better blend of things to enjoy.  Be brave, visit, and enjoy!

670184638.name: Very interesting things to see here!
670184638.author: a TripAdvisor user
670184638.reviewBody: The shops are colourful but repetitive. You can find several tequila shops, traditional dress shops and shops selling wrestling masks. The Caesars restaurant is also nearby. Easy to find food in this area. This is the street to see zonkeys!

667939939.name: A fun place worth visiting
667939939.author: a TripAdvisor user
667939939.reviewBody:
Sadly a lot of shops on Ave. Revo have closed down after 2008.  There are not to many shops selling authentic mexican handicrafts, only a few leather goods, the rest mostly T shirts, bars, restaurants, Farmacias and doctors offices.

Walk North to a plaza in front of hotel Nelson.  Weekends usually have live music and various perfomances, including Aztecs' dances ect.  Next to this plaza is a pedestrian street with about 2 dozen trinkets and souvernir stalls, worth browsing.

This street also has half a dozen restaurants and bars, worth checking out.
 
Be careful of pick pockets on this busy ave.  If stopped and searched by Policia, hold your walltes, money and all valuables in your hands.  dont let Policia touch them or they will likely steal some cash.

If harassed, tell them you want to deal with Tourist Policia, call  *78 and ask them to wait.  They have to wait.  Also take down their badges and cars numbers, for filing abuse complaints later.

663449813.name: Good place to visit & enjoy a few beers
663449813.author: a TripAdvisor user
663449813.reviewBody:
Felt quite safe here to be honest didn’t know what to expect. We heard a lot a bad stories but all we saw was a lot of families & people just visiting & enjoying themselves like anywhere else in Mexico.
There is a big police presence here, cars are always about on almost every corner, wouldn’t like to stray too far from the main area though. We got a taxi from San Ysidro border crossings for $6 & walked back the next day in about 30mins. The signs are easy to follow ‘To USA’
Food & drink is very chea
No problem & a great day trip.

661442928.name: Main drag of Tijuana
661442928.author: a TripAdvisor user
661442928.reviewBody: This is the central street of activity in the city, with the arch at one end and tons of shopping along its entirety. Especially interesting is the amount of outdoor art and open markets, not to mention other major sites on or just off the Avenida.

655840920.name: Interesting shops, pharmacies and restaurants.
655840920.author: a TripAdvisor user
655840920.reviewBody: Avenida Revolucion is a touristy street lined with souvenir shops, restaurants, and pharmacies that sell to tourists. Stay south of the Tijuana arch unless you want to see more shady things like prostitution, brothels, and drug dealers. If you do go to the "dark side" for a peak, stay on the main drag as the side alleys and back streets are reportedly not safe for anyone, especially tourists to visit. Avenida Revolucion feels safe, particularly with armed local and federal police patrolling every 5-10 minutes. If you need a place to relax, there are a few classy air conditioned coffee shops on the street. If you are looking for a special souvenir, I suggest looking for a hand made mortar and pestle carved from porous volcanic rock (called a molcajete). Make sure to check it carefully though as some are fake and made from cement in mold. They are a different color and have mold lines and smoother surface. The real ones are awesome for making homemade salsa and guacamole the old fashioned way.

651735147.name: Fun loud nightlife
651735147.author: a TripAdvisor user
651735147.reviewBody: Lots of dive bars, to hit up. Different music scene. All around a fun area to hit up if you are looking for a fun night out.

649990950.name: Great if you like downmarket areas
649990950.author: a TripAdvisor user
649990950.reviewBody:
Maybe one star would be a tad unfair, but that is what I was going to give this street. It is full of tacky tourist shops close to the large arch, and when they run out it is full of tacky bars!

But then my wife pointed out that the sidewalks were in good shape, which might well be unique in the whole of Tijuana. In fact, we didn’t trip over one piece of broken sidewalk for the entire length of the street. 

So here you are, here’s another star!

647690595.name: Big dreams
647690595.author: a TripAdvisor user
647690595.reviewBody: They wanted the arch to go all the way from the street to the boarder. That\'s a loft goal. The arch reminded me of something I think I saw in Argentina. It\'s a nice celebrations of the century.

646081118.name: Less Than Expected
646081118.author: a TripAdvisor user
646081118.reviewBody: I stayed five nights in a great hotel on this street while having dental work done, so I had many hours of time to kill and spent a lot of it walking up and down Revolucion. I was thinking there would be more interesting shops, but most were the typical tourist junk which didn\'t interest me. Still, I enjoyed myself, because there are some great and memorable restaurants, coffee places, and a few shops that make it all worthwhile.

644644532.name: Good food
644644532.author: a TripAdvisor user
644644532.reviewBody: People for the most part come to Tijuana for drinking and hookers. I come to enjoy authentic Mexican food while visiting my old Army buddy.

640190688.name: Great Place
640190688.author: a TripAdvisor user
640190688.reviewBody: When visiting Tijuana everyone must visit Avenida Revolution it has something for everyone. Food, unique gifts and crafts you will find it here. Enjoy the experience.

639278490.name: Old and new and everything in between
639278490.author: a TripAdvisor user
639278490.reviewBody: "La Revu", as it is called in Spanish, can be everything and anything; for example, a set of tourist traps set all over the place: your photo with a donkey painted as a zebra, stores filled with low quality "the handcrafts" which sell cheaper than in San Diego, but which are all "clich\u00e9" Mexican souvenirs...But also, you can find a supermarket, lots of Dental offices, tons of pharmacies, and bars where the party continues all day and all night long. There are coffee places, and trendy places like Cine Tonal\u00e1, and dozens of clothing boutiques (used, hand made, TJ related tee-shirts), gift stores, and artisan beer places, on the avenue and inside the Gomez and Rodriguez  passages, both across each other, "entre la 3a y 4a", which means, between 3rd and 4rth streets.\nIf you visit on a weekend, you will see all kinds of people from both sides of the borders, all colors and beliefs. It can be fun, better if you come with friends! If you want to have some drinks, you can choose a bar with a view, or walk a couple of blocks to shady spots or full on table dancing places; you might want to visit El Zacazonapan is a tiny place favored by locals, or, if you rather stay on Avenida Revoluci\u00f3n, you can go to Porky\'s or wherever the music appeals to you. If you rather eat, then you\'ll find Mexican, Italian, Japanese, and everything in between. Again, if you walk a block or two away, you will find places for locals, and, of course, in every corner, there are tacos or burgers, and all kinds of goodies. Just trust your sense of smell, or the length of the line! \nNo way you will get bored with this walk. Check it out on Halloween! If you are going to Tijuana for the first time, you have to hang out \u00a1en la revoluci\u00f3n!

638398046.name: Different than the old Revo Ave. New scene, Same scams and pitfalls.
638398046.author: a TripAdvisor user
638398046.reviewBody:
The Revo has been in the slumps since the mid 90's and the arrival of mass violence in TJ back then. While the violence is still in TJ it has moved mostly away from the downtown corridor except on the North end of Revo in what is known as Zone Norte or the North Zone where Revolution and Coahuila Aves meet. The Norte is where all the strip clubs and prostitutes ply their wares. In general you will not notice this if you are South of the friendship arch.
 The district has reinvented itself in recent years to not only accommodate the gringos but the locals as well with many breweries, restaurants and live music clubs scattered along it's length. There are some pretty nice places here now. Gone are the huge dance clubs that use to cater to the college kids from San Diego. Some of these old clubs are now kinda like little food courts inside. It's a little odd but very affordable for some prime tacos. Dentist office and other med services including Pharmacies are sprinkled on thoroughly along the entire Ave as well still.
 All the same scams and pitfalls still exists and always will, this is Mexico after all but that is part of the charm of visiting a third world local. Make no mistake TJ is still a 3rd world City. The Revo is relatively safe but keep your wits about you, don't Flash cash or expensive items and you'll be fine.
 All and all I like what the Revo has become much better than what it was. If you liked it then you'd be better off going over to Plaza Fiesta now but that is a different review.

638284732.name: Amazing place
638284732.author: a TripAdvisor user
638284732.reviewBody: We had a great day here to explore this border city. This is a lovely place for shopping and discover the new culture, the food was tasty at local restaurant

631241825.name: Welcome to Tijuana
631241825.author: a TripAdvisor user
631241825.reviewBody:
I visited Tijuana last September. It was my first time in this border city. It was really amazing. Tijuana in general gives me the feeling of being in stand by, contemplating the life on the other side of the border, the better life, the american dream, the greener grass. 
Revolucion Ave. is nice, lots of shops and places to eat. There's a Japanese restaurant, good noodles there (I don't remember the name, but is the only one on Rev. Ave.) 
Lots of public transportation, although you have to speak Spanish to use it. Very cheap, 7 pesos and you are in 10 minutes in the beach. Tijuana beach is so ... interesting. The wall is just there and if you stare in the horizon you can actually see San Diego. 
Cold water, lots of families enjoying themselves on the beach. The music groups walk along offering to playa tune or two for the families. Musicians weraring boots, texano hats, leather vests with fringe. 
Tijuana is good, but because it is standing by the shade of the super power, the great United States, where we all think everything is better, in Tijuana you get that feeling of "not good enough". People and life in general seem to act that way. 
That is sad. 
But i do like Tijuana. I wanna go back, not in a bussiness trip, to explore a little bit more.

624831399.name: A fun two hours to kill
624831399.author: a TripAdvisor user
624831399.reviewBody: A great place to stroll and take in the many sights. Keep your valuables locked up and preferable not on your wrists or neck. Never leave your wallet, camera or cell phone out of your hands. Keep all bags and purses locked upon and you will have an adventure to remember.... Lots of people watching, good food and stores to take in. Security is a must!!! and being with a group is even better.... Not a good place to walk alone late at night particularly if you are a female.... be careful and remember security security security and you will enjoy!!

621996605.name: Movie style place
621996605.author: a TripAdvisor user
621996605.reviewBody: If you go to Tijuana you must drive though the street La Revoluci\u00f3n or you were not in Tijuana.\nIts a nice place during the day and has many attractions and land mark places.

617982593.name: GREAT STREET TO STROLL ALONG
617982593.author: a TripAdvisor user
617982593.reviewBody: The vendors are not so aggressive anymore like they where years ago. If you want to shop, there are fantastic things for great prices if you know how to bargain.\nPlenty of nice restaurants and little coffee\'s to enjoy an ice cream, lunch or just a drink and watch people go by.

617120607.name: Viva la Revolucion
617120607.author: a TripAdvisor user
617120607.reviewBody: A main attraction in the northern part of Tijuana, called Zona Norte, is Revolution Avenue. Hotels, restaurants, and lots of shops beckon the tourist. Especially funny are the donkeys that have been painted with black and white strips so as to look like zebras, waiting for you to be photographed with them. Very festive and safe.

613162024.name: Zonkeys, sombreros, Caesar salads, and so much more!
613162024.author: a TripAdvisor user
613162024.reviewBody: I\'ve watched Avenida Revu change over the past few years from its "classic" tourist shops and predictable Mexican restaurants to a place with fresh craft breweries and hip new shops and restaurants right alongside the old tourist shops with their sombreros and luchadora masks.  The zonkeys are still there and it\'s about five bucks for a photo with one of them (they print the pic right there for you, too!) and mariachi bands can be heard in a few of the restaurants, particularly on the north end of the street.\n\nIf you haven\'t been in a few years, go again.  Check out the breweries, Pasaje Rodriguez by the big Caliente Casino, look for a zonkey, and enjoy the ambience.

610972042.name: I returned to Avenida Revolucion after being away for 8 years.
610972042.author: a TripAdvisor user
610972042.reviewBody:
Since I personally know some vendors on the street, I know where to go for reasonable deals. (I'm still not afraid to dicker and bargain for a good price). 

I know el Girasol (The Sunflower) on the east side of the street. Liza (pronounced Lisa) was very friendly and can be found at No. 964 Avenida Revolucion. Jewelry, Leather Luggage, Wallets, Onyx & Iron, Wood Carvings as well as Fireworks. Phone # 685-85-61.

I ate a Caesar Salad at the Caesar Hotel & Restaurant. A small order and tow side dished ran $5.28 + propina (tip). There I chatted with an attorney from Mexicali and his wife. Great people.

Learn Spanish and enjoy Tijuana for the place it is. Fun, lively and full of surprises, It is a city of many charms.

610356094.name: Nothing to see
610356094.author: a TripAdvisor user
610356094.reviewBody: Some spots worthwhile to go down to, but you` ll miss nothing swaying away wandering through the street

606559411.name: Great late night street tacos
606559411.author: a TripAdvisor user
606559411.reviewBody: All I can say is that late night, we enjoyed some excellent street tacos! \n\nPlenty of shops, bars, trinket stores, pharmacies, restaurants, everything for everyone.

602281876.name: Street never sleep!!!
602281876.author: a TripAdvisor user
602281876.reviewBody: It is very close from the Mexico-US border. There are many bars and restaurants. Also there are many pharmacies and souvenir shops. Great place to experience modern Mexican street.

601222623.name: What a dump
601222623.author: a TripAdvisor user
601222623.reviewBody: So I came here over 10 years ago.  Everything looked fun and sort of safe as long as we stuck to the main street.  I came back with kids and what a surprise.  I did not feel safe with panhandlers and people soliciting on the street that I just kept on driving and tried to go to Mercado el Popo.  Wow, whole drive there were dump and didn\'t feel at all safe even with many many Policia cars that we decided to just go straight to our hotel.  We had a nice dinner at Mr. Pampas and went to Plaza Rio next day which felt 100 times safer with actual locals going about their business.  I\'m glad that I skipped this tourist trap.  Food cost much less at Plaza Rio where locals go.  I mean it\'s an experience to come here but that day on Friday afternoon, I believe I made a right decision by not getting off here.  On next visit I\'ll try to come earlier just so that the kids can experience a circus of Avenida Revolucion before all the drunks and pan handlers and such come out.

596718848.name: Great Place To Visit
596718848.author: a TripAdvisor user
596718848.reviewBody: This is a wonderful tourist spot just across the border from San Ysidro, CA.  There are so many Mexican shops and restaurants to go to without the expense of having to fly deep into Mexico.  You can either drive across the border or park your car right outside the border and walk across.  I personally prefer to walk across because if you drive you will probably be sitting in your car for over 3 hours just to pass customs border patrol.

596437830.name: Used to be fantastic!
596437830.author: a TripAdvisor user
596437830.reviewBody: When our family spent our summers in Rosarito Beach, we would spend the day going into Tijuana. It was fun.....lots of music, good food and great shopping, We were there last year and left after about an hour, it\u2019s dirty, half the stores are closed and it was not a place that I wanted to be at. Such a shame.......it\u2019s a dying area!\nGo to Rosarito  Beach......

596375782.name: Great People Watching
596375782.author: a TripAdvisor user
596375782.reviewBody: We walked down the Blvd. This was my first time here. There were several different bands, singers, and mariachis. Plenty of shops selling the same items. We enjoyed buying a drink and people watching. A homeless "American" walked up to us and asked for a nickle.  We denied him and he went on to tell at us...calling us liars and telling us we would burn in hell for lying. I didn\'t feel scared at that time or any other because my fiance is a big guy.

596017424.name: TJ has grown!
596017424.author: a TripAdvisor user
596017424.reviewBody: We came across the border because we were in San Diego and my sons had never been. \nWhoa, the TJ that we used to visit 20 years ago when I was college is all grown up. We had a good dinner at Los Ponchos and eked around to the shops. It was a great evening of people watching and lots of walking. If you come bring good walking shoes or you can catch a cab. We walked across the border and was asked for our passports on our way in and out. We bought some blankets and shirts! Great time! I will be back!

594661648.name: great
594661648.author: a TripAdvisor user
594661648.reviewBody: great place to walk...  good restaurants,  bars,  art and stores to see and try... \nthey have a couple of alleys where you can find fun stores,  cafe and breweries.

594536487.name: nice and clean
594536487.author: a TripAdvisor user
594536487.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this ave, it is so different then it was years ago, it is very clean, not a lot of vagrants , I felt safe as police where in the area, loved the Casino I really enjoyed the shopping

593414980.name: An Easy Day Trip..from the San Diego Trolley
593414980.author: a TripAdvisor user
593414980.reviewBody: Was disappointed that the stores all sold the same things it appeared. Oddly, not a Christmas ornament in any of them if you are looking to start a business:) Loved the church and had my Caesar salad where it was invented but basically walked up and down and then back. Those donkeys are cute. Got my Tramodols, antibiotics..but hard to tell who had the best quality as I heard there are fakes. Need to do more research. Make sure you have a Sentri entrance card or you could wait in line for hours to return. That card was a luxury and walked passed hundreds to passport control!

591028016.name: Must visit in Tijuana
591028016.author: a TripAdvisor user
591028016.reviewBody: First time to Tijuana and went straight to this area. Lots of shops, restos and street art in this historic area. Home of the original Caesar salad and lots of liquor store selling tequila.

590650804.name: Great bang for your buck!
590650804.author: a TripAdvisor user
590650804.reviewBody: Don\'t go past the Arch.  We were told that\'s entering the not so safe part of TJ. We had fun and got a lot of great deals.  Negotiated every single sale!  They\'d rather sale it for what you offer than not make a sale at all. :)

590085706.name: always a lot of fun
590085706.author: a TripAdvisor user
590085706.reviewBody: yes this is Mexico in all its splendor and glory, or at least Mexico border town.   noisy, lots of hustling going on, endless tacky souvenirs, lots of good eats, etc.  if you approach this place with the right attitude, it really is a lot of fun.

587086648.name: Souvenirs or drugs anyone? \u2013 3.25 out of 5 rating
587086648.author: a TripAdvisor user
587086648.reviewBody:
We were there on a Wednesday afternoon in May after taking the Blue Line trolley from downtown San Diego to San Ysidro (next to the Mexican border).

Once you get off the trolley, you will see the McDonald’s and the pathway to the Mexican border.  This may change once the construction is completed.

Around noon time, it took less than 10 minutes for the Mexican visa application for the both of us as there were very few people in front of us.  There is no charge for the visa application.  

After exiting the building follow the signage to get to Revolution Avenue.  It will be about a 1 mile (1.6 kilometer) walk to the Tijuana Arch landmark and Avenida Revolución.  If you get lost, use this landmark to get your bearings.  Heading back to the US, retrace your steps to get back to the highway and then walk along the highway path to get to the USA immigration building.  On the way back we waited about 20 minutes to get back to San Ysidro.

Avenida Revolución is maybe a 6 – 7 block stretch where the “action” is.  If you’ve been to Playa del Carmen, it is somewhat similar in some respects – lots of souvenir stores and restaurants.  On the Avenida Revolución there are also a few pharmacies selling cheap drugs.

We were there for about 4 hours to browse and have lunch.  We did buy 4 mini-guitars after some “serious” negotiations.

If you like souvenir shopping, this maybe the place for you.
For me it’s not the shopping but the browsing, eating and soaking in the culture.  I would rate the experience at 3.25 out of 5 rating – above average.

Notes & Tips
    • The restaurant that is said to have invented the Caesar Salad is on Avenida Revolución
    • Check out the “zebras” on Avenida Revolución and take a photo with one for a fee
    • We had lunch at El Gallo (in Tijuana), at the Santiago Arguello outdoor mall across from  the McDonald's.  Santiago Arguello “runs” right into Avenida Revolución by the Tijuana Arch.  This “mall” consists of a lot of restaurants, souvenir vendors and other businesses. 
    • If you have mobility issues and can’t walk more than 4 miles - walking to and from the border and walking down Revolution Avenue, I would suggest taking a taxi or alternate transportation once you cross the border.  There should be taxis waiting along the route once you cross the border.
    • If you need to use the washroom before heading into Tijuana, the “free” one is at Jack in the Box at the last trolley stop.  The washroom facilities in the building that houses McDonald’s is a pay facility.  The washrooms at the top of the hill behind McDonald’s are also pay toilets.
    • Check various websites for additional information
    • After our trip to Tijuana, we went to Las Americas shopping outlet in San Ysidro.  The outlet is less than one mile from the trolley line stop.  Just take the overpass and once you reach the sidewalk on the other side, walk maybe a 1/4 mile to the intersection and you will see the shopping outlet.

586287217.name: Last stop with Baja Tours
586287217.author: a TripAdvisor user
586287217.reviewBody: I came with group of 12 and since this was evening, we stopped only about 30 minutes or so before heading to SD. It would be interesting to visit shops and listen to music on the street. I did buy fake silver bracelet for $5 from sreet vendor because it was pretty. Some restaurants seemed fancy. It is quite touristic place as you can imagine.

583883716.name: Fun loving shopping and eating
583883716.author: a TripAdvisor user
583883716.reviewBody: A great place to spend some time. Friendly store keepers and the place is clean and safe for all. Don\u2019t listen to the naysayers who tell you how dangerous it is here they are very wrong, stay on the main areas where possible but even going  out of the tourist area was not an issue as no+one bothered us at all.

576834901.name: Commercial - Fun - Delicious
576834901.author: a TripAdvisor user
576834901.reviewBody: Revolution Street - Was exciting to all of my senses at the same time! So much to see, experience and eat all in one place. Everyone there was so friendly and welcoming! I bought a lot of stuff and ate some things I never heard of before. I even went into the casino and won 20 dollars!! Haha

575744814.name: Nice area and lots for tourists to do
575744814.author: a TripAdvisor user
575744814.reviewBody: Came here on our day trip to Tijuana.  We had spent a little time outside of the tourist area earlier in the day and this was the last stop.  Lots of shopping and bars and restaurants and fun people watching.  Some cool art as well and a lot of nice people!

572012394.name: Nice colorful place, at times dangerous
572012394.author: a TripAdvisor user
572012394.reviewBody: Keep am eye out, be vigilant, lots of good deals to be had, but very scarce parking, must pay if you want a spot(usually $5 or less).. lots of places to walk here, however, if you go down to "La Coahuilla" area which is off 3rd st or 2nd and Revolutcion, a little more of the shady crowd, (underbelly of TJ, prostitutes and other characters and establishments). Lots of legal activities along Revolucion, nice bars, not so nice bars and good eats. Good buys for tourists and good deals. Was in this area one very late night at 2am and big street brawl broke out, but other than staying out too late in this area..pretty safe.

570646722.name: Great time on a Friday night!
570646722.author: a TripAdvisor user
570646722.reviewBody: A friend and I were staying in TJ for the week and had the opportunity to go with our BnB owners downtown. We went to eat at Voodoo Stu\u2019s gumbo shop and then to a dance performance in a little side studio. We were so pleased with the chance to experience TJ\u2019s culture and vibe on a busy night. Definitely recommend checking the area out. There were loads of pop up vendors selling anything and everything! The street art was very enjoyable to see, live music was in the air and so many good people watching spots!

570316277.name: Visit friends
570316277.author: a TripAdvisor user
570316277.reviewBody: Revolution ave, is ok..fun bars and good spots to eat...Just be careful.now is a new restaurants to visit..

570207176.name: Enjoy
570207176.author: a TripAdvisor user
570207176.reviewBody: Everything you want is available along this ave.  Many goodies and alot of food! You need to experience the area!

569973577.name: Day of sightseeing and shopping
569973577.author: a TripAdvisor user
569973577.reviewBody: Enjoyed a day of shopping, sightseeing and eating in Tijuana. Everything was very clean and prices were great! Be aware the border crossing back to the US is a LOOOOONNNNNNGGGG line!

566389585.name: Avenida Revolucion
566389585.author: a TripAdvisor user
566389585.reviewBody: Center of the tourist area in Tijuana.  Shops, restaurants, street vendors, scammers.  Fun to walk around and look but better deals can be found just off of this main thoroughfare.  Most vendors are willing to negotiate so don\u2019t take the first offer. Seemed safe during the day but beware as the sun goes down...

566382597.name: Fun day trip from the SD trolley.
566382597.author: a TripAdvisor user
566382597.reviewBody: I took the trolley in San Diego straight to Tijuana ( about 45 minute trip), you get off at the San Ysidro station. \n I have to admit I was leery at the thought of initially going especially after the US government just put up a travel warning at that time. I went on a Friday mid morning, I didn\'t have any issues with long lines going to MX, or coming back, none at all. I will also tell you at no point did I ever feel afraid or uneasy, I felt very comfortable, safe, and welcomed there by everyone I came across and I always travel solo. This was my first trip to Mexico but I read previous reviews that travelers left so I knew where to go and where to stay at(in view of that Arch) lol.., and again I did a day trip and was gone by like 6:00pm. I met so many friendly people and bought back many cool souvenirs, and enjoyed just conversating with the store owners, everyone I encountered spoke English very well so there was no issue with that in case someone might be concerned. Many of the store owners told me how business was real slow due to all the warnings at that time. I cant say anyone was overly pushy, I dealt with way worse in Jamaica,but  just remember to be polite and respectful to everyone wherever you travel, and politely tell them no thank you if you are not interested. I had my small drawstring backpack and a couple bottles of water, I didn\'t eat or drink anything there, but that\'s just me. Also I highly advise you to either not drink alot of water, or like me you will have to "hold it in" until you get back to San Diego to go to a bathroom, seriously I saw a sign for the restroom but there was no way I was going near that from how it looked so I had to hold it in lol.. Also if you think you may be lost or just want to "confirm" you are going the right direction, there are always plenty of people to help you and police as well as border patrol, don\'t be afraid to ask them. I somehow missed the beach, I guess I didn\'t go down far enough so I can\'t comment on that, but there are many places to buy cool souvenirs and t-shirts, and things and remember they will give you "good deal", enjoy.

562406667.name: Negotiate with them!!
562406667.author: a TripAdvisor user
562406667.reviewBody: All I can tell you is you must negotiate with clerks any prices! A clerk told me a cap was $20 but turned out to be $7!!\nUnthinkable!

562283692.name: Not like it used to be
562283692.author: a TripAdvisor user
562283692.reviewBody: I was surprised to see so few tourist while downtown but given the need for passports and added security at the boarder I guess it was inevitable. I felt very safe walking around although I stayed in the primary area. Shop keepers are not as pushy as in Cancun. Pharmacy business seemed very competitive for those looking for less expensive and often over the counter medicine. The area is very slow in the morning and comes more to life at night. There was a charming casino down town that offered .25 roulette and 1.00 craps a nice change from the 10.00 minimums in the U.S. Tijuana has become a modern city although you still have to be careful walking as you never know when you will find a deep hole or other trip hazard on the sidewalks.

559867652.name: as known in TV
559867652.author: a TripAdvisor user
559867652.reviewBody: Tijuanas famous entertainment area. very lively, but folks around there are still very friendly. must visit when in Tijuana

559098092.name: Tourist haven
559098092.author: a TripAdvisor user
559098092.reviewBody: All the tourists seem to flock to this street.  Lots of shops selling souveniers.  The only reason I see to visit is to try the original Cesar Salad.

558313291.name: Shopping
558313291.author: a TripAdvisor user
558313291.reviewBody: This area of Tijuana is good if you are coming to simple look around, shop for Mexican items, and perhaps eat at a local restaurant.  I was there during the daytime and felt safe.  The only things that continues to bother me about the vendors and stores is that they are always in your face trying to sell you something.  That bugs me.

557639448.name: the revolucion
557639448.author: a TripAdvisor user
557639448.reviewBody: its worth visiting once ,but that\'s it like any other market, lot of pushy guys wanting you to buy cheap stuff

557229652.name: take peso change
557229652.author: a TripAdvisor user
557229652.reviewBody: this place is like a low rent puerto vallarta.... everything is very cheap and there is parking meters everywhere . all gifts are junk the only good thing is the people.  Also make sure to google map directions for the way back, the border lineups are REDICULOUS,.. 6 plus HOURS

556765329.name: Worth visiting once
556765329.author: a TripAdvisor user
556765329.reviewBody: This was my first visit to Tijuana. All the waiting to and from at the border is deff not worth it. Too much waiting time.\nGreat food and drinks everywhere you go!

553062276.name: Something\'s missing
553062276.author: a TripAdvisor user
553062276.reviewBody: We had done so much research on doing the day trip in to Tj from San Diego, perhaps a little too much. Unfortunately we were decidedly underwhelmed. Admittedly we weren\'t there to shop and were hoping to experience the hustle and bustle and soak up some of the vibe..............but there wasn\'t one. The entry was seemless we parked and walked over the bridge with a couple of US Border and Customs officials on their way to work who gave us a couple of tips and lessons in haggling. We were easily through the customs and visa check point and out onto the passageway up over the bridge and down onto the street. There is good directional signage and it\'s easy to stick to to strip and get yourself to the market. To be his set the market in San Antonio was far better. The food the sights the sounds smells and shopping! There was none of the authenticity that we were expecting, just a lot of food vendors wanting us to dine in their restaurants. We moved to downtown and were equally unimpressed. It was full of the same shops selling the same stuff and so many pharmacies all trying to get you to buy Viagra  and Tramadol. The streets were freshly swept and clean and everyone had something to sell, but it just felt like another street in another city. And I have seen plenty in the past three weeks driving across America. We never felt unsafe and had a couple of laughs along the street with the shop keepers. We spent a very long time in the queue waiting to cross back over the border. There is a lot of improvements being undertaken to the border facilities which will hopefully improve the wait time in the further. Not sure if I could recommend this as a great activity, pleased to have a stamp in my passport though ;)

549618720.name: Great shopping Destination
549618720.author: a TripAdvisor user
549618720.reviewBody: Review of Day trip for shopping..  Excellent spot for souvenirs from Tijuana along with some interesting photo ops.   Prices are VERY negotiable so be prepared to haggle.  .  Guissippes ITALIAN restaurant provides a classy upscale dining environment, good food and an exceptional value.

549575872.name: Tijuana Revolution St.
549575872.author: a TripAdvisor user
549575872.reviewBody: Came down to Revolution to check out the shops and vendors. The atmosphere is great and the streets are alive. Not much riff rad that I noticed due to the police presence along the roads and sidewalks. Good time here.

548513450.name: A Must Do in Tijuana
548513450.author: a TripAdvisor user
548513450.reviewBody: The best place to make a good deal on leather, jewelry and alcohol. Our driver left us at his friends shop. When done shopping that same friend arranged our ride back to the hotel. Felt very safe and in good hands.

547238912.name: Most dinamic street!
547238912.author: a TripAdvisor user
547238912.reviewBody: Want a grab a drink? Have a decent meal? Visit a Sports bar?... Maybe walk by the curious store to get a nice souvenir back home? then this is the place you should visit!

544881633.name: Awesome Experience
544881633.author: a TripAdvisor user
544881633.reviewBody: Loved it!!! Very interesting area with lots of places to party. Tia Juana\u2019s Tilly was one of the best!!

544339855.name: Not what it used to be
544339855.author: a TripAdvisor user
544339855.reviewBody: Back in the day Avenida Revoluci\u00f3n was the must go place for establishments to eat and drink but like in any other city, time has changed things. Cuisine in Tijuana it\u2019s much better than before and the best restaurants and bars are not located in Revoluci\u00f3n, with the exception of Cesar\u2019s Restaurant, and the same applies to the taquerias located there. \nIf you\u2019re looking for good food and drinks in Tijuana, Revoluci\u00f3n it\u2019s not going to be the place, but you can ask a local for other options.

543745477.name: Nice to visit at least once
543745477.author: a TripAdvisor user
543745477.reviewBody: I visited Tijuana during my trip in California. I recommend to do a day trip to Tijuana if you are staying in San Diego. Spexially if you want to hace some good tacos, tortillas, margaritas and tekila. I spent in Tijuana just few hours but enough to share some experience with locals.

543266001.name: Still cr**ppy even though they tried to clean it up
543266001.author: a TripAdvisor user
543266001.reviewBody: Still cr**py even though they tried to clean it up. Nothing here you really need other than to brag you went to Mexico. Step across the border and head back to the States, I have yet to find any redemption in Tijuana.

539784986.name: Tourist Hell - Skip it
539784986.author: a TripAdvisor user
539784986.reviewBody: REVO - what a hassle and a terrible place to hang out. TOTALLY SKIP this. You really don\'t need to see the filth and the decay.

539058396.name: Been there, done that, run away!
539058396.author: a TripAdvisor user
539058396.reviewBody: Dreadful place with no charm whatsoever. The only thing I learned from being there, was just how gloomy and sad a place can actually get. I have never been so happy to leave a place. Don\'t go if you can avoid it. If you do go: Find a place where you can drink until you can leave.

537227497.name: Used to be fairly seedy but.....
537227497.author: a TripAdvisor user
537227497.reviewBody:
Now, they've worked hard on cleaning up the area. Gone are many of the nasty strip bars (still some) still present are most of the touristy crap shops filled with stuff that amuses you once or twice after buying, then die a useless death.

Everything there is sooooo much cheaper. For instance, a good Italian restaurant off revolution, full dinner for 12 (soup, salad bread and main dish) came with a bill for $150.

Tijuana, is turning into a mega medical, dental & cosmetic surgery destination from people in the US and the far reaches of Canada. The work is about 1/3 the cost of the US and gets good to great recommendations. So with  lots of new money has come new development and cleanup.

Someone pointed out to me that the homeless don't aggressively beg, dig through garbage or sit around all day in a stew of their own making, like in the US but rather try to sell you some trinket or build and sell something or wash your windows for a buck or two and it dawned on me that it's fairly true. There's a lot of junk for sale but hey, they're trying.

I like Tijuana.

537168942.name: Be aware of the police
537168942.author: a TripAdvisor user
537168942.reviewBody: So, it was an interesting place to visit. It was good to see another country and good to explore an area I had never been before. We accidentally went the wrong way and wondered into a sketchier area of the city and turned around toward the tourist area. As we were walking back, we were stopped by the police and searched for "drugs". They searched our backpacks and pockets and had us up against the car. I\'m not sure how or why we were randomly selected (neither my friend or I have ever even done drugs), but it is kind of embarrassing and terrifying to be searched like that in a different country.

536752602.name: Must See if First Time or Haven\u2019t Been in a While
536752602.author: a TripAdvisor user
536752602.reviewBody: I would label this as the official Tourist Trap of Tijuana.  However, this place has changed drastically in the last ten years.  With change to Tijuana gastronomically and culturally in the last decade, Revoluci\u00f3n is no different.  There are craft breweries, International film theatre, interesting restaurants, as well as the standard souvenir and local craft shops .  On this day we came for a tequila festival, just one of many they have on this street throughout the year.  The intersecting Sixth Street has a variety of interesting bars for all different likes.  If you are just starting out or haven\u2019t been to the \u201cRevu\u201d in a while, time to visit.

536235361.name: If you can\'t get into the REAL Mexico, stop here
536235361.author: a TripAdvisor user
536235361.reviewBody: The last time I was through Tijuana was over 30 years ago. My how things have changed!\nJust like any town, it\'s good to explore. Once. You\'ll get better prices than on this tourist trap, but if you like crowds and hawkers, this is the place to come.

536026708.name: Visiting the shops take you back about 30 years.
536026708.author: a TripAdvisor user
536026708.reviewBody:
If the prices in the shops are posted, they are fixed. If not, be willing to bargain! Take the time and effort to know what you can bring back across the border and enjoy it. Avenida Revolucion is the biggest "tourist trap" in all of Mexico. Don't let the vendors take advantage of you and you can have a good time.

I don't drink and would recommend that you stay out of the bars on the Avenida. There are a dozen different scams that the men and women on the street to separate you from your money. Watered down drinks, "buy the woman a drink" (at double the price) and exchanging a $1 for a $10 bill confidence game. As this old sailor says, "Watch your six" (backside) or they'll clean out your wallet.

Learn to speak enough Spanish to let the local merchant realize that you can't/won't be fooled/fleeced.

Enjoy the great city that is Tijuana.

532458749.name: If the shopkeepers could only be a little more pleasant
532458749.author: a TripAdvisor user
532458749.reviewBody: Some of the things are actually quite nice.  The bummer is that the shopkeepers aren\'t.  They\'re extremely pushy.  And if you happen to be under the direction of a pushy tour guide, it\'s a lot worse. \n\nAdvice: don\'t go alone.  This is to that you can tactfully ignore the shopkeepers.

532045613.name: On a Nice Stroll through Downtown
532045613.author: a TripAdvisor user
532045613.reviewBody: Was there in the morning and it was quite and very relaxing. Was able to do some shopping and have breakfast and there not be any big  crowds.

530370884.name: Crazy street
530370884.author: a TripAdvisor user
530370884.reviewBody: Main street of night life Tijuana, this is where we can experience just the beginin of a lifetime adventure of images and vibes.
