Walk from one end to the other for the full experience from the Tijuana Arch which is hard to miss - right up to the oversized Mexican flag at the other end. There is plenty to stop and look at, eat or drink. Sunset over the arch is a pretty cool place to be before the excitement of the nightlife kicks in.  \n\nFor those concerned about safety - fear not, the usual amount of vigilance when travelling is required, but nothing more. The stories of yesteryear are exactly that. Stay alert, not alarmed.

360372404.name: SAFETY, BOARDER CROSSING, TOURISTS PASSES
360372404.author: a TripAdvisor user
360372404.reviewBody: I have crossed ever way possible from knocking on contractors windows, bicycle, motorcycle or cars.  Safety?? 1000 visits and no issue but safe crossing and crime less incidents  don\'t sell US newspapers. Tj if you want to eat, shop, sports bet, see playas, chase and catch beautiful women TJ is great....or take a picture with a painted zebra it\'s fun!! Los pulgas will draw 7,000 people on a weekend NIGHT, 100 plus security AND 8 party rooms with variety of music.  Your checked coming in no macho attitudes, cheap drinks good variety of music. Caesars is great to sit outside, smoke drink and people watch.\ncrossing the border....tourists passes are 10 dollars or most medical care facilities have them a few restaurants, finer hotels I have placed $10 in a see through envelope that has worked.  $5 cramped mini buses save time as opposed to walking. Avoid driving on Sunday, otay is much faster. Otay sometimes you end up in ready lane but the cbp r nice.

360220384.name: Spot to be for night life
360220384.author: a TripAdvisor user
360220384.reviewBody: This is the spot to be for the nightlife in Tijuana. I highly recommend the club "Hong Kong", and you can pretty much do anything in this area.

358217011.name: Good fun
358217011.author: a TripAdvisor user
358217011.reviewBody: A fun walk for people watching during the day with lots of things to do at night from concerts to restaurants to dancing.

357789754.name: VIVA TIJUANA!
357789754.author: a TripAdvisor user
357789754.reviewBody: Ever Since 1977 when we moved from Honolulu, Hawaii\nto San Diego California I have visited Tijuana. My sound reinforcement business flourished in Tijuana for Decades.

357465626.name: Revolucion tjuana
357465626.author: a TripAdvisor user
357465626.reviewBody: Calle revolucion in tijuana is fun with all the Night clubs Free Drinks ,hot girls and guys,loud music.Party place

355447740.name: Avenida Revolucion Great Police Security The Entire Area & Great Places To Eat & Dance
355447740.author: a TripAdvisor user
355447740.reviewBody: Nice to feel safe and streets welcoming as people friendly and business strive to please you.  Great places to eat up and down Avenidea Revolucion and if you are looking for night clubs and great music many to choice from.  Once you experience it your next trip will only get better.  Eat, Drink, Dance and Be Happy!!

352320790.name: "La Revu"
352320790.author: a TripAdvisor user
352320790.reviewBody: The street were all start for Tijuana, around this street Tijuana was build rebuild after 2008, this is the heart of Tijuana

350985190.name: Its fun
350985190.author: a TripAdvisor user
350985190.reviewBody: Not much really to say about Revo other than a bunch of Pharmacy shops little spots to eat /drink .Really a area for anyone to go walk around for the day. Love the Market plaza. Lots of great little finds like cheese,  mocajete and pots Even the Mexican canela is pretty reasonable there . Nothing beats a day of shopping and cheep eat and drinks

349937124.name: I felt like a money bag, everyone is trying to rip you of
349937124.author: a TripAdvisor user
349937124.reviewBody: Could have been a nice break from San Diego, but honestly, everyone is pretty much trying to get the much money they can out of you, taxi drivers, shops, restaurants, mariachis. I sat at a restaurant with a friend and a guy from a random shop just sat with us for 10 minutes trying to sell us stuff, he wouldn\'t leave. Just spend an hour there.

348341722.name: Perfect spot for a stroll
348341722.author: a TripAdvisor user
348341722.reviewBody: This is yes the tourist place to be, but also holds a lot of Mexican charm, authentic food venders, and lots of nooks and crannies of places to eat and shop. Make sure you barter, never pay the price. Great place to pick up trinkets, and typical wears. Very safe and easy walking.

347936499.name: Somewhere between Mos Eisley and Key West
347936499.author: a TripAdvisor user
347936499.reviewBody: I rode the train from San Diego to San Ysidro, went through Mexican customs/immigration and crossed into Tijuana.  It is a short 5-10 minute walk over the bridge across a plaza or two and you arrive at the Tijuana arch.  from there start walking south on one side of the street about 8 blocks and back on the other side of the street.  The sites and experiences are amazing.  Every, restaurant, bar, gift shop and farmacia has someone on the street trying to pull you in offers of free shots of tequila, cheap souvenirs to take home, jewelry for your wife, girlfriend or both and great deals on Viagra.  Every other block you have the opportunity to get your picture taken with a Tijuana zebra, a mule that is painted with stripes.  I had some amazing empenadas at El Tucamano, grabbed a couple of post cards and headed home.  Things to no: Learn how to say no, try some food and keep your head up.  Overall I felt very safe and would return.

347898451.name: This is why you go to Tijuana.
347898451.author: a TripAdvisor user
347898451.reviewBody: See the colorful sights, do some shopping (err haggling). Roam, shop and people watch. Yes, it is a tourist trap that goes on for blocks but you know that going in.

347361156.name: Great Afternoon
347361156.author: a TripAdvisor user
347361156.reviewBody: Spent a little time in the area. Very safe and easy walking. Lots of venders selling the typical Mexican flare. If you looking for a pharmacy this is the place to go. i lost count how many there were. \nThere is a casino about mid block and a very large cafe with live music and dancing open air. Kinda fun to watch.\nGreat place to people watch and enjoy the weather not to mention shop till ya drop.

347238109.name: Interesting
347238109.author: a TripAdvisor user
347238109.reviewBody: A little scary if you\'re not used to the culture.  For those accustomed to saying No, do this!  It\'s worth the walk around and cultural experience.  No, you will not be stolen from the streets.  Be smart, take photos and be careful of your loose change.

345966730.name: Lots of shops and restaurants
345966730.author: a TripAdvisor user
345966730.reviewBody: If your in the area shop till you drop. The border crossing is painless going in and slightly longer coming back. You can take a taxi back if you don\'t want to walk and wait in the long line. It livens up at night with bars and restaurants filling up. Lunch was good and shopping was inexpensive but be sure to haggle.

345298489.name: Policia Everywhere, People trying to get you inside to buy stuff!
345298489.author: a TripAdvisor user
345298489.reviewBody: I love Mexico and this place is famous.  If you have never been here you have to do.  But go in the daytime and be aware of your surroundings.  People in Mexico are very poor and have no problem picking your pockets.

344626296.name: People watching and shopping
344626296.author: a TripAdvisor user
344626296.reviewBody: This is the place to see in Tijuana. Lots of specialty shops and bars line this street for blocks. Just head for the Tijuana arch.

343982837.name: Great fun shoping for unique items, and lots of historic info if you just ask!
343982837.author: a TripAdvisor user
343982837.reviewBody: We spent about two hours here, shopping and bartering-which is apparently the name of the game, the store owners were fun to visit with and full of interesting information regarding their wares and the history of their country.  It was a great experience.  I loved the children singing and selling their bracelets-Warning-not good prices if you cant barter or say no lol!

343882315.name: Enjoyable and Secured Avenue
343882315.author: a TripAdvisor user
343882315.reviewBody: Although this avenue was busy and enjoyable, I could not find many nice restaurants along this avenue except Caesars, the restaurant which produced Caesar salad originally. Instead, there were many pharmacy shops along the street.\nI could walk along this avenue safely even at night.

341751903.name: Okay to visit--wouldn\'t go back
341751903.author: a TripAdvisor user
341751903.reviewBody: My wife and I stayed in Old Town along with another couple while in Southern CA.  On the 2nd day of our stay we decided to visit Tijuana.  We drove down 5 south to one of the public parking lots next to the border (you can also take the trolley to San Ysidro). Instead of walking across the border, we elected to take a shuttle from the parking lot to downtown Tijuana.  Although the driver knew how to deftly navigate traffic, be forewarned, the ride is not for the faint of heart ($10 round trip per person + I tipped the driver). The shuttle will drop you off at the border and wait for your group to make their way through the Mexican border crossing.  Crossing was fairly easy and took 10 minutes (~9am) ; you fill out a simple form and show them your passport.  Once the group were okay to pass, we made our way through security.  Our driver was waiting for us on the other side.  He drove us to Avenida Revolucion and dropped us off at one of their shuttle stops (near 6th and 7th).  \nOnce there we visited the numerous shops, had a couple of carne asadas, a few cervesas/margaritas, and test-tasted some tequila.  Shop owners were friendly and are definitely willing to haggle.  Most of what is sold amounts to cheap souvenirs.  Wife and I bought a couple of small items but nothing significant.  The area is fairly rundown--don\'t expect a modern looking shopping district.  As you might imagine, stores and restaurants are always approaching you to come in (even pharmacies).  But no one was ever rude or overly pushy. There\'s a good polic\u00eda presence there; never felt as if we weren\'t safe.  Once we made our way around most of the shops, we ventured to a side street.  After we spotted numerous call girls lining the block, we turned around and made our way back to the shuttle stop.  In total we were there about 4 hours.  It was cool to say I was there but wouldn\'t go back.  If there\'s a means to invest in the area, I could see it becoming a much better place to visit. However as a married couple, I would look for another location to visit.  \nOur same shuttle driver took us back across to the US.  We ended up having to go to the next border crossing location as Tijuana was backed up.  Border crossing into the US took about an hour.  Was kind of cool; there are musicians and people selling snacks/drinks while you wait in line.

341261537.name: Exactly what you\'d expect - and that\'s a good thing!
341261537.author: a TripAdvisor user
341261537.reviewBody: If you go to TJ, this is pretty much the destination. If you can shop with a couple caveats - this is all knock-off, everything is negotiable, and you can absolutely walk away - then this place is a blast. Fantastic food everywhere, and vendors that will sell you anything for just about any price. It\'s great for medications, alcohol, and leather products. I\'d stay away from "premium" cigars.

340588053.name: anything and everything and things you did not know you wanted. LOL
340588053.author: a TripAdvisor user
340588053.reviewBody: We spent a few hours here. We shopped until we ran our of money. So many things to see. And the food was awesome.

340556988.name: Tourist trap
340556988.author: a TripAdvisor user
340556988.reviewBody: This street represents the tourist trap portion of tijuana. Its mainly pharmacies (its to take advantage of usa drug pricing), restaurants, trinket shops. If you   make the crossing by foot from the san ysidro entry just cross over the bridge and start looking for the silver arch and walk towards it.

339956707.name: Fun Haggling But HAs Good Buys
339956707.author: a TripAdvisor user
339956707.reviewBody: We had a great time here.  Not only felt really safe walking and buying items but it was fun strolling around looking at the various quality of goods from cheap beads to fine jewelry and high end knock off purses only found if you are invited into the back room after developing a comfort level.  Excellent buys but don\'t accept their initial offering in price and quality.

339738390.name: Still Fun to Shop and Eat
339738390.author: a TripAdvisor user
339738390.reviewBody: Revolucion is still a fun place to shop for things to bring home and have some Mexican food. It has changed over the n early 50 years since I first visited. It is safe to walk and there is problems if you do not wander away from the tourist areas. Visit and enjoy.

338704495.name: Shopping and food
338704495.author: a TripAdvisor user
338704495.reviewBody: Along Revolucion are many tourist shops and eateries.  This is one of the busiest tourist areas and is fun just to walk along and people watch.  Fun to chat with the vendors.  There are many different eateries along the boulevard from just tacos off a cart to fine dinning in a restaurant.

338549709.name: Tourist road
338549709.author: a TripAdvisor user
338549709.reviewBody: This is where all the tourists hang out so the shops all cater to tourism. Lots of shops to buy souvenirs, eat, drink and have a good time. Not far from the border.

337057019.name: Campy But a Can\'t Miss
337057019.author: a TripAdvisor user
337057019.reviewBody: Everyone visits the Avenue once during a trip to Tijuana.  There are souvenirs galore, everyone bargains and where else would you find donkeys painted like zebras on every corner?

336796585.name: Great trip!
336796585.author: a TripAdvisor user
336796585.reviewBody: We spent a day here and it was well worth the trip from San Diego.  Very different and worth the trip.  We were impressed with our friendly all the people were on our visit. Worth a trip!

335580480.name: Big City Vibe
335580480.author: a TripAdvisor user
335580480.reviewBody: I was on the Avenida as part of  a tour that focused primarily on other districts of TJ. We visited on a Saturday evening and found it to have an electric energy and vitality. We never felt unsafe but again, we were with a group and were also walking purposefully to our next destination. That made a difference and I\'d recommend doing the same-going with friends and having an idea of where you want to go next, rather than ambling. Many locals were out, heading for dinner or a drink., which added to the vibrancy. The biggest hazard we faced was the rough condition of some sidewalks, not only here but all over the city; definitely a place for sturdy shoes

334943154.name: Typical Trouist Trap
334943154.author: a TripAdvisor user
334943154.reviewBody: Painted donkeys, cheap poorly made crafts and margaritas. Lots of vendors yelling at us as we passed, some meaner than others.

334485378.name: Fun and safe!
334485378.author: a TripAdvisor user
334485378.reviewBody: I went on a day trip and visited avenida revolucion and really enjoyed it. I felt safe and got some great deals. Visited Casa Cacao for lunch and would definitely recommend it, as well as just walking around.

334432350.name: Few Gems If You Search Hard Enough
334432350.author: a TripAdvisor user
334432350.reviewBody:
Not too much to see or do unless you are into looking for tchotchkes and beer. This is the tourist trap of TJ. 

We came to have lunch at Ceasar's and decided to walk around and managed to find a few gems...

Ceasar's:  Namesake salad invented here and lived up to its hype. Bone marrow is a winner too. 

Pasaje Rodriguez:  Cute alley with fun street art. Found a coffee shop with lavender infused syrup to accompany an amazing smooth latte. 35 MXN = $2.05

Mercado El Popo:  This was hard to find and we walked around twice. Its not on the strip, but on Peuerto Tercera. It's hidden by the multiple stalls...but look for stalls selling spices or cheese. Bought a Nicky painted mug for less than $2.

332939478.name: Good for tourists, but shouldn\'t be the only place you visit!
332939478.author: a TripAdvisor user
332939478.reviewBody: The Revu is a great start for a tourist, but doesn\'t represent TJ as a whole.  There\'s some cool shops if you head up the Revu.  On the Sexta there\'s quite a few places for having drinks and check out Colectivo 9 for some great variety in food.  And don\'t forget to buy something from the I love TJ store!\nIf you\'re looking for a guided tour - check out Turista Libre.  There\'s also a ton of festivals throughout the year that are cool: Tequila Fest, Taco Fest, Toys for Tots, etc.\nIf you\'re coming just for the day, don\'t come on Sunday!  The border wait to get home will be way longer than you expect (3 hours on average in the afternoon)

332391597.name: Exciting vibe!
332391597.author: a TripAdvisor user
332391597.reviewBody: I took the trolley from San Diego and crossed the border on foot. There are hundreds of people waiting to cross into the USA, and once you pass them it\'s quiet for a couple of blocks. But then you hear the music and see the crowds of Avenida Revolucion! There are taquerias, sobrero stores, and a great, lively atmosphere for a few blocks.

332166248.name: Fun fun fun.
332166248.author: a TripAdvisor user
332166248.reviewBody: It\'s great to get out and relax. Many cool places to see and things to do. It has never disappointed.

331955929.name: Fun experience
331955929.author: a TripAdvisor user
331955929.reviewBody: I went to Tijuana and found that as of September 2015, the Mexican authorities require a passport, which is different from simply walking through with no interaction with border control.  There are a number of taxis that will try to convince you to take a taxi to downtown, but it is a fairly short walk to Avenida Revolucion.  A walk down Avendia Revolucion is always fun to see what treasures can be found in the various shops.  As a word of caution, the lineup to return to the US can be a couple of hours long, so if you have a Nexus or Sentra pass, you can walk right pass the lineup and get into the special line.  Alternatively, you can pay $6 to take a bus which drops the passengers off at the front of the queue.

331434421.name: Great Place.........if you come to buy Medicin
331434421.author: a TripAdvisor user
331434421.reviewBody: Arriving around 9 in the morning I found Avenida Revolucion fairly empty.  Most shops (except the pharmacies which seems to be open around the clock) were still closed and didn\u00b4t open untill 10 AM or past.  Anyhow, when they finally opened, I didn\u00b4t find anything worth bringing home.\nAvenida Revolucion seemed fairly abandoned and neglected to me.  I imagine though, that it might be OK if you come to Tijuana in the evening to party.

329398869.name: The gateway to Mexico
329398869.author: a TripAdvisor user
329398869.reviewBody:
I visit Tijuana once a year on my yearly trip to Mexico

Avenida Revolucion is quite unique street, one end of the street you can find  nice decent international  cuisine restaurants and the other the infamous 1st. street or Coahuila street, where sexoservidoras or prostitutes swamp the street along with some decent bars, you can find anything you look for on this 10 block avenue.

I stay at the surprisingly decent hotel Aqua Rio hotel, very clean, free coffee and fruit-based daily breakfast for about 35 US dolls /night
What I most enjoy -if you can - is the amazing breathtaking highway Tijuana - Ensenada, if you have the time take the road and stop at some of the cliffs along the highway.

327526479.name: Take your time, you WILL save money.
327526479.author: a TripAdvisor user
327526479.reviewBody: A lot of the stores have the same kind of stuff so look for exactly what you want. Also ask the price, compare a little and most things are about half what they first ask for. Up 3 blocks from Ceasars heading toward town on the same side is a excellent boot shop . Got some great Copperhead Snakeskin Boots for under $150. \n

327255861.name: Spent the Afternoon Wandering Revolution
327255861.author: a TripAdvisor user
327255861.reviewBody: My wife had been to Tijuana many years ago but I had never been.  She wanted to take me there on our most recent vacation.  I was apprehensive reading many online reviews saying that Tijuana was unsafe.  We decided to go anyway and I spent some time trying to find something to do.  Once we made it over the border we took a taxi to Avenida Revolution.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  It was cleaner than I had imagined.  The stores were tiny and selling lots of cheap souvenirs, exactly what I had expected but also what we were looking for.  Although the shop owners were assertive in trying to lure us into their stores, they weren\'t pushy.  We found the atmosphere fun.  We were there until about 7 PM, as it got dark.  I felt completely safe the entire time.  We did not eat but we bought plenty of souvenirs and some tequila to take back with us.  It was a pleasant visit and I am sure I would go back to see more of the city.

326063426.name: Pleasant Surprise!
326063426.author: a TripAdvisor user
326063426.reviewBody: Man this place has changed! I went there during my entire high school career and had an amazing hopping from bar to bar seeing which one had the talent that night. I went recently and found to be a changed place, for the better! The streets were filled with local tourists and the atmosphere was a little electric. There were tons of things going on, huge motorcycle groups driving by in Harley\'s to scooters, classic cars, tons of street food and everyone in great spirits and very friendly!  My suggestion is to go check it out, you\'ll have a great time!

324324835.name: Fun street to visit
324324835.author: a TripAdvisor user
324324835.reviewBody: My family and I stayed at hotel aqua rio and visited this street, fun ice cream shop called 42 flavors, and also ate at cesars restaurant. Great tasting restaurant, only a few minutes from the hotel.

322761003.name: Welcome to Mexico
322761003.author: a TripAdvisor user
322761003.reviewBody:
Good place to go if you don't have visa 
You can cross the US border Walking or via cars....
Good place to party and very cheap
A litlle dangerous and dirty...

322095665.name: It\'s TJ
322095665.author: a TripAdvisor user
322095665.reviewBody: I hadn\'t been to TJ in about 15 years, so I was itching to go when I moved back to SD.  I finally found the time to go when a friend was visiting.  Of course we walked across and then did the tour de Revolucion.  It hadn\'t changed much from what I remember.  Everyone kept saying not to go, it\'s too dangerous. It was fine.  There were several upgrades like Colectivo 9 at Avenida Revolucion 1241.  I would definitely exchange money before hand, negotiate any cab fare in advance and if you haven\'t already sign up for Global Entry or Sentri, there is literally no wait to get back into the US.

320768945.name: Take it for what it is.
320768945.author: a TripAdvisor user
320768945.reviewBody: If you tell most Americans that you enjoy Tijuana you will get a funny look. I personally enjoy going down there every once in a while. Its very easy to take the trolley from San Diego and walk across and back. The last time I was there I was able to see some cool folk dancing, haggle on a switchblade knife, eat at a great street taco place, have a few cervesas while watching mariachi bands. I got to see a drunk get handcuffed by the police and saw some fake police waiting for a gullible victim near the exit area for a bribe. All fun to me.

318141095.name: Overly rated border city
318141095.author: a TripAdvisor user
318141095.reviewBody: if you want to go to another country without visa from the states, then take a day break in Tijuana, mexico. To cross border and take a walk to the other land is just exciting. This landmark is visible from the US too. Nothing really close by the attraction except for eateries and local markets. You get cheap beer and drinks compared to US but you have to bargain real hard. There is a digital watch maintained by Samsung.\n\nIf you are on a Work permit to the US, the your I94 will change with the exit and reentry to the US.

315744217.name: Two day trip
315744217.author: a TripAdvisor user
315744217.reviewBody: Nothing but restaurants, i loved it. Feel free to ask if its not on the menu, chances are they have it. My BF and I went Friday and stayed till Saturday (it\'s not safe after 10pm). Be prepared to walk ALOT!

314493424.name: This is the purely touristy strip for those with only hours to spend in TJ. Fun for a one time visit. Circus-like fun.
314493424.author: a TripAdvisor user
314493424.reviewBody: The farther one gets from the arch, the more one sees the "Real" Mexico. I especially like the Sweets and Spice Market.. . . mercado el popo. It\'s a smallish market, but clean and fascinating.

314423014.name: very touristic
314423014.author: a TripAdvisor user
314423014.reviewBody: main street in TJ, definitely more fun during weekend nights as it is full of clubs\nduring the day there are plenty of souvenir shops\nof course it is full of americans and very touristic, not the best place to enjoy real Mexico

311038043.name: Tijuana\u00b4s main touristic street
311038043.author: a TripAdvisor user
311038043.reviewBody: Since two years ago this \u00e1rea has been reborn.  I advice to park your car or start your walk at 8th street at Sanborn\u00b4s there is a public parking lot, there you can start walking and first you will see the hold Jai Alai palace was, you can take the traditional picture with the Zebra-donkeys or walk all the way to first street where a monumental clock and ark is located at Plaza Santa Cecilia to listen to mariachi music and eat traditional mexican food.  If you want to taste something innovative go to "colectivo 9" between 8 and 7 street (ask for it), where you will find at least 9 chef\u00b4s with experimental and unique cuisine.  You can buy mexican handcrafts and a local suvenir from the I LOVE TJ store

310384507.name: Super tourist yet fun
310384507.author: a TripAdvisor user
310384507.reviewBody:
I do not like typical tourist places but my friend insisted. 
There was a vintage car show  for a few blocks and they had live music playing. That kinda set a fun mood. 
We walked down the street and found some real great buys. I wish I remembered the names of the shops. 
If you feel intimidated or annoyed at the pushy vendors just keep on walking but you could be missing out on a super deal!

310326428.name: Fun with my husband
310326428.author: a TripAdvisor user
310326428.reviewBody: We stayed at hotel Ticuan which is walking distance from Avenida Revoluci\u00f3n. On Saturday evening we decided to walk around the Avenida around 8 pm. We had a couple of drinks in a couple of bars and then ate nachos and watch people walk by. Had a very nice time. As the evening progressed the environment was much more "party" like so we decided to go back to our hotel. For low key couples I recommend walking around the Avenida from 8 to 10 pm.

309290490.name: buyer beware
309290490.author: a TripAdvisor user
309290490.reviewBody: lots of pushy street venders if you stand your ground you can make a real deal we were always concerned about our safety from police and thugs alike we never had a problem on this street though

308398085.name: Typical Tourist Trap
308398085.author: a TripAdvisor user
308398085.reviewBody: Tourist Trap, just bargain bargain bargain and be prepared to walk away. don\'t go to any restaurant or bar where you are enticed on the pavement.

307868396.name: Safe and full of culture
307868396.author: a TripAdvisor user
307868396.reviewBody: All I can say is that I felt extremely safe while walking around town. The people are amazing and the food delicious!

306964906.name: Great place to go
306964906.author: a TripAdvisor user
306964906.reviewBody: During day is a great place to be at for the night to start. An at night lots of clubs an people from all over places. Great area

305820249.name: It was better 15 years ago.
305820249.author: a TripAdvisor user
305820249.reviewBody: I went to Tijuana, for "shopping" on Avenida de la Revolucion last time in 2000. Well this time it was a bit different. Going to Tijuana by foot was easy, you just walk over the border and catch a taxi that brings you to Avenida Revolucion. But coming back was hell. We had to wait in a line for over 2 hours (and that was not a busy day). The controls done by the US customs are so slow, it\'s crazy. Anyway, it\'s the last time I go to Tijuana. \n\nBut we had a blast there; good food, people very nice, cheap sombreros and lucho libre masks :-)

305059265.name: Not like in the old days
305059265.author: a TripAdvisor user
305059265.reviewBody: Nice place to visit, however is full of drug stores and bars not like in the old days, not much tourist attractiuons to see...Governement insisted they will change the image but so far this didn\'t happened...

303817212.name: Not a lot to see and security concerns always in your mind.
303817212.author: a TripAdvisor user
303817212.reviewBody: Long street where you can find lots of places to eat, trinkets, and friendly people. I did not see many tourists there and a great police presence (is it good or bad?).\nDespite the security concerns and the US government advisory, I felt safe there during daylight hours. I would not recommend the area at night and, above all, not visiting TJ alone, even during the day. If you decide to buy a souvenir, ask around and negotiate the price. It will go down for sure.\nPersonally, what I saw was not worth the effort and the risk.

303085184.name: Not the Tijuana I remember
303085184.author: a TripAdvisor user
303085184.reviewBody: Not the Tijuana i remember, but it has been 25 years. After walking across the border we took a taxi for $5 to Revolution Avenue. I was suprised by the lack of tourist even for the middle of the day during the summer. Looks like most of the souvener shops have been replaced by drug stores. We walked around for about an hour and pretty much saw everything. I was worried about safety but we all felt safe even during the taxi rides. I would probably not go back, but my teens can say they have been to Mexico.

297619097.name: A Fun Day Trip! If you shop, be sure and dicker!
297619097.author: a TripAdvisor user
297619097.reviewBody: This is a fun day trip if you are a San Diego local!  The happening street in TJ is Avenida Revolucion which is approx. 5-10 min. walk once you cross the border.  Crossing the border into TJ is fast, but be prepared for a wait upon your return as you will have to go through customs, and don\'t forget your passport or passport card!  There is no cost for this activity, but do plan to bring some cash so that you can shop.  You can get some great deals if you know how to dicker.  Do not be shy about dickering as it is expected, so if you don\'t, you will be paying far more than the going price.  I tested this by dickering (bargaining) for the same item--a backgammon board--with several different vendors who had differing starting prices and discovered that if one dickers long enough with each vendor, one will end up with the same final price!\nSome fun, but free or cheap activities in TJ are as follows: You can enjoy the sound of Mariachis which will make you feel that you are truly in a foreign country even though you may live just a few miles from the border!  There are lots of places to get super cheap Margaritas--just be sure to order them without ice as ice is afterall made from their water! (That is if you do not wish to experience Turista aka Montezuma\'s Revenge.)  If you want water in a restaurant, be sure to ask for bottled water!  Agua Caliente racetrack is always a fun visit and is free unless you bet.  I will usually place one tiny bet to either Win, Place, or Show depending on the horse I am betting on, just to make the race a little more exciting.  If you can go on a day when they are having greyhound racing, it is even more fun, because you can view the greyhounds being weighed right before the race.  I usually look to see which greyhound seems to be more spirited and bet on that dog as I believe it ups my chances of winning.  It\'s fun to watch the greyhounds chase the mechanical rabbit around the track, but what would be even more fun would be to something I have heard about but haven\'t had an opportunity to see: some days monkeys are dressed like jockeys and ride the greyhounds.  I have yet to discover when this happens and sometimes believe that it is just a rumor, but several different people have told me that this DOES happen! You can find the Agua Caliente racetrack at the far end of Avenida Revolucion if you\'re coming from the border.

297578550.name: Tijuana is Amazing!!
297578550.author: a TripAdvisor user
297578550.reviewBody:
Excellent food, culture and evryone there is amazing.
We had a great time there. Spent almost 2 years relaxing, exploring the beaches, shoppes, restaurants, bars, clubs and scenery..

Tijuana is amazing. A must see and visit for everyone.

295229224.name: Great experience, especially for San Diego Tourists
295229224.author: a TripAdvisor user
295229224.reviewBody: Tijuana is a great experience, especially if you are in San Diego and want to spend a day in a quite different environment. We first had security concerns, but everybody was friendly and polite. We always felt safe and we enjoyed great restaurants and shops and got the chance to have chats with several people.\n\nGetting to Tijuana was easy: We parked on the US-side, then had a 10 minute walk across the border. Our 3-year-old daughter joined us on this trip, so we decided to take a taxi to Avenida Revolucion (USD 5), but it\'s also no problem to walk. Crossing the border back to the US took us about an hour, so be prepared to wait.

292328366.name: Just needs tourists
292328366.author: a TripAdvisor user
292328366.reviewBody: I hadn\'t been to Tijuana in 20 years and was eager to revisit. I was impressed!  It is clean, the people are friendly and the food is great.  The border crossing (into Mexico) is one of the easiest and nicest experience I have had too.  YOU should go!

290717740.name: Plaza Santa Cecilia and the Mariachi
290717740.author: a TripAdvisor user
290717740.reviewBody: Very nice road, lot of shops, good restaurants, lot of clubs, good night life. At the end there is this square, Plaza Santa Cecilia, by the arch, with the typical great mariachi, many different bands...Beautiful!

288561343.name: Fun place to party at night
288561343.author: a TripAdvisor user
288561343.reviewBody: Pretty fun nightlife here but day shopping here is okay not really anything special food several dining choices here

288284132.name: Lots of shopping
288284132.author: a TripAdvisor user
288284132.reviewBody: There are many shop along revolution  that offer a wide range of goods. However most items offered  for sale are cheaply made and of low quility. The rule here is you will be quoted a higher price for the item your interested in. If they ask 10.00 most likely you can barter for 4:00 to 6:00.\nRemember  all that is shinny is not real. Extream caution should  be in place when purchasing in pesos with dollars. Always  barter in the currency you are most comfortable in dealing with.

287777708.name: Not worth the trip
287777708.author: a TripAdvisor user
287777708.reviewBody: I had a specific reason I had to go to this area, but I wouldn\'t otherwise recommend it.  It is crowded, dirty, and seems somewhat dangerous even during the day.

287110290.name: Definitely not the best of Mexico
287110290.author: a TripAdvisor user
287110290.reviewBody: If you want to learn something about Mexico, and enjoy your visit, this is definitely not the place to come.  The best restaurants left for other areas (Colonia Aviacion, the Zona Rio) a long time ago, so did the better stores.  What is left is a cheap, not very well maintained version of its former self.  If you like studying older architecture, the old jai alai palace is still here, so is Caesar\'s famous restaurant and there is a Sanborn\'s still operating....and there is the "arch"....a nice landmark....but otherwise the street is populated with a lot of shabby discount stores and pharmacies and very cheap souvenir stores selling stuff that you will be getting rid of at your next yard sale.  The poor donkeys that have been painted to look like zebras are still, unfortunately, there....its really difficult to visit this street without coming away feeling really depressed and sad....better to go to the newer parts of Tijuana for a much better and more positive experience and less hassle from sellers of cheap souvenirs, watered down alcohol and other merchandise and services of ill repute.

286519701.name: Just what you expect!
286519701.author: a TripAdvisor user
286519701.reviewBody: Crowded, loud, bars, restaurants, souvenir shops, fake zebras (yes, I said fake zebras) etc...\nYour typical tourist trap

284819189.name: You find the best price by bargaining . . . and walking away . . .
284819189.author: a TripAdvisor user
284819189.reviewBody: For eleven years, my wife and family and I enjoyed San Diego . . . beginning in June, 1970!  And learning how to bargain in Tijuana on Agenda Revolution is a HUGE reason!  And I didn\'t learn by observing my close friend who was a native of San Diego.  When he first walked off from a "deal" . . . I was turned off.  And then I saw him come back . . . and again . . . and again . . . and then he had a deal!  The price was right!  And what a deal!  Next, I found just the fireplace screen that would work in our new home!  Could I negotiate?  It seemed heartless to me, BUT . . . I wanted the fireplace screen!  So when he priced it to me, I countered.  And he refused.  What was I going to do?  I left.  Shopped around.  Even left the shop.  And price some other screens -- but not what I wanted.  So I came back and asked his price again.  He dropped it a tad.  So, I came up slightly.  He came back with a price closer to mine.  And the fun began!  And before long, I took home the deal of a lifetime . . . it was there when we sold the home nearly ten years later!

284445095.name: Tense
284445095.author: a TripAdvisor user
284445095.reviewBody: Nervous about going here, but had never been to Mexico before, so just wanted to try. Made sure to not take any credit cards. Just stayed about 1 hour and spent $20 on variety of cheap stuff as souvenirs. We were very happy to get back in USA!

284394297.name: Not what it used to be, but still fun
284394297.author: a TripAdvisor user
284394297.reviewBody: We have gone to Tijuana for years. It seems the same but the shops are closing with the lack of tourists. Still a unique experience but the wait to cross the boarder back into the USA is too long

282463601.name: Always Trouble and Hassle in Tijuana
282463601.author: a TripAdvisor user
282463601.reviewBody:
Do you like to get pulled over by the police every day? Well, that is the reality of tijuana. The police are always out to get you! Even if you are driving normal and don't nothing wrong they hassle you, try to get bribes and threaten to tow your car away. It is not the city for the faint of heart. 

Further, everyone is always asking you for money. Any moment you can be robbed. Go to a bar/club and expect them to overcharge you, rob you or steal your phone.

I say all this from experience.

279386268.name: HUSTLES AND HASSLES????
279386268.author: a TripAdvisor user
279386268.reviewBody: A half day here is probably ok. it has obviously died alot since the hey-days, and outside of the few block swhich are alive, the shops are boarded-up. Even on the main drag, many small adjacent malls or alleys are deserted. The hustlers working for the shops are not as bad as made out by other reviewers. I have seen worse. They are very polite, and if you don\'t want to go inside, then be courteous to them; they are just trying to feed their familia, like you or I.\n\nMaybe one third of the stores are Farmacias, one third souvenir shops. According to people i spoke to, the police are the only ones who will bother you, if you bother them.

277879687.name: Best to take to bus and not drive down from San Diego
277879687.author: a TripAdvisor user
277879687.reviewBody: Oh my goodness, be careful if you go here.  Make sure to negotiate with the shop keepers- they expect it and it\'s part of the fun. But DO be extra careful with your safety and belongings.

275170563.name: A Sensory Overload
275170563.author: a TripAdvisor user
275170563.reviewBody:
My wife loves the Revo. I can take it or leave it.

It is colourful, noisy, full of different aromas (in some cases aroma is a very, very generous word!), full of shopkeepers trying to hook you into their shops and others trying to get you into their bars.

It has a lot of restaurants and bars, nightclubs and cafes. It is interesting as a place for people watching with a beer or a meal. The pasajes are cool, with little craft beer bars and bookshops and galleries, always with something going on. 

I wouldn't say it's a destination you should definitely get to but it has enough going on for many people to enjoy an afternoon. I am not too sure I would spend a lot of my time here if I had kids as there is just so much going on, I find it difficult to be in sometimes. Almost anywhere along the avenida you are bombarded by noise coming from bars, restaurants, pharmacies(!), it often feels like you are listening to three or four songs at the same time.

It is the Revo nightlife that shines as it's stand out element for the young and young at heart. With the sexta, there are so many venues for punk gigs, banda music, 80s cheese, more modern music and old fashioned cantina style drinking that everone will find something to do. There is a large place on one corner that pretends it is a fish taco restaurant: on the right nights the whole floor is packed with people dancing to salsa music, sometimes so many they spill onto the street. It is a sight to behold!

 The food options are good late at night too, especially around the weekends as there are some very nice pizza places such as the ferreteria and a good burger and hotdog place on the sexta that have vegetarian and vegan options.It is a busy place, day and night. Every night is a party here and this is what gives Revolucion a good grade instead of average.

274850611.name: The Tijuana Jazz and Blues Festival
274850611.author: a TripAdvisor user
274850611.reviewBody: The music scene in Tijuana is excellent.  The food was great and musicians truly enjoy their craft and it shows

274566646.name: The Heart of What Tijuana is Best Known For
274566646.author: a TripAdvisor user
274566646.reviewBody: At night Avenida Revolucion is great for people watching.  It also has numerous restaurants and drinking establishments.  During the day it is good for shopping.  This was the first paved road in North America, when prohibition prompted many Americans to visit Tijuana to for legal drinking.

274172642.name: Pathetic
274172642.author: a TripAdvisor user
274172642.reviewBody:
I guessed I'm not the haggling type. I don't like people pressuring me when I shop. This is a pathetic little market with shops that sell the same things and desperate shopkeepers trying to flatter you into buying over priced junk that you don't want or need. 
I guess just like every other third world country tourist market. 
I felt bad for the poor donkeys painted like zebras forced to stand on the hard concrete in the heat all day with no water or shade. I did not feel safe there even with a huge police presence. 
Not my kind of thing.

273164356.name: Stressful but worth a day trip for the experience
273164356.author: a TripAdvisor user
273164356.reviewBody:
We only went down for a couple of hours but that was enough. The people were all friendly enough and we didn't have a bad experience but we couldn't help but feel stressed for our safety. Maybe that's just because it was our first time and can barely speak a word of Spanish.
The shop owners can spot a tourist a mile away and are pretty pushy with their sales pitch so I got over saying 'no gracias' pretty quickly. 
It wasn't as cheap as you hear Mexico is but then again it's not a real representation of Mexico in my opinion. There are much nicer and more genuine places to go but as far as a border town and the convenience that comes with it it's worth a day trip down.

Be wary about the wait to get back into the U.S. We walked over and had to wait about an hour which didn't seem as bad as it was when we entered. I wouldn't bother driving over for the added stress, traffic and police but I haven't done it so can't say for sure.

271785159.name: Bit of a trap
271785159.author: a TripAdvisor user
271785159.reviewBody: It\'s pretty and fill of shops with big pressure sales people.  They negotiate pretty hard so if u want something offer 75% less than they start with and do not go past 40-50% of staying price

271651666.name: Meh-xico
271651666.author: a TripAdvisor user
271651666.reviewBody: I just returned to this Avenida after about 15 years and it\'s sadder than I remember. Just a lot of desperate/pushy people trying to sell made-in-China "Mexican" things and 2 for 1 margaritas. Please don\'t think this is the real Mexico. It\'s such an amazing country. This street is nothing like it.

270812756.name: Went here several times
270812756.author: a TripAdvisor user
270812756.reviewBody: Enjoyed the shopping, sights, places for lunch etc. This is the main tourist drag in town. Kids had a great time.

269768456.name: If you\'re a fan of tourist traps...
269768456.author: a TripAdvisor user
269768456.reviewBody: ...then this is a great place to visit. Typical Tijuana. Food is hit or miss, but is always beyond reasonably priced. Vendors are everywhere selling trinkets. They\'re a bit pushy, but either stop to buy, or just keep walking. I\'m not a barfly myself, but I have to say that the bars are probably one of the best things about this place. Drinks are always dirt cheap. Music is pretty good. Crowds are pretty decent. Anytime I\'ve been inside of any of the bars there I\'ve had a good time. It\'s worth a visit at least once. Parking on the streets in residential areas isn\'t too difficult, and you can almost always park for free, but the streets surrounding this one are extremely sketchy and worrisome. I can honestly say the handful of times I\'ve parked around there that I have actually worried about my safety just a bit. Do not venture very far to the north as you will enter the red light district, and that is extremely troublesome. Do it once, try it out, and then you can say you\'ve experienced TJ.

269452967.name: Small town feel for a big city.
269452967.author: a TripAdvisor user
269452967.reviewBody: I liked the statues along the avenue and the many shops, I didn\'t care for the prices too much as they seem to raise them and want dollars instead of pesos being near the border and a sort of "tourist trap."

267541914.name: Visible updating construction in progress
267541914.author: a TripAdvisor user
267541914.reviewBody: We enjoyed our day with a slow walk down revolution avenue. We saw many interesting sites including some less desirable ones. As with anything if you look for good you find good and if you don\'t you won\'t. The reconstruction is coming along nicely. It is well policed and we didn\'t feel threatened at all. Lots of good restaurants. Many interesting shops. A good afternoon well spent time.

266537993.name: Terrifying random searched by police
266537993.author: a TripAdvisor user
266537993.reviewBody:
A friend and I were walking near the northern end of Revolution Avenue (near the arch) when two police approached asking for ID.  It was about 1:00am on the wee hours of Saturday morning.  After some initial questions such as where we've been and where were going, he said we’d be subject to a drug search.

They asked us to place our hands on the police car as they dug aggressively through our pockets.  Throughout, they asked pointed questions about where we lived and where we were born.  The officers weren't rude, but they weren't polite either.  There was just something less-than-professional about their demeanor.

What was most terrifying was that the search occurred in a quiet section of Revolution Ave where few witnesses were around.  Our fears were that these cops would plant drugs and set us up for extortion.

After it was obvious we had no drugs, the cops adopted a more conciliatory tone about needing to combat drug trafficking.  I told him I understood his mandate and that I didn't mind the inconvenience.  Then, he let us go.

I understand the city's effort to combat drug trafficking and organized crime.  But surely, the officers could have conducted these random searches in a more reassuring manner, one that wouldn't chase away the few remaining tourists that are still visiting Tijuana.

For example, I read recently how Tijuana police are now equipped with body cameras.  The cops could have assured us of a fair search by giving the option of having the search video-recorded.  They could also have said we could summon tourist police for help before the search began or to invite us to a more well-lit, more populated area to conduct the search.  Lastly, the cops could have given us their names and badge numbers.

Aside from this unsettling ordeal, I was surprised Tijuana cleaned up dramatically.  It's been ten plus years since my last trip.  Now, there are fewer beggars, less street prostitution and the street simply looked better.  But prices also have gone up.  Don't expect cheap drinks and food anymore.

Equally noticeable was the lack of tourists.  It was Friday night and most bars and restaurants were 80% empty, and most patrons were locals.  There was something wild and crazy about Tijuana of the 1990s.  Now, it's just a subdued street with a few bars and US prices.  You can get the same thing in San Diego, except you won't get stopped and searched by police.

265374392.name: Its bordertown mexico
265374392.author: a TripAdvisor user
265374392.reviewBody: Visted  here with my daughter  while we took a tour basically  its a tourist  trap its all store fronts with tourist stuff  pharmacys everywhere restaurants  and cantinas it can be seedy the further inn you go they even got a red light district  but we didnt go that far every shop owner is trying to get you in there store to buy something  basically  they try everything they can to make a sale  having been all over mexico this is nothing like real mexico towns but this is typical fast paced seedy border town mexico where most people come once and never return so people will do anything  at all cost to get your business  there are some good restaurants  but i didnt stay long enough  to try them out we spent about 5 hours then left

263430353.name: DONT DO IT !
263430353.author: a TripAdvisor user
263430353.reviewBody:
Visited when staying in san Diego  - visiting Tijuana should come with a 'stress' warning. Not sure what I was expecting but shocked at what we got and saw....!

Very poor run down rough and foreign - even though san diego USA was a stones throw away - its a world away. The contrast between the two couldn't be more extreme.

Didn't feel quite safe ? was bothered a lot by store keepers - nothing of any value was marked up with price everything was open for barter - and with regard to the jewellery i was looking at uneasy about it being fake !

Bought some artefacts - feel we paid over the top.
 
Very seedy bars and loud music ( though it was only lunch time) with large first floor balconies with lots of very young girls and boys trying to entice passers by in ..

We couldn't get back to border quick enough only to be confronted by a line /queue which strutted for miles - I was planning a nervous breakdown when we were approached by a minibus diver offering seats on his bus `? did we go for it ? Hell yes .......OMG what had we done ....... squashed in at back with non english speaking traveling companions - 2 hours later and still at a stand still couple hundred yards from the border (midnight express flashing thru my mind ) I started to have a panic attack wondering if we would ever get back alive ?

but we did and lived to tell the tell 

Visit Tijuana ? my advise....DONT DO IT !

263155017.name: A mere shell of it\'s pre-9/11 state
263155017.author: a TripAdvisor user
263155017.reviewBody:
I am chagrined to report that downtown TJ is not at all like one would recall pre-9/11.  Businesses have been sustained for the most part on Avenida Revolucion, but the extensive malls that used to exist behind the storefronts are pretty much gone.  The wonderful Cafe La Especial is no longer in business.

Unfortunately, the viable businesses are dominated by cheesy pharmacies hawking things you probably shouldn't be taking back across the border.  Even with a passport card (which is supposed to expedite your return as opposed to a regular passport), the wait to get through customs is generally an hour or more.

On the bright side, I will still make the trip every few months so we can have a meal at the wonderful Caesar's restaurant on Revolucion - that makes it worth the painful return, plus one can pick up a few bottles of mezcal or Kahlúa to take home.  Despite the recent bad news in TJ, we generally feel safe while visiting and really wish it could return to some semblance of it's former self.

262918375.name: I\'d had good trips here in the past, but things have changed some
262918375.author: a TripAdvisor user
262918375.reviewBody: Don\'t take the pedestrian bridge!  Scary walk now.  Take a cab.  Most are $3 or $4.   Prepare to have many people trying to sell you things unsolicited.  Shop owners try to drag you in and kids and old women walk up to you with trinkets and just stare at you.  Not sure if they do it more now, or if I just have a lower threshold now.  Personally, I\'d just take a cab straight to the central area and hang out at the Mercado Hidalgo and cultural center area.  Not as much English spoken there, but it\'s actually not hard to get around.  And if you walked across the border, don\'t let anyone trick you into taking a express van back over.  Yes, the customs line looks long, but it only took us 20 min last time.

262839094.name: Let me tell you about our day!
262839094.author: a TripAdvisor user
262839094.reviewBody:
I'll let you know about the whole day right here.
We crossed the border and walked to the Avenida Revolution. It wasn't that far, and there were 3 of us-one is fluent in Spanish, which is very helpful. 
Had a fun day in this area. The local people shop there as well, which is what we liked. A street vendor chopped up a cup of fresh papaya, mango and coconut. Dulcerais Avala was an open market where we found some great treats made locally. Had an advocado salad at La Tradition. 
They vendors/restaurant servers have excellent customer service, and while in that area at no point did I feel unsafe. Plus, the prices were great. It got 5 stars. I'd go again.
Now I will take the time to offer a warning so it doesn't happen to you, though I should have listened to my instinct. The wait at the border was anywhere from 1 1/2 to 3 hours. It was suggested to us to take a bus through because it was faster. While we were trying to figure it out, Dorados Express talked us into using their services. It's a white passenger van. For $6 per person they would get us across in 30 min. There were 9 of us in the van. Once inside the van we were told we were going to another border because it was faster. 30 min later we are at another border and we were told to get out and walk across and he would pick us up on the other side. We got through customs quickly, but he never showed up (other companies similar to this one did the same thing and were there to pick up their customers) 5 of us shared a taxi for $30 to get back to the original border crossing. Don't do it. Unless you are on a tour bus, there is no easy way to get back across.

262791880.name: Bad experience !!!
262791880.author: a TripAdvisor user
262791880.reviewBody:
It's tours place and everyone know that. We came her just want to have some souvenir for the memory of Tijuana Mexico. 
But the people who working in the store was really RUDE ! 
The store is the first one on the right from the Tijuana Arch and they are selling the leather stuff. 
I will never every come back again !!!!

260401858.name: At least get the zonkey picture!
260401858.author: a TripAdvisor user
260401858.reviewBody:
At one time this must have been worth seeing, but now it is very sad.  As we walked across the border the line to leave Mexico looked three hours long.  We walked a deserted street (at noon on a holiday Monday, but maybe it is always that way). We made a pretty quick pace passing shops as we didn't feel safe to browse and wander.  We came across Ruben the Zonkey and his owner and had to take a picture.  For 5$ we took several and even asked the guys to get in it with us.  I felt sad for them as the town was so deserted  (so we gave them a little more to encourage them to keep the tradition)!
The other reviewer said this place needs vision and a plan is absolutely right!
And trying to leave was a nightmare.  With the long line we ended up getting in the van for $10 for the two of us and they crammed 13 people into a 12 passenger-no AC-van that we sat in for over 30 minutes.  Then they drove us to the front of the line and we waited another 30 minutes.  I really don't know if this was the smartest exit plan, but by then I just wanted out!  
Come on Baja and Tijuana -People would come if you would build it and make it desirable.  You are letting Ruben and his people down!

260046231.name: Interesting place - must go
260046231.author: a TripAdvisor user
260046231.reviewBody:
Tijuana Centro is pretty interesting. I went for the day with a friend. 

We parked in a lot on the USA side near jack in the box. We walked across the border, couldn't have been easier. They didn't even check our passports and no line. 

Once across, go to the path on the left that's lined with little vendors. Take a cab to "Centro" should cost you no more than $5. Make sure you negotiate with the driver first. He would probably take you for $3 if your Spanish is decent. 

Once downtown we just walked around. It's super interesting downtown. It didn't feel that touristy. Dont go alone, but also don't be afraid to walk around. The restaurants are awesome and beers are usually less than $2 each. 

If you walk a few blocks from the Main Street you'll find the club district. There's a lot of prostitutes in this area. Everyone is friendly though (it IS a service industry after all). 

Don't be afraid of Tijuana. Just be smart about what you're doing. If you're looking for trouble then you'll find it just like in ANY other North American city. 

We went back across the border at around 11pm and there was no line to walk back across. The U.S. Border guards were super friendly and they are told to treat our Canadian passports like American. 

Fun times!

259893294.name: Shopping
259893294.author: a TripAdvisor user
259893294.reviewBody: Fun to browse the shops. The shop owners are energetic in their encouragement of you visiting their shop but quite amusing with it. Didn\'t feel harassed which was good.

259033939.name: i wish for so much more for  this area of TJ  and the city in general :(
259033939.author: a TripAdvisor user
259033939.reviewBody: it  needs  somebody with vision and a plan to  recreate it into something people from san diego and the world would actually want to visit and spend money on.

258273620.name: Gotta experience it!
258273620.author: a TripAdvisor user
258273620.reviewBody: This street is full of shops targeting tourists.  It\'s a great place to go to find souvenirs to take home, but expect to be targeted and be prepared to haggle.  When you know what to expect, its fun to walk the gauntlet, and listen to the persuasive patter designed to entice you into their shops - "come in and buy something you don\'t need!",  While it can seem intimidating, everyone is really friendly, and if you just smile, say "no, thank you" and keep walking, they will leave you alone.  \n

257386641.name: Not a cultural attraction
257386641.author: a TripAdvisor user
257386641.reviewBody: If you decide to make the trip to Tijuana, it\'s advised that you pass through Avda Revolucion very quickly! The street is lined with overpriced tchotchke stores and restaurants, pharmacies and dentists. I went during Dia de los Muertos which was a little more cultural, but otherwise I would suggest finding something else to do while in Tijuana.

257178897.name: Window tint Police traps!!
257178897.author: a TripAdvisor user
257178897.reviewBody: I went to Tijuana, avenue Revolution! Be careful with the police. I was pull over due to Windows being tinted. The police told me to follow him to the station so that I could pay the find. Once there he keep trying to scare me telling me that, my car was gonna be towed for having the windows tinted. That they would keep my car until the next day and that I would have to pay the tow fee plus the fine, that would have been $260 dollars. He kept taking me inside the station and then outside. Once outside he asked me to give him $100 and that he would let me go. I felt he was just trying to scare me but I felt I had to choice but to give him the money to let me go. Be very careful with the police there that are only looking to still your money. If you have tinted windows, just put them all down while in the city.

255702907.name: Not attractive at all
255702907.author: a TripAdvisor user
255702907.reviewBody: Mexico should sell Mexico (Folklore, arts, foods, etc.) not chip beers and second rate medicines.\nAvenida Revoluci\u00f3n may be a great attraction for tourist of all the world if it becomes the real sample of Mexico and its culture.

254761417.name: very Disappointed
254761417.author: a TripAdvisor user
254761417.reviewBody: Went there with friends for the day , our guide from the US was fantastic and gave us lots of tips on where was safe and where was not . I fell sorry for the shop owners there , they are pushing you all to come into their shop and then get quite angry when you don\'t go into everyone . I found all the shops had the same things and not really aimed at the tourist . The street was dirty and quite smelly and we wanted to leave earlier than planed but not able to , had to wait for our guide to come and meet us . Enjoyed lunch at Hotel Caesars , home of the Caesars salad . I am still glade we went as it was part of our holiday that we had planned to do .

254689836.name: Economically depressed.
254689836.author: a TripAdvisor user
254689836.reviewBody: Most of the stores are shuttered, the street went into a depression after 911 when it became difficult to cross the border back into the US.  It was a prosperous and rambunctious street in the \'90\'s as I remember but no more.  Can be dangerous after dark.

252105525.name: Not want it used to be.
252105525.author: a TripAdvisor user
252105525.reviewBody: Went to TJ for the day with friends.  Always felt safe.  Having not been here for over 20 years, I was saddened to see that it isn\'t what it used to be.  Stories of drug cartel violence and shootings have kept Americans away.  Too bad.  This used to be fun place to shop!

251264352.name: tacky
251264352.author: a TripAdvisor user
251264352.reviewBody: dirty, sleazy, the souvenir shops are full of overpriced rubbish and are all exactly the same, the market area looked much nicer but our guide didn\'t let us shop there. The little cantina where we had lunch was amazing, family run  the food was fresh the marguerites awesome and the prices very reasonable. I have no idea why they dye their donkeys to look like zebras but it seems cruel. watch out for the cranky show shiner who wants to charge you $5.00 to take his photo.\nThe walk across the border was an experience in it\'s self but next time I go to Mexico it won\'t be Tijuana

249361167.name: Gringos descend on Tijuana
249361167.author: a TripAdvisor user
249361167.reviewBody: This strip is where most Americans wind up after crossing the border.  It\'s a short walk, not well marked from the border, no visitor info welcome, and a few standing maps that don\'t tell you where you are.   But you can generally follow the Americans and find it.  \nThere\'s not much here but tacky souvenir shops with hawkers, sketchy snack places and lots of pharmacies touting cheap Viagra.    We came for lunch as a side trip from San Diego but I would not recommend it nor come again.\nWe did, though, feel very safe, never a thought of being in a dangerous foreign country.

248974836.name: Tijuana for the Day
248974836.author: a TripAdvisor user
248974836.reviewBody: We left early in the morning for a side trip to Tijuana with no misgivings what so ever. Sure I had heard and read about all the trouble that is going on down there but that didn\u2019t deter us. We hoped on the trolley which a few minutes before the border we had to get off and get on buses because there was an accident on the track. No problem. We boarder and a few minutes later we were walking up a little path to the Entrance\u201d of Mexico. There was no problem going over into Mexico. They didn\u2019t even look at our passport. I noticed the long line of people standing in line to get over into the US. After changing US dollars into Pesos, ($10.00 for  140 Pesos at the time we visited) we caught a taxi,( $6.00) to take us into town a few blocks away that we could have walked. We were let off in front of La Pasitos Mexican Restaurant and givien a phone number to call when we were ready to go back to the border. We began walking down Avenue Revolucion stopping in stores that caught our eye. Tried to take a picture of the \u201cFamous\u201d donkey, which is painted like a Zebra,  but was told not to unless we paid $2.00 for the privilege. No thank you and we walked away. As we moved along the sidewalk, I notice that the store owners invited us in but was not pushy which I liked right off. We then enter into this one shop that had all kinds of leather goods, \u201cGloris Curios and Boots\u201d,  out on the sidewalk. My traveling companion was looking for something to buy to take home to her father. The owner/ manager, Sergio,  came to greet us.  A very pleasant man. He actually spent some time with my friend explaining to her the difference between \u201cfake\u201d leather and \u201creal\u201d leather which I believe she appreciated. The item that she wanted was priced at US $35.00 and I was able to get it down to $25. She still had her doubts. He saw her hesitation and then lowered it to $15.00 and I told her to take it. She still hesitated and I then thanked him and left the store. Needless to say I was upset because I would have taken it even at $35.)) but she was new to traveling and on her own and did not know the ways of traveling or bargaining. She left Tijuana without the bag saying that her father would think that it was too expensive a gift. Both  Sergio and I said that he didn\u2019t need to know the price, it was a gift. Oh well, what can I say. We walked up one side of the street and down the other, looking into other stores. Outside the La Pasitos restaurant there was a street vendor who had a nice display of Jewelry. Some real sterling, some not. She was now looking for a little ring to buy for herself. He introduced himself as Raymond . He smiled and talked at length about his little table display of items. He also warned us about not going past 1st street and I asked why not and he said that it was the red light district and they don\u2019t even go there. Enough said. Shortly thereafter my friend walked away and into another shop called the Emporium and I am so glad she did because soon after, I followed her in. I stopped at a case that had jewelry in it and I noticed that there were tags on different items stating what they were.  He had identified items that were \u201creal\u201d Sterling Silver, and the fakes. He even shared with me that fact that some shop owner will even go so far as to STAMP the items with the 925 stamp causing unsuspecting people to think that they are getting the real thing until they happen to come in to the Emporium and find out the error and march right back to the store and get their money back. We stood and talked for a long time while my traveling buddy was busy with the other attendant trying to decide on a \u201cTurquoise/ Sterling ring. I have always been fascinated by the colorful pottery and ceramics and this store had shelves and shelves of it. I just stood there with mouth open and marveled at all the many pieces. I saw a little plate/saucer that I like and Jesus went into the history of the ceramic piece and I am so grateful that he did. My first concern was whether it had lead in it and it did not. It was a piece of Talvera ceramic that is handmade and signed by the artist. The clay that they use is found in select areas and one of them is Puebla, Mexico. My piece was packed as if it were going on a journey of a thousand miles (which it was). I noticed when back out on the streets that there were not many \u201ctourist-Looking\u201d people out and about that I could tell. I remember Jesus telling me that it is  really depressed because people are afraid to come anymore because of all the news headlines, which if one travels as I do, that could be just about anywhere and I don\u2019t go to those places anyway. I keep to the well-traveled path of the tourist, but then again anything can happen anywhere at any time. I will tell you that I felt safe, unhurried and the people were very friendly. I can say that I would not hesitate about going back.

248535023.name: Its old Tijuana
248535023.author: a TripAdvisor user
248535023.reviewBody: Revolution is and old area of the city. lots of bars and table dance spots. The area has gone and remade itself, nicer restaurants and trendier bars.Lots of youth hangs out in this area at night. Street at not that well lite, but if you are young and want to party its good for you. If you are a mature adult there is only one place worth visiting here: Ceasars restaurant Home to the first ceasar salad ever! (look it up its true).\nOther than that, there is much nices parts of the city to be a tourist in This place is designed for trourists that want to get drunk and go to a table dance.

246080862.name: Avenida Rev is but a Slice of Tijuana
246080862.author: a TripAdvisor user
246080862.reviewBody:
For tourists accustomed to the old Tijuana (pre-2006), expecting the best of a city to be confined to one street, you will be disappointed. While Revolucion is in the process of restoration and modernization, Tijuana's economy no longer focuses primarily on tourists to sustain itself. Due to the collapse of its tourism sector from 2006-2012, the city has invested in its own people and diversified its entertainment and attractions over more of the city's geography. Therefore, don't expect to find all that is great about Tijuana all on Av Revolucion.

Revolucion is now but a fraction of Tijuana's offering to tourists with an adventurous spirit. To find the best of the city, you will have to dig a bit.

As for Revolucion itself, it is repopulating with newer establishments every month. In addition to bars & restaurants, cliche tourist trinkets, and more street vendors selling bacon-wrapped hot dogs than street tacos, there are newer tourist treasures.

The issue is - they are not pushed on tourists because they are not aimed at tourists. They are part of Tijuana's home-grown culture, seen only by thosr who look for them. For that reason, only tourists who truly enjoy a bit of exploration will find them - things like a growing hipster population and bohemian sector tucked in secret alleyways, a busy nightlife scene with popular dance clubs that only come to Life at Night, and even a growing technology space.

The bottom line is not that Avenida Revolucion is not what it used to be, it's that Tijuana is so much more now and it's spread out over greater area. Places like Zona Rio for restaurants, shopping, and business districts with modern architecture; Gallerias Hipodromo for shopping and a remarkable view of Tijuana at night; and roundabouts featuring large city monuments, including one of US President Abraham Lincoln, which looks a bit surreal illuminated with neonish blue ground lighting.

There isn't any easy way to discover these fascinating things... and some really are fascinating. You won't find them by googling Tijuana, which often yields years-old search results which innacurately describe Tijuana. Tijuana is a place of rapid change, where the influences of its US neighbor collide with the city and influence progress at a remarkable pace.

On a final note, you can easily still find delicious street tacos within walking distance of the border, including some pretty good (although not #1) 24 hour street tacos. The difference is, in 2015, you'll want to order an Uber ride to arrive at one of the best street-style tacos in Tijuana, Tacos el Franc.

An exciting world awaits you in Tijuana. Don't be afraid, it's relatively safe now. Just exercise caution and respect your surroundings. Do some research first and  look at current articles to find the best of what Tijuana has to offer.

242458637.name: Revolution street
242458637.author: a TripAdvisor user
242458637.reviewBody: Classic tourism street. Back in the day this 10 block avenue use to be packed with people from all over, buying everything under the sun. Crowds are gone now and place has a new feel to it. Now full ob pharmacies, galleries and delicious restaurants like CEASERS.  A visit to TJ is not complete without a walk through here. A must do if you cross the border.

240491618.name: It was unpleasant....
240491618.author: a TripAdvisor user
240491618.reviewBody: Sorry for the hard working people of Tijuana but it\'s really difficult to say something pleasant about that place.  If you are of European descent stay away from Tijuana.  What am I saying?  It doesn\'t matter what skin color you have, if you made it back, you are lucky.  Fifteen years ago there was some life in Tijuana, now, it\'s a war zone.

239111573.name: Didnt feel safe
239111573.author: a TripAdvisor user
239111573.reviewBody: Being 6ft+ and blonde, I stuck out like a sore thumb in this place. All the locals were staring and I thought I was going to get robbed at any time.\n\nBorder crossing takes ages, almost not worth crossing over to this place anymore.

238505219.name: Great..! not anymore
238505219.author: a TripAdvisor user
238505219.reviewBody: It is almost empty place, no tourist attraction anymore, few open stores, more pharmacies, liquor stores, few restaurants...  old taco places are gone.. noisy by night but have to be careful to stay close to main streets.. avoid low class bars and cantiinas

237670036.name: Tijuana was fun 20+ years ago it\'s awful now plus tips if you go
237670036.author: a TripAdvisor user
237670036.reviewBody:
forget the fact that the border crossing from Tijuana back to the U.S.A. takes hours and hours whether by foot or by car.
there is nothing exciting or fun about going to Tijuana any more. there are 3 types of business in Tijuana and all are legitimate but there are dozens and dozens of pharmacies and dozens and dozens of tourist shops selling poncho's and every other knick-knack known to mankind and dozens and dozens of sub-par and not very clean food stands and restaurants.
tourism is so bad in Tijuana that every shop and every restaurant  and every pharmacy has people/employees standing out in the front of the shops/stores trying/begging walkers-by to "come on in - I have what you want".
Tijuan is filthy and the whole city emits an awful stench that sticks to your clothes until you wash them.
the only thing I learned is that I will never , ever go back but for others that go by foot (while parking in San Ysidro, Ca.) I suggest taking a taxi ($5 American) from downtown to the border crossing and from there look for the shuttles ($6 American) that will take you to the border crossing in Otay which is past the Tijuana airport. the border crossing at Otay cuts the wait time by hours - literally hours on busy days (weekend days) and after you go thru customs at Otay the shuttle meets you on the U.S.A. side and drives you to San Ysidro.
all in all there is no redeeming value of visiting Tijuana - not any more.

237634021.name: Bargains to be found
237634021.author: a TripAdvisor user
237634021.reviewBody: Avenida Revolucion is the main tourist shopping street of Tijuana.  It is recommended you stay  in blocks 1 through 10 for safety.  It is great for a couple of hours shopping but many shops stock the same or similar items therefore shopping becomes a little boring after a short period.  The people are obviously quite poor and will harass you consistently for a sale, They will haggle with you for a price so don\'t accept the first price you are given.   The quality can vary greatly from shop to shop so the buyer must be aware of this.  Lots of shops selling fake/inferior silver so you will need to shop around to assure quality, Lots of T shirts, Day of the Dead ornaments, leather goods  and cheap alcohol.   There are many bars/restaurants all offering great value for money.  We shopped with USD and had no issues doing this.   You can have your photo taken for  $5-10 with a Zonkey which makes for a novel holiday snap.   We enjoyed our quick trip to Tijuana the people were very friendly and eager to help.

235789722.name: Its like you have gone to the circus
235789722.author: a TripAdvisor user
235789722.reviewBody: Dont take TJ as real Mexico.I mean yes you are in Mexico but it is a border town that is not to be mistaken with the more non tourist aeras of Mexico.TJ is crazy with action everywhere you look.I suggest take as many small bills as you can and barter.Keep a few in one pocket so you can pull it out and say thats all I got,take it or leave it.If you are not into shopping you can get an eyefull justwandering the streets and alleys browsing.But be prepared ,they will try to get you into their store or booth to buy.Its 3pm and you will be told you are my first sale of the day ,others say just come in for the hell of it.Latley I have been going to the out of the way places and living by the locals who are some of the nicest people I have ever met.But if you want an edgey Mexico that can be a lil crazy TJ is a must

235041153.name: Fun shopping!
235041153.author: a TripAdvisor user
235041153.reviewBody: Lots of fun things to look at. We picked up some great souvenirs and had fun talking to the locals. Some can be a bit pushy but it\'s all part of it. Make sure you take the time to go shopping!

234569710.name: Beer and FUN
234569710.author: a TripAdvisor user
