234569710.reviewBody: lots to see and do! Inexpensive food and beer :) a MUST for Canadians. Expensive for pottery and silver. I attended The Tequila Expo ( Oct 8-12) then went to party in the local nightclubs.....LOVED IT

234422060.name: Not as bad as you might think
234422060.author: a TripAdvisor user
234422060.reviewBody: After reading a lot of the reviews I was truly expecting worst of the worst when I visited Avenida Revolucion. I thought it was going to be very dirty, smelly, and extremely noisy. If you are from a quiet suburban town in good ole USA then yeah it might feel like a very daunting place. But if you are a urban dweller or travel the world Avenida Revolucion is actually not bad and you have a lot of of food and shopping options. It is a tourisy place and people do pressure you into being their junk but if you are not a gullible traveler you should be fine. I actually had a lot of fun. It is very LGBT/GAY friendly there are many great bars to go. On the weekends they sometimes have different festivals. We were lucky enough to be there during a tequila tasting expo, for 6 bucks we went in and tasted all kinds of delicious and quality tequilas. The expo also had food and entertainment. I never felt threatened or that my safety was in jeopardy in any way. If you come to Tijuana, this place is a must. My only complaint is that Tijuana in general is not as cheap as I thought it would be and if taxi drivers or shopkeepers could smell the tourist in you then they will try to charge you more because you have dollars! So be low key and before you get into a taxi ask for the price before you get in.

234163088.name: Not really worth
234163088.author: a TripAdvisor user
234163088.reviewBody: During our stay in San Diego we took the chance and went to Tijuana by train (by car is not that easy and your rental company may not allow it). In the tourist office they told us that the Avenida Revolucion is the only place to go. It was rather dodgy and lacked charme. Had some food and a few beers in a bar, went home when it got dark. No partycrowd around, a lot of people in SD said it\'s not safe, we felt a bit unwell because they street wasn\'t busy at all. At least the take aways near the border were nice. To get back to the US we had to stand in the row for about an hour. Don\'t forget your passport!

232135598.name: Where are the tourists?
232135598.author: a TripAdvisor user
232135598.reviewBody: Avenida Revolucion, or La Revu, is the most noticeable casualty of the decline in tourism. So many arcades and stores are empty, shuttered, or for rent. What was once a lively walking street is no longer. We visited on a weekday and perhaps the weekends still bring in large groups, but our heart aches for the vendors trying to make a living with so few customers and plenty of competition. We were also sad that so many wonderful charming stores selling the best of Mexico\'s artisans are gone, many replaced by large modern buildings. The Mercado Artesanias is a wonderful addition to the city, but cannot replace the stores that used to line La Revu.

229202299.name: Party for everyone !
229202299.author: a TripAdvisor user
229202299.reviewBody: you will find any kind of club, bar or pub, plus tons of stuff to buy, even "zebras", Police everywhere taking care of tourist. Last street is the "Red area".

228116296.name: Just a typical tourist trap type place
228116296.author: a TripAdvisor user
228116296.reviewBody: If you have never been to Avenida Revolucion, you probably need to see it once, just to say you\'ve been there.  All of the vendors have the same stuff at nearly the same price but if you have some time to kill, it can be an interesting hour or so.

227403783.name: PHARMACY ON REVOLUTION, BEWARE WARNING!
227403783.author: a TripAdvisor user
227403783.reviewBody: Beware of pharmacy tactics. I was on Revolution Street in Tijuana where there are dozens of pharmacies. To shop for my prescribed medication for antibiotics and pain medication for dental work I had that day. At one pharmacy I handed my prescription and they quoted me a certain price. After I agreed to purchase, after they related they made an error and I had to pay an extra five dollars. At this point, I noticed they had stamped the back of my prescription \u201cmedication dispensed\u201d in Spanish. When I decided I would not buy medication at that particular pharmacy, I took it to another pharmacy and they related I could not buy medication, in particular (antibiotics) because it was stamped \u201cmedication dispensed\u201d. I was stuck with either going back to the pharmacy who stamped my prescription or go back to the dental office and get another prescription. What a horrible experience! Buyers beware!

226727968.name: Same streets as before
226727968.author: a TripAdvisor user
226727968.reviewBody: Pemex cheaper than US gasoline.\nThe street is passable and paved. Needs more clear signs. It\'s safe here once you get around the macho man egos of the male residents

226382100.name: weekend vacation
226382100.author: a TripAdvisor user
226382100.reviewBody: this place has so many shops that you can squeeze it all in one weekend but will be back saw a beautiful purse that i wanted but didn\'t get a chance to go back.

223531483.name: the commercial drag of TJ
223531483.author: a TripAdvisor user
223531483.reviewBody: The street is full of stores selling various tourist times, coffee shops, restaurants nite clubs bars, etc.  Yes the locals will solicit you to come into their business. they depend on tourist and need business.  I guess some might be offended to ask to try this or check out that, they mean no harm and if they don\'t pitch the till might be empty some days.  At least that is my take.  I found the local and business owners very freindly and helpful.

220638938.name: Down town
220638938.author: a TripAdvisor user
220638938.reviewBody: Was on business and got a tour from one of locals.  Use caution in this area, some locals will not visit this area at night due to the presents of local drug cartels so if your an out of towner be careful.  During the day it\'s full of colorful people and very tourist freindly. Lots of police present. Look for the zebra donkey!

219516996.name: Lot\'s of variety
219516996.author: a TripAdvisor user
219516996.reviewBody: The best part of strolling down Avenida Revolucion is that you never know what\'s going to happen.  Like on all of my trips to Tijuana, I make it a priority to spend some time walking up an down the stret here.  Even if I have no intentions on buying souvenirs or anything, I just really like strolling and the people walking.  Sure, there are plenty of people that will ask you for money, but do what you are comfortable with.  If you want to give, then give freely, if not, just smile at them and keep walking.  My favorite part is travelling down here earlier in the day, and the peeps in the restaurants try and get you into their establishments.  I get it, some are annoyed by that, but for me, it\'s just part of the experience.  While I don\'t think that the prices are all that much of a deal, it still provides some fun banter while you are out and about.  Overall, nothing really major to point out here - just understand that you will be approached by a ton of people.  If that doesn\'t bother you, prepare to enjoy people watching, and hopefully a good drink special.

216682934.name: Exactly what I had envisioned
216682934.author: a TripAdvisor user
216682934.reviewBody: My friends really wanted to take a trip south of the border while we were in San Diego. This place is a dump. There\'s no other way to put it. Avenida Revolucion is probably the safest place I was in the city, outside of the gate that brings you back to America, but I still felt unsafe. Some of the shops were nice and we were able to find cool souvenirs to take back home, but I probably won\'t ever be back.

215991319.name: I like it
215991319.author: a TripAdvisor user
215991319.reviewBody:
I went to Tijuana for the first time two days ago and loved the place. Pretty much everyone I know told me I was crazy for wanting to go there but I heard all the same misinformed garbage about Phnom Penh, Cambodia before I went there back in 2000 and found it to be great as well.
The people of Tijuana are very friendly and are just trying to make a living like everyone else on the planet.
Sure there are bad parts of the city but the same can be said about every other large city in the world as well.
Just be smart about where you go and what you do and you'll be fine.
The wife and I even went there this morning again via the San Diego trolley just to have breakfast before going to Anaheim!

214326485.name: Welcome to Mexico!
214326485.author: a TripAdvisor user
214326485.reviewBody: Tijuana - just 30 mins from Downtown San Diego is an interesting place to visit if you have valid visa/ passport requirements.  We booked a tour via Viator since it was our first time and its a different country, different language. The tour was good takes about 6-7 hours round trip from SD downtown. \n\nThe streets are fun, happening with curiosity filled tourists and locals. First things TJ is safe and just another tourist spot. The locals are very friendly and helpful. Most of them speak English! When shopping "Bargain" a lot. If the shopkeeper quotes $20, start bargaining from $5 and you\'ll end up close to $9 or $10. Margaritas and Tacos are cheap and too good. I have no idea how much we ate, so delicious.

213456377.name: Tijuana was better in the 90s
213456377.author: a TripAdvisor user
213456377.reviewBody:
Had previously been to Tijuana in 91 & 96 when it was great and spoke to the US Customs Guys about a school hours visit during daytime hours in Sep 2013 despite the travel advisories.

Tijuana is a shell of it's former self. Yes, it was a bit scary in parts, but VERY glad we went. In years gone by, loved the leather goods which were sadly missing. Got taken for a ride at a Cafe near the border for a light lunch but talking a few bucks.

The big problem, was getting back over the border, the queue was MASSIVE (up to 4 hours).

In short, recommend the trip but lose 2 stars for the lack of leather products and the long wait to cross the border

213334874.name: Interesting trip for sure, beware of the hustles however.
213334874.author: a TripAdvisor user
213334874.reviewBody: I have been here a few times over the years, and decided to bring my 16 year old son.  He has never been out of the US and I wanted him to see it.  It still is a very interesting place to co, but it is dirty and a little dangerous. The cab drivers and people on the streets are constantly trying to get over on you, so do your research and be careful not to be a victim.  If you buy from the pharmacies, be sure to check around because the prices can vary greatly for the same medicine... just be educated and you should have a good visit.  I plan to go again someday.

212551944.name: Interesting!
212551944.author: a TripAdvisor user
212551944.reviewBody: Fun street to wander. Loud, colorful and interesting. Zebra donkeys on every corner. Curious shops with cheap tourist trinkets. Local liquor stores that stock twisted bottles. My only suggestion (and this goes for all of TJ) is bring your own toilet paper,  soap and hand sanitizer. Sure for a few pesos you can purchase questionable TP but your own will keep from wanting to take multiple scolding hot showers with buckets of soap when you get home!

211253346.name: Pretty Smooth Transition by Foot
211253346.author: a TripAdvisor user
211253346.reviewBody:
The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars is because you are crossing the Mexican border, which is one of the most busiest and considered the most dangerous border crossings in the world.  But, in my opinion, its just as safe as anywhere else in the world.  Everywhere is always some kind of risk.  We took a day trip to Tijuana this past weaken, and walked it across the border with ease, and we made it back to San Diego in one hour.  

A Few Tips:

Park your car at the trolly station in San Diego and walk.  You will be glad you did when you see the traffic crossing, and more glad when you see the traffic crossing back.

Get a Sentri card before crossing, and you can cross back through the Sentri line, which is way shorter than the general public and fast lane.

Bring your passport.  You can get back it without it, but there is paper work and several other document required.  And, I don't know how they know you were only in Tijuana less than 72 hours.

Try not to look like a tourist, although it's not so easy.  They pinned us immediately, and my boyfriend is Spanish.

Be aware of the conversion so you don't get had.  

There are plenty of taxis, but you don't need one if your just going downtown.  You still have to wait to in line to get back in, so don't get tricked into a taxi going back either.

Stay Safe and Have Fun!!

210827465.name: touristic route
210827465.author: a TripAdvisor user
210827465.reviewBody: I like the restaurants and the massage parlors as well as the cheap souvenirs, I also liked the donkeys pretending to be zebras, only a donkey would try to do something like that. I dislike the long walk and the heat.

210588540.name: Junk for Sale!
210588540.author: a TripAdvisor user
210588540.reviewBody: I think this is the only city in Mexico where junk art is rampant. However for cheap souvenirs it\'s a must. The Cultural Center had some nice things well made but very pricey. Taxis are hilarious. Wherever you want to go they say they can get you there but they don\'t use gps or know where it is and often take you to wrong places. I wanted to go to a restaurant close to Revolution Zona and was dropped off about 5 miles away! The natives are friendly but if you like to carry a purse that\'s a bad idea. Best to hide your money on your body. It\'s safe enough if you keep to main streets and avoid conversations with people who approach you in the street.\nTip...crossing the border as a pedestrian..if you are in any way disabled, there is a Handicap/Accessible line which enabled us to cross over in 20 minutes!

207872064.name: Fun and Safe
207872064.author: a TripAdvisor user
207872064.reviewBody: We spent one day in Tijuana, Baja California Mexico. We thought it was fun. We thought it was safe. We rode the trolley to the border, and walked across. We took a taxi to the center of the city. It took one hour to cross the US Border.

201672601.name: Greatly Improved
201672601.author: a TripAdvisor user
201672601.reviewBody: I walked up and down Avenida Revolucion recently for the first time in years while waiting for some body work to be done nearby on my car.  I was quite surprised to see many of the junky old souvenir shops and tourist traps had been replaced by stores with attractive displays of art and other merchandise mostly from Mexico.  The store employees or owners were happy to give me information about individual artists and where in Mexico the items were made.  There was one store were you can watch them roll Cuban style cigars.  Although I no longer smoke, the place sure smelled great.  They are also refurbishing one of those old Mexican malls where you enter off the Avenida and have a number of small shops on each side going back about a block.  It is like what they had  a long time ago only nicer and cleaner.  You can still do some haggling on prices, not so much in the nicer shops more so in the small mall shops.  The whole Avenida seems wider and is cleaner than the old days.  There are a lot of pedestrians downtown like any busy urban area.  There are a lot of clean looking caf\u00e9s with sidewalk seating--great for people watching and taking a break.  I plan on going back soon to do some more serious shopping.  Incidentally, the dent in my fender was fixed and painted in about four or five hours and looks great.  I paid about $70 for the repair compared to my estimate of almost $900 in San Diego.

201317616.name: Tijuana streets
201317616.author: a TripAdvisor user
201317616.reviewBody: Is ok, there\'s some club\'s and restaurant you can take a picture with a donkey paint as a zebra.  Just to  walk around and buy. A few souvenir.

201262856.name: Stay away
201262856.author: a TripAdvisor user
201262856.reviewBody: Up to the 80\'s it was one of the few attractions in Tijuana. The city grew and now has way too many options. "La Revu" is still favored by some, but you need to be willing to get drunk and able to tolerate a lot of noise.

201203656.name: Saddly
201203656.author: a TripAdvisor user
201203656.reviewBody: I live in Tijuana and Revolution ave. is not what use to be before not to many attractions just the sixt avenue with bars for young people but nothing else .

193821823.name: Fun and Adventurous
193821823.author: a TripAdvisor user
193821823.reviewBody: When you are looking for the perfect souvenir to bring back to friends and family, then Avenida Revolucion is the place to go. You will also find great restaurants and night clubs if you are there for the night, some clubs are 24 hours. Take a picture with a donkey with zebra stripes just to prove to your friends that you actually crossed the border into Mexico.

193662092.name: Very exciting attraction
193662092.author: a TripAdvisor user
193662092.reviewBody: I am a world traveler and have been too many places. There are no sidewalks in this area and I would recommend you to know few basics of Spanish. Else, it would be difficult to enjoy this place. The local shopkeepers were very assertive to visit their store and I did get some fabulous collection from there. I am quite happy about my visit and if I get a chance to go there, I shall think about it. For eating, shopping and drinking this is the best place I guess. The attraction offered many shows, shopping festivals and much more to travelers. Good place to visit once.

193434152.name: The Mexican hart
193434152.author: a TripAdvisor user
193434152.reviewBody:
I went to Tijuana just for a quick tourist trip to get to know the reality of the other side of the border. It was a quite impact... I became aware of how most of the people live in the world! this is the real life of the other side!

For me, it was rewarding to see that avenue, despite the two hours I had to wait to return to the United States!!! It´s the history there... And most interesting, you can appreciate some influence of the mexican style when you get back to United states, the colours of the roads, the lines in streets...
Worth it!

190652560.name: Not worth the trip
190652560.author: a TripAdvisor user
190652560.reviewBody: This seems to be the place to write about Tijuana in general, so here goes.  It is not the poverty or the dirt that turned me off to this place.  I\'ve been to Haiti and Tangiers (and parts of Newark, NJ, for that matter). It was the 3 hour line to get back into the United States!  Having a US passport means nothing.  You have to wait with no access to bathrooms or protection from the cold or rain or wind. No wonder we were the ONLY Americans walking along Avenida Revolucion that day.  Visitors to San Diego...don\'t bother.  I feel sorry for the local restaurant and store owners.  If you walk across, you can\'t really get to this area without hiring a taxi or walking WAY out of your way.  There are NO sidewalks, just highways, between the border and the Avenue.  No signs telling you where anything is located. (I can read Spanish.  There was nothing to direct you in ANY language.)  And the stop signs are COMPLETELY ignored by the locals.  You take your life in your hands crossing the street.  I never felt in danger from the people.  Everyone was friendly.  They try to draw you into their shops and restaurants, but were never pushy. I guess I\'m glad I saw the place, but never, never again.

190046995.name: Very interesting
190046995.author: a TripAdvisor user
190046995.reviewBody: Ok I put my last review in the wrong place. We are world travelers and believe everything is worth seeing once. To avoid all the long lines we went with a tour that dropped us off here for a few hours. Pushing selling is not unusual to us, try Turkey! We were really on the look out for little pieces of hand made stuff that would sell for much more in the U.S. and we found some cute things that were obviously hand made (not made in china that we saw). The sad part was being ripped off at the very good lunch we had. They charged us as much for the two CANS of diet coke as they did for our whole meal (we didnt think to ask the price of them) plus a 15% tax. We simply took out a bill and told them it was all we had and they took it. That doesnt help turism, we were glad we went but would never go back, there are too many other things to see in the world, but it was definatly worth a visit. We waited about 5 minutes at the boarding crossing with the tour. When my husband lingered in a store i did notice people getting a lot more assertive with me to visit the store, but over all it was not bad.

188734739.name: Do Not Go!!!!
188734739.author: a TripAdvisor user
188734739.reviewBody: This was a crazy idea to go over to Tijuana for a short time.  It is dirty and poor and not fun to see,  but the worst part is the multi-hour wait to get back across the border.  Do you want to spend a whole day in line?  Don\'t go!  Not worth it!

188456729.name: Always something to do
188456729.author: a TripAdvisor user
188456729.reviewBody: If you are looking for eats, drinks, shopping, or just strolling all is available here any time of day or night

188373425.name: Bad Memories
188373425.author: a TripAdvisor user
188373425.reviewBody: I can remember when going here on a weekend what the thing to do, not anymore. With the amount of "Hustlers" on every corner and drunken disorderly fights that seem to happen every 5 mins I now avoid this area. I would recommend doing as some of the others have suggested and hiring a guide to show you the areas that are good and safe and the areas to stay away from.

186256691.name: Poor Tijuana
186256691.author: a TripAdvisor user
186256691.reviewBody: I\'ve lived in Tijuana, working with children in Zona Norte, quite close to Avenida Revolucion, for many years.  Revolucion is about the best tourist thing left in Tijuana, but I don\'t think it would be worth a trip for most people.  Back in the 1970s and before, it was quite lively with tourist shops and restaurants and bars.  That was in the days when an easy trip into Mexico was exciting, exotic travel and people\'s standards for travel destinations was much less selective.  There\'s been an effort to liven the street up in the last few years to bring it into the 21st century as a destination, but sadly that\'s not been successful in my opinion.  Tourist shops all sell the same  predictable things--T-shirts, silver jewelry, knick-knacks, post cards, stuffed animals, some Mexican-style clothes for children. There are still restaurants and bars that are probably ok, but they aren\'t well respected by the Tijuanans I know.  Mostly the scene on Revolucion is small groups of visitors rather haplessly wandering around as though they really hope the next block will bring something worth the trip.   The bars that other reviewers have mentioned as edgy and hip aren\'t on Revolucion but on the side streets, and it should be noted that these are definitely not for families.

185780293.name: A Renaissance in Progress
185780293.author: a TripAdvisor user
185780293.reviewBody: In around 2006, when American tourists stopped coming in droves to Tijuana, Avenida Revolucion [known as "Revo"]  languished in despair, with sad, boarded-up storefronts and desolate sidewalks. But then the locals returned, attracted by the available space and low rents, and suddenly hipster bars appeared up and down Sixth Street [Calle Sexta]. There was Caesar\'s Restaurant on Revo and 4th, then El Collegio at Revo and 5th. And soon celbtrity San Diego chef, Chad White, will open Justina\'s on Revo and 3rd!  The renaissance is continuing and the locals have returned. Now if only they would get rid of those poor suffering donkeys painted as zebras on the corners for photo ops. It pains me just to see these chained animals!

185778896.name: I think is the most typical place to see in Tijuana
185778896.author: a TripAdvisor user
185778896.reviewBody: Avenida Revolucion a traditional tourist spot in Tijuana where you\u00b4ll have a glance of Mexico, nice curious shopping, great food, great environment and great prices, don\u00b4t forget you picture on the zebra Donkey.

182927958.name: Interesting, exciting...worth a visit
182927958.author: a TripAdvisor user
182927958.reviewBody: Edgy, exciting, interesting...definitely worth a visit. Consider hiring one of the "guides" who hang around if you want to see the more adventurous side of the city without standing out as a toursit/victim!

177794510.name: Lovely shopping area
177794510.author: a TripAdvisor user
177794510.reviewBody: I loved the stores at Avenida Revolucion.  Also great inexpensive places to eat.  Night time had live music which was great when having a romantic dinner.

177039227.name: See it once then you can always avoid it
177039227.author: a TripAdvisor user
177039227.reviewBody:
Before  I start:  the ONLY things on Revolucion that I think are worthwhile are the jai-alai fronton, Washington Dental Clinic across the street, and the Tijuana Historical Museum several doors north of Washington Dental. 

I've been in and out of Baja & Tijuana for decades, and I remember what were probably the last of the glory days of Revolucion - back when there were real supperclubs with diners in evening dress and cigaret girls and ladies who took your picture with big boxy camera sporting cupped flashbulbs.

And those days are long gone.  Now a magnet for every kind of touristy tourist, Revolucion is a pit of commerce, a place where every seven feet some huckster is hyping some junk to people too numb to object.

Want a tawdry or insulting tp-shirt or knick-knack?  Go to Avenida Revolucion.  

Want to be assaulted by music so loud emanating from nightclubs that your ears will hurt 25 feet away?  Go to Avenida Revolucion.  

Want to develop the lowest possible opinion of Mexico and Tijuana?  Go to Avenida Revolucion.  

There is much to love about Mexico.  And much to love about Tijuana, but none of it is to be found on Revolucion.

176104995.name: Day trip from San Diego
176104995.author: a TripAdvisor user
176104995.reviewBody: Usual tourist strip street, with people calling you into their stores with every step you take. avoid the street sellers, some of the stores have nice stuff but chose carefully and bargain big.  we were advised it was not safe to stray from the main street or to go beyond the big arc. was fun to go to experience the border crossing and see a bit of Tijuana. glad i was with a minibus tour and a street wise driver who told us where to go and where not to go.

172854327.name: not going to return
172854327.author: a TripAdvisor user
172854327.reviewBody: we drove by and saw lots of people, its dirty, people selling things everywhere. when we were there people beg you to buy their stuff. i didnt like vibe

172713196.name: Nice to walk around
172713196.author: a TripAdvisor user
172713196.reviewBody:
A nice area to walk around
Not too much hustlers
The arch looks well
Tijuana has a nice edgy feel to it and is certainly a party town 
Remember to stamp your passport on way from USA as the office is hard to see
If not you will have issues leaving

172584648.name: I avoid most of it.
172584648.author: a TripAdvisor user
172584648.reviewBody: The amount of barkers is frustrating. Not a whole lot of interest to me, and I prefer to choose which businesses I go to without the hard-sell. There is the Casa Del Habano (official Cuban cigar store), which is a good place for a smoke and has an awesome owner/manager. I like the bar and restaurant at the Hotel Nelson, too, with good food and drink. Tijuana has a lot going for it, but I would recommend walking down the parallel Avenidas Constitucion or Madero unless you have a specific place you\'re going.

171568060.name: Street like a street.
171568060.author: a TripAdvisor user
171568060.reviewBody: Nicer that other streets of Tijuana, but in my opinion nothig special. There are many above average shops and restaurants. If you are in Tijuana, that is the street you should see.

170137708.name: Crossing the border from Tijuana to US
170137708.author: a TripAdvisor user
170137708.reviewBody: I read a lot of websites about border crossing waits from Tijuana to US; consensus was less than 1 hour if going by foot. We went to Tijuana on a Monday and decided to head back @ 1PM. It took us until 5 PM to get across. I don\'t know if something unusual was going on (holiday etc). It was definitely not worth the trip. There\'s nothing on the main drag but farmacias, junk shops and cheesy restaurants.

170058139.name: Shopping, restaurants, etc. it has it all
170058139.author: a TripAdvisor user
170058139.reviewBody: Revolution avenue was revamped a few years ago and now it\'s one of the safest places in Tijuana. If you love the night life then this is the place to be thanks to its many night clubs. Leaving Tijuana? Then come and get a few souvenirs just beware that some people may try to sell fake jewelry, it\'s better to buy at one of the establishments.

169815217.name: Tijuana makes me hungry!!!
169815217.author: a TripAdvisor user
169815217.reviewBody: Tijuana, just  10 minutes down south from San Diego, has a lot to ofer, both cultural and gastronomical, no wonder people like Anthony Bourdain or Andrew Zimern have traveled several times to this magnificent city. From gourmet restaurants like Mision 19 from chef Javier Plasencia or El Taller from chef Miguel Angel Guerrero, you cand find good meals for all budgets. Tijuana is a very safe city, also you can visit the Tijuana Cultural Center with its onmi max complex, several shoping centers where you can find good deals, have a nice glass of local Valle de Guadalupe wines, or taste some tequila wich I recomend served chilled. Don\'t think twice, Tijuana will make you happy and satisfy any pallate!!!!

169752003.name: Ave Revoluci\u00f3n
169752003.author: a TripAdvisor user
169752003.reviewBody: You will visit OLD TIJUANA, where visitors would find such things as were prohibited in the USA during the 20\'s. From 1st through 6th streets there have been new business and more activity. You will find mexican folk art and souvenirs.Specially recomended is CAESARS Restaurant (Revolution and 5th) with fine dining and lots of photographs from the 20\'s through the 50\'s.

169721119.name: Nothing much to see here folks, please move along
169721119.author: a TripAdvisor user
169721119.reviewBody: There\'s no denying this is a very colorful and lively street, but today it is just a partial shell of what it once was.  Numerous businesses are closed, due to the danger present in this city.  If you like getting asked every 10 feet to come in and buy, or to "see a show", then by all means have fun and enjoy.  If you just want to explore in peace, well your in for disappointment.

169693582.name: Tourist Zone Tijuana, Mexco
169693582.author: a TripAdvisor user
169693582.reviewBody: We live in Rosarito Beach and go to Tijuana several times a month.  Great Shoppng, Dining and just looking around.  We have always felt safe and the dining is fantastic.

168787948.name: Border Crossing Line to U.S. is Long!!!
168787948.author: a TripAdvisor user
168787948.reviewBody: We went to Tijuana on a Sunday. We didn\'t feel unsafe and got a very good meal. Getting inside Mexico was very easy from San Diego (we took the Trolley and walked across the border). Getting back to the US, however, took hours! If you walk across the border, it seemed like you have two options: (1) stand in line for hours, or (2) pay 6$ to sit in a van or bus that eventually drops you off at Customs to a much shorter line. We did option 2 and it was well worth the $6. Make sure you plan your time accordingly. If we ever go back (not sure if it\'s worth it) we would go with a tour bus from San Diego - you would see a lot more and probably cross the border much faster.

167147956.name: Hated it
167147956.author: a TripAdvisor user
167147956.reviewBody: I couldn\'t believe how sleazy Tijuana was. I knew it was going to be a bit \'different\' but I certainly didn\'t expect the overall sleaziness that seemed to permeate the avenue. From the moment I walked over the border and asked a security guard for directions until the time I crossed back over the border I was asked if I wanted to score drugs. It started with the security guard who then seemed to announce by mobile to other shopkeepers and various street people that another likely "suspect" was around. People that I hadn\'t even spoken to previously knew I was Australian and kept yelling \'Hey Aussie, wanna buy.........!!!\' It was hard to get rid of some of the street sellers as they follow you around and keep hassling you. I didn\'t want to be rude as I was just a visitor on their territory. I managed to find a nice little restaurant that had 3 women who couldn\'t speak English working there. They were lovely and definitely not part of all the crap going on in the street and the food was great too. I did get some good bargains however, jewellry and a lovely rug. I couldn\'t wait to get out of there and I will never bother again. It\'s a shame because there were some really nice, genuine shopkeepers who liked a bit of a chat and weren\'t trying to shove their goods or drugs down your throat. There was some nice architecture but you\'re not left alone to explore it.

165593436.name: Is this the best street in the world?
165593436.author: a TripAdvisor user
165593436.reviewBody: We came to Tijuana full of expectation because in Mexico...anything goes. We had a nice walk around and decided to stop at a nice restaurant Margaritas Village. Our waiter Lucas was the best, he gave us a good deal on beer and food and then the party really got started despite it only being 12pm. \n\nThe best tip Lucas gave us was "Check out the club 2 blocks down called Hong Kong" and I finish this review with the same tip.

165219260.name: Vibrant but dirty
165219260.author: a TripAdvisor user
165219260.reviewBody: All the "beachside" touristy shops - towels, jingles, shot glasses, etc. Run down clubs and bars which look vibrant at night and tired during the day. Think Bourbon street.  Some side streets showcase that special guest for your evening ;) You can imagine this being an adventure for more sheltered day trippers across the border, but not worth it for professionals or the cultured traveler.

164720058.name: Not so great anymore
164720058.author: a TripAdvisor user
164720058.reviewBody: I lived in San Diego for a while and was able to go down to Revolucion multiple times.  I think all the tourism is just turning this place into a bad location, people go there and do what they can\'t do at home, drink, drugs, etc.  It\'s ok to walk around in the daytime but not so much at night anymore.

162684972.name: I wish I had more time to spend....
162684972.author: a TripAdvisor user
162684972.reviewBody: We visited on our last day in Tijuana so we only spent about an hour there. On my next trip I will be spending more time. Then shops we visited were nice and decent prices and always ready to barter.

161629763.name: Shopping extravaganza
161629763.author: a TripAdvisor user
161629763.reviewBody: Just what you would imagine shopping in Tijuana would be like.  Be prepared to barter and say no...LOL

160737358.name: i love this place
160737358.author: a TripAdvisor user
160737358.reviewBody: you find all kinds of people in la revu i went to this place with my boyfriend and i saw some mariachi which i love and they played us a song named "si nos dejan" i love the shop etc. \n

159101890.name: Teh Folk side of a border town
159101890.author: a TripAdvisor user
159101890.reviewBody: A typical one-dollar beer for a peep show across the border. Kind of sordid but fun if you are not totally aware that your dollars are on the run. Too much alcohol and noise but fun if you keep eyes wide open.

159067273.name: Love that Salad that,s where it started
159067273.author: a TripAdvisor user
159067273.reviewBody: I eat and party at Ceasars every chance I get also do doctors and dentists as well as shop it,s always fun

158025941.name: Used to be a lot more
158025941.author: a TripAdvisor user
158025941.reviewBody: Compared to five years ago when the economy collapsed, this place is ghost town now. There are still a few discoteques and seedy strip bars.  There are some nice shops still with artisans and beautiful silver from Mexico.  It is worth a stop but not much more.

157367016.name: Typical Tourist Trap
157367016.author: a TripAdvisor user
157367016.reviewBody: If souvenirs is what you seek this is the place for you. The stores have all the typical stuff for the tourist trade. Lots of bars and restaurants to choose form. During the day tourist friendly. At night young crowd hang out.

156823289.name: The Avenida ain\'t what it used to be!!
156823289.author: a TripAdvisor user
156823289.reviewBody: This was our first visit to TJ in over 2 years (the shootings and problems scared us and many others away.)  We were supposed to take the Red Bus and went to the parking lot where they leave from on the U.S. side.  Instead we were put in a white van that cost more (not a lot more) which we learned when we arrived at the drop off in TJ on Avenida Revolucion at the corner of the 6th Avenue and La Revolucion.  We immediately noticed almost all (if not all) of the upstairs restaurants and clubs are now vacant and run down.  As we walked along the street we were acosted by every merchant and restaurant all the way down to the Arch (looks like the St. Louis arch) where we turned left into a shopping district.  This section of TJ seemed less aggressive and the meals were cheaper as were the beers and other drinks.  Still I would say that you are better off eating at Tapa Tia\'s in Imperial Beach because the food is better and you don\'t have to be mugged by every merchant in town.  Also we noticed that very few white folks were on the Avenida still.  We didn\'t feel threatened but just were cautious (and we have travelled all over the world.)  We had to get a time (can\'t just walk up and buy a ticket to go back to San Diego on the vans) and ended up waiting two hours for the next van.  Then it took about 2 hours to get across the border.  This was a Saturday but still it was a miserable trip for very little fun.  The shops all have the same purses, belts, blankets etc. so it is really quite boring now.  Without the night life (I would never go to TJ at night until I had reason to believe it was much more recovered than it is now.)  All in all I think it is a good idea to stay in San Diego and not go through the hassle.  There are other crossings into TJ and Mexico but my question is why go?  If you are going further into Mexico maybe, but as for a day trip it really is a mess.

154919157.name: DEAD. PEOPLE HARASSING YOU FOR A BUCK.
154919157.author: a TripAdvisor user
154919157.reviewBody: Ok if you like to be hassled to come into a store then come here, the economy fell out of here long ago, and whats left is a few places with ok deals really wanting to make a sale. I personally enjoy it a little, but I like to stay near the artesianien market and away from this street. Once I was pushing my son in a stroller and a man from a bar said, "Come on in lady and have a drink! Free babysitting!" lol.

154757596.name: What a dump
154757596.author: a TripAdvisor user
154757596.reviewBody: I was visiting San Diego for the first time with family and we decided to take a mini day trip to Tijuana since we have never been to Mexico before. We parked in San Ysidro and walked over the border. Walking to Avenida Revolucion is easy to find but it was a waste of time. The place is a complete dump and we were bothered non stop by people coming up to us trying to sell us garbage. We stopped in one bar and got $1 Coronas but inside we were also bothered over and over with people trying to sell us stuff. We then had to wait in line at the border for two and a half hours just to walk back across to the USA.  We were very sorry for wasting a beautiful sunny day in San Diego.

153623926.name: What Can I Say About This Place?
153623926.author: a TripAdvisor user
153623926.reviewBody: I loved the fact there is so much to see in this place! There is a little of everything and for everyone. This place is phenomenal not to say more! The night life is indeed great and during the morning hours it\u2019s just as amazing. This place has always something going on but I also recommend 6th street! J\n

152312670.name: TOTALLY CHANGED FOR THE BETTER
152312670.author: a TripAdvisor user
152312670.reviewBody: I remember the old revo, where you could hardly walk without getting jumped by everyone to come in and see the sex shows, well now it is cleaned up where you can walk dignified with your family

151689002.name: TJ is always fun!
151689002.author: a TripAdvisor user
151689002.reviewBody: Love the street tacos and empanadas de pina from the bakery.  It\'s so fun when your waiting at the light, and someone pops up with fresh Churros at your car!   I DON\'T like when they try to clean your car windows while you are at that same light! lol One of my other favorite things to do is cruise to the beach and have ice cream!!  It\'s very close to the Bull ring and that ice cream is heavenly!!!   My dad likes the cheap prices the dentists offer there! lol  I also like to buy my reading glasses there at El Rio de Tijuana

146592658.name: viator tour to tijuana from los angeles
146592658.author: a TripAdvisor user
146592658.reviewBody: this was a tour that i did without my better half as she had heard it was not safe. - went by myself - if you can go past the \' have a look in my store\' it was not too bad - don\'t buy cuban cigars and try and take them back into the USA as they are illegal. and of course the pimps  were around but accept the note that i am in a relationship and would not partake. is a very safe place to go around. and of course the 1 hour wait to get back into the USA as the customs is very secure

146351106.name: So close and so far from the US
146351106.author: a TripAdvisor user
146351106.reviewBody: During a stay in the US, I was even in San Diego, close to the border with Mexico. Then I decided to cross the border and reach the closer mexican city in "Baja California": Tijuana. It was a fast trip but, anyway, really interesting. Particularly, thanks to this visit, I realized how, sometimes, Politics can affect people and change the destiny. Few kilometers of distance from US, but a huge difference in terms of culture. In my opinion it was a nice trip to get a general idea of Mexico but, obviously, if you want to get a deeper knowledge of this amazing country, you should plan a longer stay.

145384626.name: Sadly, it has seen its better days, except for the Fri.  Sat. night 18 to 25 yr. old disco travelers.
145384626.author: a TripAdvisor user
145384626.reviewBody: Afternoon walk can be enjoyable towards the Sanborn\'s Rest. area. Disliked? Well, the Mexicans are super friendly, but my fellow Americans tend to be a bit\nlound and wild.  But then where else can the 18 to 21 yr. olds enjoy Corona, Dos XX, disco dancing....all legally?

145030520.name: It\'s not what it used to be, but still great place to walk and have a drink
145030520.author: a TripAdvisor user
145030520.reviewBody: oh by the way i live in tijuana son i know about it, i pass tru it like 2 o 3 times a week, and don\'t forget the cesar salad.. the place where all begain... tijuana 6th and revolucion

143579797.name: Challenging but interesting
143579797.author: a TripAdvisor user
143579797.reviewBody: Tijuana and Revolution Avenue are apparently going through a financial crisis and they have lost lots of tourism and businesses in recent years.  As a result, it is worthwhile to go there with the understanding that the locals are not "pushy", but desparate for the tourist dollar. It can feel a little overwhelming in that respect, however all the people I spoke to were very nice.  In addition, it\'s probably not a bad idea to go there with the intention of making a contribution to the economy, rather than bartering for the absolute lowest prices.  Afterall, if you eat at a restaurant, drink at the bar or buy food at a store in Tijuana, it will be way below what you are used to paying. Overall, colourful scenery, vastly different to the US (which is within walking distance!) and a real experience.  I will never forget it.

141076214.name: Getting to know Tijuana
141076214.author: a TripAdvisor user
141076214.reviewBody: Loved the local arts and crafts. I Bought a chair-hammock not expensive at all (18 bucks) and I love it.

140997066.name: Where is everyone?
140997066.author: a TripAdvisor user
140997066.reviewBody: I hadn\'t been to TJ in over 20 years. So as I strolled to what I assumed is to be their version of a Hollywood or downtown LA. I was surprised to not see very many people out and about since it so close to the border. I literally only spent 1 hour there. Lots of shops where closed. But it was a fun experienced since I had travel further into Baja California. This was the last stop before home. I would say shop for the goods right before you cross the bridge. So much arts and crafts. And lot of negation to get your business.

140890158.name: A real tourist trap
140890158.author: a TripAdvisor user
140890158.reviewBody: Shopping was a nightmare - shop keepers trying to get us in their shops / trying to charge the most they can as we are tourists - not taking no for an answer - filthy toilets at the restaurant we went to ( food was excellent) really was a suffocating experience and not at all enjoyable !

137797434.name: great place
137797434.author: a TripAdvisor user
137797434.reviewBody: Great place to shop fun haggeling with the locals you can get some great deals. Good food and entertainment

136940433.name: Busiest street in Tijuana
136940433.author: a TripAdvisor user
136940433.reviewBody: Vendors are relentless....if you are smart and can be assertive, but polite...you will be okay.  I would not recommend this area if you are a single female traveling by yourself.  I would say it is an interesting place.  But be careful..typical tourist trap.  You can have fun...but be cautious here.

136554042.name: Avoid This Place
136554042.author: a TripAdvisor user
136554042.reviewBody: I have family in Tijuana and go there often. Years ago I would recommend this street to anyone but now it\'s not worth it unless you are visiting San Diego and just want to say you came to Mexico. It\'s close to the border. All jewelry sold at the shops is fake. The waiters at some clubs will rob you if you are drunk or "forget" to bring change. If you walk around late at night there is a chance a cop will stop and search you and ask for a bribe or get robbed. If you must party, Las Pulgas or the bars on 6th street are ok and much cheaper than the US bars, plus they close at 4-6 AM on weekends. I gave this place 2 stars because there is some value with a selection of food and cheap souvenirs if you haggle. Tijuana doesn\'t have much to offer a tourist unless you are looking for some sleazy fun. In that case go to Coahuila street, it\'s much funner than Revolucion and crazier than Vegas. There\'s guys from Vegas that party there every week. Remember though, Tijuana is full of thugs which includes the police.

136018302.name: Tourists only, but hey it\'s a tourist town.
136018302.author: a TripAdvisor user
136018302.reviewBody: Haggle,  haggle , haggle, bargains to be had, ideal presents etc don\'t expect top drawer clothing, cheap medicines from local pharmacies, large supermarket just off st good for alcohol bargains

134859234.name: All American Avenue
134859234.author: a TripAdvisor user
134859234.reviewBody: Burger King, Walgreens and other familiar names are to be found.

132881002.name: A Bit Frustrating
132881002.author: a TripAdvisor user
132881002.reviewBody:
Took a taxi from the cultural center to Avenida Revolucion. It was a hot day, and I was with my two teenage children who had never been to the west coast. I decided to take them to Tijuana (so they could go back home and tell their friends they had been to Mexico), although I know TJ is not a representation of what Mexico is really like.

This street is lined with shops, shops, restaurants, bars, pharmacies, shops, restaurants, bars, pharmacies. Did I forget to mention that it has a lot of shops? We couldn't walk in peace because every owner, along with their wives/husbands, children, in-laws, and everybody else were hounding us, almost forcing us into their shops to buy things we had no use for or didn't care for.
At one point I left my 16 year-old daughter a couple of steps behind me and when I looked back I was shocked to see that a vendor, who apparently was selling silver trinkets, had actually put handcuffs on her! She was calling out to me, but because of all the street noise I couldn't hear her. I immediately told him to take them off and I, and my kids made a beeline to a taxi to get back to the border and cross over the the U.S. side. She told me that he was hounding her for her to buy his wares and put the handcuffs on her so she could see. These people really, really don't take no for an answer. My son was extremely annoyed and couldn't wait to go back to the hotel in San Diego.

This place is very busy, and there are a lot of beggars in the street. A young girl with a toddler boy approached me asking for money. I asked her what she needed to money for, and she told me she needed it to feed her baby. She was dirty, her clothes were dirty and her hair was matted. I took her to KFC so she could buy whatever she wanted for her and her child. I don't give money at all...ever. This young girl told me she wasn't going to eat in the restaurant because her son didn't like to eat in public which I found so very odd. She wouldn't look me in the face at all, and seemed to be nervous and in a rush. I helped her with her son and once she got her food she was gonna walk away without saying anything to me. I held her back and told her to look me in the face. She wasn't able to really and I knew she had something else in her mind. She didn't want to be bothered with what I was telling her.

As we parted ways, I store guard stopped me and told me about the girl. Everybody knows who she is and she has a guy who sends her out on the street to beg and takes all of her money. She uses her son as a catch. I spoke to the guard about my personal beliefs. He told me she was going to sell the food, and I asked him who would buy food from her not knowing what's actually in the food.

Five minutes later, my son saw the same girl, with her son, but no KFC bag. The boy only had a small cup of soda from KFC. What happened to all the food I bought for her? My son keeps telling me that she sold it. If she did or not, that's her problem, but it kinda saddened me to see this girl in that predicament.

Moral of this story...don't get sucked into paying $20 for a meal for a beggar in the street. Next time, I'll make sure the person eats it in front of me, or at least some of it.

I think I'm done with Tijuana, and I don't think I'll be returning ever again, and if I do, I'll make sure not to stroll down Avenida Revolucion.

130907648.name: good shopping for tourists
130907648.author: a TripAdvisor user
130907648.reviewBody: The day trip to Tijuana is a good mix of fun, shopping & adventure. There a lot of "pharmacies" that will sell you the usual meds without prescription & I loved the snake skin boots but there was no way Mr Customs was going to let me back into Australia with them. That is one thing to remember when you get carried away with the moment of shopping, that most things can come back into the USA but not so into Australia

129953525.name: This place changed so much
129953525.author: a TripAdvisor user
129953525.reviewBody: This place used to be a great family place when I was younger, now I would not recommend leaving revolucion street and I would not recommend going out at night.

129382041.name: Nice Walk
129382041.author: a TripAdvisor user
129382041.reviewBody: Not as busy as it use to be, but a good place to stroll, grab a bite to eat and watch the busy life of Tijuana go on around you.

128495165.name: Calle Revolucion
128495165.author: a TripAdvisor user
128495165.reviewBody: We only drove through the street, we didn\'t actually walk the street.  It looked ok but nothing like it was in its heyday!

128092463.name: tijuana tourist centre
128092463.author: a TripAdvisor user
128092463.reviewBody: please visit ceturmex before you go shopping and ask for the outstanding host list. its ran by baja tourism and they will go out of their way to help you, wonderful service and the people at the shops listed are great. we had a great time  in tijuana and are looking at visiting again in the near future

127382679.name: Dirty, leather and purses ALL fake - dont be fooled by the "lighter trick"
127382679.author: a TripAdvisor user
127382679.reviewBody: leather and "brand name" purses ALL fake - don\'t be fooled by the "lighter trick". Good deals on kids dresses, but make sure to bargain low and be ready to walk away.

126122448.name: No es el mismo lugar de hace anios!
126122448.author: a TripAdvisor user
126122448.reviewBody: I love Tijuana since I live here on 2001... and Avenida Revoluci\u00f3n was a good place to walk, drink some beers and have some fun... but since a few years ago and the called "war against cartels"from our President.. the place started to going down due to the fact the tourism was dramatically reduced.

126019594.name: Nights like these are not common where i\'m from.
126019594.author: a TripAdvisor user
126019594.reviewBody: To be honest I would not recommend this place to just about anyone. Walking trough this area made it clear that Las Vegas is far from being sin city.  This are of course could be a lot of fun if you take precautions like being with a group. I don\'t see myself returning soon but I cant say I did not have a great time  \n\nThis is for people looking for clubs and mainly a place to party.

126018883.name: algo diferente
126018883.author: a TripAdvisor user
126018883.reviewBody: great place to walk around during the day , at night would just hang around 6 and revolucion great clubs

125972735.name: NOT representative of Tijuana
125972735.author: a TripAdvisor user
125972735.reviewBody: Stay away.  Even if you are walking or driving in for the day, there a lot better places to go and only a 50 pesos ($4US) taxi ride away (see my TJ reviews).  This is not Tijuana.  Going here is like flying to Paris France and just visiting the airport.  Lot of touts chasing you down with menus, tourist souvenir shops, bad food, college drunks, thieves looking for easy prey, stay away.

125595748.name: Fun simple fun!!
125595748.author: a TripAdvisor user
125595748.reviewBody: do not miss this town!!! fun, good food, late night fun

124721246.name: party
124721246.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721246.reviewBody: you will feel at home (too many gringous), a nice place to party and drink

124645799.name: Stay away.
124645799.author: a TripAdvisor user
124645799.reviewBody: This is not Tijuana; this is not Mexico. Avoid Avenida Revolucion unless you like to be constantly assaulted by children selling cheap trinkets, vendors harassing you to come in their stores to buy more cheap trinkets, and waiters waving menus in your face from their overpriced restaurants serving bland, stereotypical food.

123471932.name: Touristy walkway
123471932.author: a TripAdvisor user
123471932.reviewBody: Lots of souvenir stores and over priced liquor stores, if in TJ you should go to get reference when you go to other areas.

122646378.name: Wow what a day
122646378.author: a TripAdvisor user
122646378.reviewBody: We spent the day drinking and shopping here and it was brilliant. We felt safe and enjoyed the whole time. You get free tequila just to look in some stores and the bargaining is fun. Paid $20 for a watch that they wanted $400 for. Don\'t get scammed.

122491373.name: What a scam!
122491373.author: a TripAdvisor user
122491373.reviewBody: We went shopping down this street on a day trip from San Diego.  The sales people were very pushy and once you get into their store it is hard to leave without buying something.  They don\'t take NO for an answer.  Be very wary of what you are buying, they say things like "I made this just for you" and "my turn."  And the prices are not really that great, you are not getting a deal. If you take a bus tour from San Diego beware that the bus driver has his own agenda.  We saw our bus drive take a cut from the one of the Silver Jewelry shops that he was praising on the ride down there.

122435842.name: Salespeople weren\'t as pushy as in Cancun
122435842.author: a TripAdvisor user
122435842.reviewBody: We did a tour of a block of shops here and all the sales people were lovely and respectful. I had experienced the chaos of markets in Cancun and expected to be pushed around. These folks really liked to make a deal and it was actually fun to barter with them.

121683611.name: great night clubs and more
121683611.author: a TripAdvisor user
121683611.reviewBody: it is a great street on weekends if you like to bar hop or go to the diffrent clubs there are also about 10 glbt clubs on or near revolucion for more info on glbt clubs in tijuana you can go to baja advisor.com other then that there are all kinds of great clubs for every one on 6th street alone there are over  20 great clubs lounges live music jazz rock and roll top 40 you name it its down here.one last note the drinking age down here is 18 so there are many young people all the way up to no joke people in there 60-70-s etc.just a very fun place to be

120557990.name: Saturday night
120557990.author: a TripAdvisor user
120557990.reviewBody: Just grab a beer in a bar and take a look at people walking by. There is a lot of interesting urban art (i.e. paintings in walls, etc. etc) to look out for.

120346317.name: Lots of Fun
120346317.author: a TripAdvisor user
120346317.reviewBody: We had lots of fun bargaining with the shopkeepers. Beware they will try to do anything to get you in their store! :-)

116861828.name: scary as we were the only Americans on the street
116861828.author: a TripAdvisor user
116861828.reviewBody: We recently traveled to Avenida Revolucion in Tijuana.  We took a shuttle bus that left us off at a bus station on the Street.  The shuttle was very clean and nice.  It was tough though as we were the ONLY Americans on the Street.  It was interesting to see the street vendors and we were able to buy some jewelry, Mexican blankets and dolls.  We did go into a grocery store which was interesting as they had raw chickens just out in a bin (no ice)for sale.  We did purchase some Liquor for a good price.  It was definitely an interesting few hours.  We only stayed for about 2 hours.  My kids were very nervous.  Basically, you walk up and down the street and there are men begging you to buy from them.  We actually had a man follow us up and down the street asking me to purchase jewelry.  We took the shuttle bus back to the Border area but they had to let us off and we had to walk over the border as there was way too much traffic.  I would not recommend going to Tijuana.  Scary!

64399346.name: Fun Few Hours in Mexico!
64399346.author: a TripAdvisor user
64399346.reviewBody:
I recently took a very short trip to San Diego and figured I couldn't pass up the opportunity to spend a morning in Mexico.  I decided to take a bus tour which turned out to work in my favor because the guide dropped us off in the middle of Avenida Revolucion, gave us some shopping and other tips and apparently crossing the border back into the US is quicker if you are part of a bus tour.

The shopkeepers are indeed very pushy, they keep an eye on you, watching what stores you do go in, so they can ask why you went into that store but can't come into into theirs?  The best action is really just to smile and keep walking because saying no thanks really doesn't help and seems to be more of a conversation starter, whereas if you don't speak up at all and just keep walking, they seem to get the hint quicker.  Some shopkeepers try to step in your way to try and usher you in, while others come up to you while you are waiting to cross the street with an armful of necklaces for you to look at, so it's best to be aware of what's going on around you at all times.  

Despite the abrasive sales tactics, many of the local people are very polite and will trip over themselves to be nice to you when you actually are interested in buying something.  I befriended a woman on the bus tour who walked around with me and she was a master at negotiating prices, which is a MUST.  If you reject the first price you can usually get them to accept sometimes half or less of what they originally wanted.  

There is a shop on the main strip of Avenida Revolucion called Hand Art that is really worth looking for, it showcases a lot of homemade table cloths, table runners and place mats that are out of this world.  There is a group of stores along the street that are a part of Tijuana's "Outstanding Hosts" which highlights some of the best shops for tourists. 

I was somewhat apprehensive about going to Mexico alone but I'm very happy I made the trip to go shopping on Revolucion.  The meal I had there for lunch (at La Placita) was one of the best things I've ever eaten, not to mention the tequila shop that gives out free samples! All in all it's just a wonderful, cultural experience.

39385547.name: A day in La Avenida Revolucion
39385547.author: a TripAdvisor user
39385547.reviewBody:
We had a very fun day in Tijuana.  The city is very safe at least by day we could see police officers all around.

We started in Avenida Revolucion where you can find amazing Mexican Hand Made goods at great prices. The only negative thing i can say is that the vendors are do not leave you alone and try to get you to buy something even if you say no thank you.  There are some really nice shops that do not have people outside yelling at you to go in and those are the ones that we went in and purchased many lovely items.

For food i recommend you hop in a taxi and go for the newer parts of Tijuana like Zona Rio where you can find extremely good food at very nice restaurants and they even have an IMAX at their cultural center and a great mall called Plaza Rio with a very elegant cinema where I got to watch "the hangover" while only paying 45 pesos which is about 3.50 in this great big air conditioned room that had big leather seats! WOW

14648431.name: A great culture experience, but somewhat repetitive..
14648431.author: a TripAdvisor user
14648431.reviewBody: My friend and I went down there to shop and eat..The food was wonderful and the drinks were awesome, but I have to say I was disappointed in the shopping. Every shop has the same stuff. You first get there and think everything is unique and then you see the same thing over and over. Don\'t get me wrong, Tijuana is something to see, but don\'t expect a lot of exotic shopping. Also, it\'s not a good place to go if you don\'t like high pressure sales situations and cat calls. If you can ignore that kind of thing, you will be fine. They play on your insecurities. I don\'t want this to sound like a bad review though because we did have a lot of fun just walking around and experiencing the culture.

5532664.name: What a Frenzy
5532664.author: a TripAdvisor user
5532664.reviewBody:
Wow. 

Outside of the floor of a stock exchange, Revolution Avenue is the most frenetic place I have ever seen. Never before have so many people tried to get my attention at the same time. More than once, my friends and I were yelled at from across the street by hawkers trying to get us into their restaurant or strip joint ("Guys! Guys! Over here!"). 

I almost expected them to charge across the street, and drag us over. 

The poverty of Tijuana was sad, with the stray dogs seeking shade, "Tijuana Zebras" baking in the sun (all had food and water), but I don't regret the few hours I spent across the border (I stayed in Chula Vista, CA). 

All in all, however, it was astounding at how different two places can be despite being just a few miles apart (i.e. San Diego and Tijuana).

2308129.name: Americanized
2308129.author: a TripAdvisor user
2308129.reviewBody: I went to Tijuana one afternoon last summer. Having been there for the first time two years prior, I could not believed how cleaned up the touristy area of Tijuana was. We had dinner at TGI Fridays, with 80\'s pop music in the background. Some of the seedier shops and bars also seemed to have closed down, replaced by American fast food restaurants. Far fewer people trying to lure us (two women) into upstairs bars (especially considering it was getting dark out, while our last trip was in early afternoon), and we saw many cops patroling the newly paved sidewalks. Another consequence of the Tijuana clean-up was the prices: goods generally seemed higher priced than last time (although still cheap by US standards).\n

1724105.name: Two hours is enough
1724105.author: a TripAdvisor user
1724105.reviewBody: I was on a business trip to San Diego a few weeks ago and took a half day tour "down mexico way" You can take full and half day tours to Tijuana. The half day tour gives you around two hours to "explore" on your own. You are left to wonder the main street with teh shops and seedy bars and hotels. It is an experience but the two hours is long enough. Dont be surprised by the barage of people trying to get you into their shops and bars. Some may find the whole experience unsettling having crossed the boarder from the afluence of California to the poverty and mayhiem of Mexico

428155.name: General Tips/Observations
428155.author: a TripAdvisor user
428155.reviewBody:
The typical tourist parks on the US side of the border and walks across.  After passing through a clangy metal revolving gate, you'll find yourself in the customs area.   At this point, you'll need to decide whether to walk or cab it to "la revol".  The cab ride is universally $5 no matter how many passengers (they will squeeze your entire party into one cab), no tip needed.  Walking to "la revol" is free and should take you about 15-20 minutes, even though you'll be told it takes much longer by the cab hawkers.

Walking is safe during the daytime, but only suggested at nighttime for groups of 4 or more (males helpful).  Walking is a great idea because along the way you'll pass many a vendor of the souveniers you are probably interested in--start browsing and see what prices you are offered.  Believe it or not, about every third or fourth store should have a near duplicate of something you're interested in.

The best way to bargain:  if you really want something, express casual interest in the item and ask how much it costs.  You'll be highballed a price, or you'll be asked what you want to pay (best response here:  "I'm not sure if I want to buy it").  Thank the shopkeeper and slowly walk towards the exit.   9 times out of 10, the price will decrease at this point or you will be asked "make me an offer" (use same response above).  Continue (slowly) to leave the store.  The process may continue a few times, up to the point where you have actually exited the store.  If you are not followed up to about two stores away from the store, the last price offered is the "going rate" at this store.   Now you just need to repeat the same spiel again at 2-3 more stores to get the "going rate" there, and you'll have a rough idea of what the item you're interested in might sell for that particular day.  There are some department stores on the revol--if an item has a price tag on it and/or you see a cash register and can pay with credit card, then bargaining is most likely inappropriate.
